Bruh don't be pulling my heartstrings like that DX... Devs have now created what is now my favorite game replacing a long favorite in the Fallout Series I have not felt this way about a game since I beat Diablo 3 almost 6 years ago. Please play this game it is worth every gut wrenching second!

This game is amazing. The graphics are stunning, even when running on medium-low graphics. The voice acting is great. The story and characters are fantastic. Also, the gameplay is both kind of challenging and very fun. Would recommend it to anyone that's looking for a great game. Prepare to be hooked.

This game is the best graphical game I’ve played on pcvr only just got a new laptop to play it when I saw it ages ago I wanted it but won’t play on quest only pcvr so bit miffed but not now just finished it last night and going to get next instalment the interaction is great story great thanks to peeps that made it hope you can do more games like this halo ,aliens , gears of war lol keep the good work up ready at dawn 👏👏👏👏👏👏👏

Outside the base, the game keeps crashing seconds or minutes after the world loading. I search the web to find a solution and a lot of people with recent cards has the same problem. But there's no known solution so don't buy this game if you have a recent rig.
My rig:
AMD Ryzen 5 5600X
RTX 2080Ti
Oculus Rift CV1

Gameplay is good. Sometimes felt a bit bored to certain game mechanics. Puzzle and navigation are the main elements where this game focuses on. Story and characters are very interesting. 

Some bugs related to the start of the session. Sometimes starting a new session causes the game to crash when doing certain action:
- Solution is to reset the character by killing it

This game is by far my favorite VR title. The story is engaging, the dialogue is witty but not campy, the mechanic and movement make for a pace that constantly felt personally adjusted to my needs. I recommend air-linking and playing from a spinny office chair for maximum immersion. (It helped with the floaty feeling) I can't wait to start the second one.

This game is the best VR game I have ever played, and I have quite a large library, but on top of that it is also the best story game I have played on any platform. My pc is pretty garbage, but with finely dialed graphic settings this was running at good fps and decent graphics, I will replay this after upgrading my pc and will  play Lone Echo II only after upgrading. This also makes me respect the multiplayer spinoff even more.
So I played it on the Quest 2 and it was amazing even if the audio didn´t work at all convos but I never had to quit the game because it fixt it self in the next one

I first played this game at my university where they had a VR lab for students to try out. This game was on there and I had so much fun, but wished I had an Oculus of my own to really fully take my time and explore everything! A year or two later, I finally saved up for an Oculus and this was the first game I got when I got my headset! Amazing and immersive and the story was really good for such a short game! Also everything Troy Baker is in always seems to turn out amazing, though I was surprised to see his name in the credits! I knew I had recognized Jack's voice but due to his "robot" voice I couldn't place it until the end. Love this game to bits and you really get invested in the story, especially the relationship between Jack and Liv! 10/10 would recommend!

Have never been able to get this singular game out of all of my purchases to run. Have tried using the alternate save files, got past previous points, but always after about 15-30 mins it crashes. Both in airlink and virtual desktop. Uninstalled for the final time, played through the start so many times that the game has lost all allure for me. Too late to get a refund and wont be buying the sequel.

review_title: best vr game ive ever played
one_reviews_text: i got this game a while ago but never wrote a review on it, this is the best vr title i've ever played. amazing gameplay, the emotion some of the game conveys is so good you'd think i was exaggerating if i descrbied it. when i had finished this game, i was in awe. 10/10

It's the best game there is on the Meta Quest in my opinion. Also for the second part Lone Echo 2.
Great storytelling, beautiful graphics.
The controls are magnificent, it feels very natural.
In space no one can here you scream

review_title: Best VR game I've played yet
one_reviews_text:
I'll admit I haven't played Half Life Alyx yet, and wanted to play this before Lone Echo 2. Running with a RTX 2070 and a crappy router which caused the odd stutter and I had to dumb down graphics a bit to smooth it out, was worth playing it wirelessly. I can't imagine playing this any other way except spinning around in an office chair while you float about. 

No motion sickness for me with the zero g. It was a pleasant surprise actually how natural the environment felt. Amazing quality and I believe the game is 4 years old now so just wow. 

Don't even think about it. Wait for a sale if you like. I usually do but from the reviews I paid full price for this and do not regret a cent.

Definitely going to get a better router when I buy and attempt to play Lone Echo 2. Would love to do wireless again. But I do not want to sacrifice graphics too much so if the new router doesn't improve things enough, I'll finally setup a ceiling rig for my link cable. Don't plan on a GPU upgrade any time soon. Just need to be able to spin spin spin 360 degrees to play this game right.
Lone Echo is really the best VR game I've experienced. The controls are super smooth and the story is really indescribably beautiful. Don't hesitate, just play! you won't regret it!

review_title: the first title on my quest 2!!
one_reviews_text: omg! an amazing VR experience, i spent about 7.5 hours to finish the game. i wish the story to be longer.  good story. don't worry if you stuck in the game, it is not due to you were not smart enough to play it, there are some areas which are still buggy, beware of where is your last check point. i guess it is best you complete the game without resuming. some actions can even crash the game. luckily i managed to complete it. suggest to get this. it lives up to the expectation!

Love this game. Appreciate the way the devs implemented the game mechanics, mostly everything is very intuitive. The scale of the ship is great. The story is adequate in lenght and I felt well thought out and paced. Visually it was a pleasure to be "in game". Recommended.

Lone Echo is by far the best story driven space game that any Oculus owner with a little intrest in science-fiction games/movies should own.
Great story, great graphics, great controls.
Great story and game play, had some challeges with some of the task but overall went fairly smooth.  Now I'm excited to see what Olivia and Jack are up to in Lone Echo 2.
Hello(:

This game although  4 years old on Oculus Quest 2 with airlink is absoltutely stunning and beautiful. I own more than 70 VR Games, but this one takes 1st place with HL Alx. The feeling of being in space is incredible, the reaction of the thrusters, the story, the gameplay mechanics and atmopshere... I am blown away. Thanks to the devs for this beautiful piece of art in VR...

It's like watching a movie - linear progress: bolts can't be cut until the character says "Oh, let's try cutting the bolts!", you can't shut down the conveyor because you had to touch specific parts on the way to the shut down switch. Sound in space, labels keep their orientation despite you changing orientation. If you wen't a fan of HL Alyx you won't be of this one.

Gameplay: Great
Graphics: Great
Story: Great
Sound: Good
Replayability: Single 5-10 hour Play through. Would be much better if the devs added "Chapter Select" and a "Skip Tutorials" option.

Sidenote: Ran better on Virtual Desktop for me than it did with Air Link.

review_title: Probably amazing, but audio is broken
one_reviews_text: I bought it, launched it, was instantly hooked, but around an hour into the game I lose all audio. I also lose all audio within my Rift headset itself. I have to close down the game and the oculus app itself to get sound back. I've uninstalled Lone Echo, Oculus, ALL my VR games and content, wiped everything clean and started from scratch, downloaded different save-game files online, and nothing helps. Right around the time you're doing your first EVA the audio just stops. I so desperately want to play this game so I can buy the sequel but I can't even play it. There's no support, so I'm just screwed.
First proper story VR game I have played and it was an absolute treat. Very engaging and not too difficult. The movement system is unique and I look forward to playing Lone Echo 2.

I bought this game after reading some stellar reviews, but was very disappointed.  The story is unengaging and subpar, the gameplay was just painful, literally several hours of being a robot without usable legs mucking about in space fixing one thing after another until the very end.  It's nearly impossible to play this game sitting down because you need to be able to turn around, but you can't really walk around either, you just stand in one spot turning around doing stuff with your hands and trying to use the most uncomforable VR interface of any game i've played to date.  Graphics are about par for 2005.  Story is entirely predictable and cringeworthy.  I wish I could give a list of pros, but there weren't many.  The only one is that there weren't too many bugs in it.
It always crashs right at the beginning after the tutorials. 20 bucks wasted. Does not seem to have fix.

An awesome VR exp, 9/10. 
Some mission critical interaction and/or actions need see the "report" first to proceed is not a good thing.

review_title: Finally got around to play this game
one_reviews_text: First bought this game on my Rift a few years ago and never played the Rift much, until the recent purchase of Quest 2. Just finished playing it and wow what a space VR experience. Have a suspicion Captain Olivia Rhode used to have a husband or boyfriend named Jack, who may have passed away. Now looking forward to continue the adventure in Lone Echo 2.

such a good game but its a bumer how short the story is I thought It was gonna be longer SPOILER ALERT: I wish I get to get rid of the biome things and fix the space craft I didnt think it was gonna  leave it broken then use another space craft then the story ends I want it to have a cutscene where they are back to earth Its so fun but it only took under a day
What a great game.  The movement is spot on.  It is the closest I'll ever get to spacewalking.  The visuals were amazing.  Highly recommended.

 GOOD GAME
...Is what I'd be saying if it weren't crashing every 15 minutes.   A  *lot* of people are having this issue.   It's unplayable, which is a real shame.

review_title: Still a Clear Example of VR at its Best
one_reviews_text: Because of the release of Lone Echo 2, I decided to replay Lone Echo. On the Quest 2 with wireless tethering, the emersion is wonderful. This game continues to be a clear example of VR at its best, with a compelling story, great use of physical motion and controllers, and beautiful graphics.

This game is so intuitive and immersive with great voice acting and storyline. I get no motion sickness whatsoever. I can go for hours and I only stop because my feet start hurting from standing too long. :)

I tried the game out of curiosity. I was pleasantly surprised! And the zero g movement didn't give me a headache! At first it was a bit disorienting, but I quickly managed to make it work! The controls are rather good!

I really enjoyed the storyline and the ambiance! This game is one of the good ones!

review_title: game keeps crashing even on lowest setti
one_reviews_text: allways crashing, really frustrating to say the least.

review_title: Good, althoughg has lots of bugs.
one_reviews_text: This game has a good story and everything, and was very enjoyable. however, I found myself running into quite a few bugs throughut the game, like noclipping into objects and getting stuck, or imputsd on the "arm computer" not working well.

review_title: really good, but had some issues
one_reviews_text:
as a newbie to vr I loved this game. super immersive.

unfortunately, considering this came out a few years ago I'm a little disappointed in some of the issues I had encountered.
first the "couldn't install lone echo" (that eventually got fixed) almost had me refunding the game before I could even play it
and then a few game breaking bugs that caused me to have to reload an earlier save file and hope that the bug resolved. most notable one I had was at the ending [potential spoilers] when a certain scripted line of dialogue and a certain chair movement didn't trigger and had me stuck for a while.

still enjoyed the experience, just a slight break in immersion at an important point that stopped me from enjoying it in all it could have been.
really amazing you just have to try it. Its a must play

Pros:

* Beautiful visuals (in-game Sharpening, other devs take note!)
* Believable voice-overs
* Immersive traversal and gameplay mechanics
* Decent length

Cons:
* Crashes often for no apparent reason
* Occasional game-breaking bugs
* Abrupt ending

The best story driven VR experience I've found so far, and a cut above the average work in this style from elsewhere as well. 

Hat-tip to the reviewer who recommended playing this wirelessly via air link while sat on a spinning office chair, it made moving around in microgravity feel so immersive. grab on to a handhold with one hand, spin the chair as you move around to face the way you want to move, it adds so much!

Game seems really fun, but crashes constantly. Only VR game I have that crashes like this. The last crash glitched my save file too, very frusterating. Nothing I've read online or tried on my pc has helped the crashing. Running in a 3070 and 10900k.

Update: I upgraded to a 3080 ti and the crashing stopped. So guessing it must have been some sort of vram limitation? Regardless the game runs great now and is a lot of fun.
review_feedback: Hi there, sorry to hear your game is crashing constantly. If you reach out to our Devs in the Lone Echo Support Channel of the community Discord, we'd be happy to troubleshoot this issue with you. If you're getting any bugsplats when you crash, please send those in so we can review them when troubleshooting with you. Thank you, and sorry again for any frustration or inconvenience caused by this.

one_reviews_text: Game is ok from a VR mechanics point of view. Storyline is very thin though, just barely to give you an excuse to move arround. It had much more potential...

Future Astronaut Simulator thats Full of interactive puzzles, and a good story. Leaves you wanting more and Its cool floating around in space with zero gravity. Graphics are high quality.  Controls are awesome. Several dialogue options that lets you choose to sound human-like or robotic.

Wow what an amazing experience at Saturn with a wonderful story that get's you completely immersed.
Great gameplay and nice puzzles that keep you going... until the battery is empty ;-).

review_title: one of the best vr games of all time
one_reviews_text: this game is seriusly on par with games like half life alyx and boneworks its so worth the £15

Ran great on a Quest 1 and GTX 970 over wireless link.  Play time of a little over 9 hours for completing all side quests. 
Great story. Would have given it a full 5 star review except I got stuck twice, each time for about an hour before looking it up. Other than a slightly more intuitive design on some levels, this was a great game with an interesting narrative. Did look for subtitles and could not see any, so that is a downside if you are not a native english speaker.

I bought this just to benchmark on my decent PC through Air Link on my Quest 2. I have to say it blew all my expectations out of the water and runs pretty well on my GTX 1050, even with Antialiasing 2X.
For a game that's 4yo, it still sets the bar high on how a VR experience should be from the visuals, story, and interactivity of the Zero G  environment.
Will definitely buy the sequel once I'm finished and looking forward to the developers future titles

review_title: Fun game, missing a quick-save option
one_reviews_text:
I had a lot of fun playing this and I think the experience is worth the price.  Felt genuine anxiety in parts where I started drifting away from the ships and land marks in the game.  The way that you move around is genius - zero gravity works very well in VR cause you can just grab anything and propel yourself.  The story line is well done and a joy to experience.  

My only complaint is lack of a quick save option.  Hard to tell when the game has been saved.  When you get VR fatigue you should be able to exit the game without losing any progress.  I don't like the way this game makes you torture yourself to get to a checkpoint when you just need a break from VR.

review_title: Amazing game,Best VR story iv played yet
one_reviews_text: worth every penny, i recommend this to anyone that loves space and advetnure with a amazing story
that was a so great experience, thanks for this Ready at Dawn Studios

Game has been on wishlist ever since I got my quest 2 back in Dec. Something about paying $40 just kinda turned me off from buying it. 
Alyx was my first game I downloaded so I just figured any other game would be a letdown. 
I've been waiting for a good sale on Lone Echo and low and behold it's now upon us. $10!!
Played it this morning for a couple hours  and every 5 min I kept saying "wow" to myself. So crazy that this game is 4 years old!! The detail is amazing!! Excited to play this game more and looking forward to Lone Echo 2. I'll buy that on day one, no question.

review_title: Can`t wait to play lone Echo 2
one_reviews_text: the voice acting was very good in my opinion also the video quality was very good.Also the puzzles were neat.
This game is essential to any VR library. Graphics are awesome and the atmosphere often made me feel like I was really there by the rings of Saturn. High recommend from me.

one_reviews_text:
I can't install Lone Echo in the Oculus app 
p.i.e.c.e o.f s.h.i.t
review_feedback: Hey there, sorry to hear you had installation issues. There was a known Oculus issue that has since been resolved. If you're still having issues, please let us know in the Lone Echo Support Channel of the community Discord.

review_title: A masterpiece and the killer app for VR!
one_reviews_text: Once you play Lone Echo you will compare it with every VR game out there. Lone Echo sets the bar almost too high! 4 years later is still the best there is! The killer app for Oculus VR.

review_title: Easily a must play for any VR user
one_reviews_text:
Along with Half-Life: Alyx, Lone Echo is the best VR game right now. What impresses me the most is how well Lone Echo holds up, because so far the VR industry moves so fast that some games are aging poorly after only three or four years (see Arizona Sunshine for example).

But Lone Echo is not one of those games. It still looks darn good, sounds darn good and, most importantly, feels darn good. I cannot think of any other VR game with a comparable satisfying level of movement. Flying through space, grabbing anything to push off and the inertia mechanics are exceptional.

The story is great too. It is pretty simple on its own but the dialogues, actor performances and the atmosphere of some kind of grounded sci-fi are elevating the whole experience to a very high level. As a bonus, this is the only AAA VR game that comes to my mind where you can interact with an actual human character for so long and for that close. It feels like a very impressive effort development-wise.

I have high hopes for Lone Echo II but even if it'll be more of the same, it'll be amazing.
Seriously enjoying this game, and I can’t wait to play the sequel! (Previously had issues installing but those are resolved)
review_feedback: Hiya, there was a known Oculus installation issue that has now been resolved. Please try downloading again, and if you have any issue let us know in the Lone Echo Support Channel of the community Discord and we'd be happy to help! Sorry for any frustration this may have caused.

one_reviews_text:
Next to “Half Life: Alyx,” which came out years after this game, “Lone Echo” is THE standard for AAA quality VR. 

- Good Story? Check.
- Strong performances? Check.
- Atmospheric? Check.
- Immersion? Check.
- Get your money’s worth? CHECK!
- Superlative graphics beyond anything else 
   out there for its time? Check. Check. Check.

The sequel has been endlessly delayed, which is why I will not pre-order, but the second the sequel is available, I will smash that “buy” button. Just take my money, I want to continue with this really amazing concept, and see where else the story goes. 

With what they can do now on newer GPUs, I am expecting nothing less than stunning graphical imagery, alongside a strong story.

This original is still better than 99% of anything you’re going to find out there in terms of getting your money’s worth, because it lasts longer than 45 minutes of interest or completion.

If you’re looking for a AAA experience that showcases VR at its finest, then look no further, just click “buy.”

Bought this awhile back (6m to a year) but it wouldn't even get past the tutorial without crashing. Figured they might have fixed the issue by now with the release of the second game but no, still crashes continuously. Would not recommend to anyone, especially if you have a Nvidia graphics card, as the forums seem to suggest that the lack of support for this card brand is why the game fails to run for more than 5 minutes at a time.

Trully top VR title. Immersive, atmospheric and not so short as VR titles usualy are. Just buy it and enjoy one of best VR games.

AirLink and spinny office chair recomended.

review_title: My favourite VR game so far - 2021
one_reviews_text: Amazing experience so far!! feeling like living a sci fi movie!
review_feedback: Hi there, sorry for the frustration this issue caused. It was a known Oculus issue that has since been fixed. If you have any other issues downloading, please let us know in the Lone Echo Support Channel of the community Discord and we'd be happy to help you.

review_title: Ahead of it's time, always phenomenal
one_reviews_text:
That this came out several years ago is insane. The graphics and immersion are on par with Half-Life Alyx, truly a stunning game. A must play, especially for just 10 dollars. If you're interested in VR, space, mysteries, and single player story-driven games with some simple puzzles then this is it.

I cannot wait for Lone Echo 2.

review_title: Good Stuff! Don't Sleep on Lone Echo!
one_reviews_text:
To think I was sleeping on this brilliant game for over four years. Lone Echo is larger and more polished than I had once reluctantly assumed. It's just as high-profile and captivating as Oculus's other forty-dollar titles. 

Primarily, it's a space maintenance game with a lot of gratifying levers and mini-puzzles. However, the heart of Lone Echo is the wonderful narrative and dialogue between Jack and Liv. The lonelier portions of the game are a stark contrast from other chapters, but they remain exceedingly immersive. Zero-G is a great fit for VR locomotion. Being weightless in game mirrors the limited physical feedback we get from a VR headset. The inverse-kinematics on Jack's body are spot on. It really sells your physical presence in a world without gravity. Much of the game seems as if it would have been ahead of its time in 2017. Also, the relative age of the game means it runs admirably well on my aging PC.

It was great to finally get around to playing Lone Echo and I can't wait to see what the highly anticipated sequel has in store.

I recommend buying this game at full price, but if there’s a sale and you are at all interested, buy it. Main game is truly a fresh experience with movement, setting, and all. Story itself is basically entirely about exposition, but that’s what makes it so good.
Loved every minute of it. Really glad I bought this together with the second game as I can now play them back to back! Holds up great in 2021, highly recommend this :)

Like Half Life Alyx, the devs care about the little details … and I love that. This is a gem from start to finish. I mean, I threw a wrench at Captain Rhodes and she dodged it; I threw a small asteroid at my Fury and it burst into dust. I love the devs that actually care to make something truly great. Ready for LE 2 … which releases in a few days.

A slow paced exploration game for a good chuck of it, you will definitely get that awe feeling as the game looks amazing. 
I loved taking my time exploring every bits of the maps, and scanning items for more information.
I really don’t have anything bad to say about this game, it’s a solid 5/5 and one of the games I enjoyed the most.

If Alice Coulthard or her Spouse one day reads this comment, I just want to say that I could not stop fondling Olivia. Her Beautiful voice that I enjoyed listening to and her eyes that I frequently stared into while holding her (so lifelike).
I purchased the game at a discounted price for $9.99 and what a steal it was for an amazing spacial experience. The game is/was definitely worth the whole asking price of $40.00. I'm surprised the Publisher removed the sale keeping it at a fixed price of $9.99.
I want the DEVS and Publisher to know that when they release their sequel Lone Echo 2 that I will definitely pay the full asking price at release.

One of the best VR games. It has no action, it is just solve problems in space with a great story. This game can see directly to the eyes of Half Life Alyx. However, I has some graphics issues (crashes in the game) due to has XMP activated on BIOS. If you are suffering this kind of problem, try to do that.

If you want the best VR can give you I highly recommend this game and it's sequal. It has incredible graphics, awesome traversal and a stellar story. The sequal is out with not much fanfare or coverage and that's a travesty.

review_title: I love this game and I’m only 45min in!
one_reviews_text:
Hardware: Quest 2, Asus Tuf F15
Graphics: Nvidia GeForce Rtx 3060

Wow this game just looks beautiful all around! and it super smooth using AirLink with my quest 2! There was zero latency and I didn’t even have to run Virtual Desktop. 

The Game:
Play as Echo 1, an assistant to Captain Rhodes aboard the ship space station orbiting Saturn. The story is immersive! It will leave you not wanting to take a break, the suspense will leave you wanting to play to more the story is so intrigue and the cinematic gameplay is just so well played, you really feel like your in space! The game really using physics when picking up objects in the game or even holding on to the ship while transporting through outer part of the ship.

Cons:
Understandably (for me that is) the game is a few years old, tasks in the game that involve picking up objects and placing them inside or around things doesn’t exactly look play well. Arms will flip and flop and Echo 1 will sometimes even launch backwards if an objects is misplaced while putting it inside something. This is something that will probably and most likely be improved in LE2.

Just buy the dam game! 
My verdict: 9.9
A great game with a great story. I enjoyed every second of it. 100% recommend it.

I bought this title and was originally disappointed because there were no subtitles available. (Which I rely upon)  This is a very story rich game, so not being able to hear what was being said kept me from enjoying this.  

Recently I discovered a 3rd party app that made it possible to add in subtitles so excitedly jumped right in, and I'm so glad I did!

A great storyline, excellent voice acting, provided by Troy Baker and Alice Coulthard and absolutely beautiful visuals make this one of my favorite VR games of all time, ranking up there with Half-life ALyx. ( though much shorter than that excellent title).

This game challenges you in ways that most games cannot.  Just getting around is a pleasure and a challenge. Traversing dark, alien organism infested corridors where merely bumping into them means you are wrapped in parasitic tendrils and "die" made for some heart pounding moments.

Though I have my "VR Legs" I was still worried that moving in Zero G would create Simulation sickness for me, but movement is handled so well that I felt no discomfort whatsoever.  Well done to the dev team!  

The superb writing and voice acting really made me care about the few characters in this game.  I laughed at the subtle humor and genuinely liked Olivia Rhodes and an AI character that comes later in the story.  The heart pounding ending while satisfying made me want much more and leaves the door wide open for the sequel. 

I very highly recommend this title and look forward to Lone Echo II.

I don know why some people write that it is a short game or disappointed in some moments, however, my opinion is that this is the very well made game for VR. Very good home to start meeting with VR world.

I cannot believe it took me this long to experience Lone Echo. What an amazing VR gaming experience. THIS is what VR was built for!

Beautiful visuals, interesting and varied locations, and a good story to move things along. Being able to just float around and complete tasks was kind of a dream come true for me.

Looking forward to the sequel coming out in about a month. The endless steam of shooting/combat games gets a bit stale, so I look forward to being a day one purchase to support these great developers.

No doubt, the best game I've played in my life. Great graphics, the story is amazing., and the game is 100% immersive. You can easily lose track of time. The way they develop the game is phenomenal, I had 0 motion sickness. Can't wait to get LE2.

Gameplay:
Let me start by saying lone echo is a game. Don't the let cinematic nature of the game fool you, this is no "experience" it's not an "interactive movie" either this is a GAME. This is both good and bad, because for the good, it means there is plenty of gameplay and puzzles to complete, you don't just stand there, you get to play. But for the bad, some moments that should be emotional and immersive are broken up by overly "gamey" interactions. I won't give any spoilers, but some really intense stuff has immersion breaking gameplay attached to it that gives it less of a gut punch when you have to, for an example, burn holes in ui panels for some reason during a really heavy part, like, how bout we just let the story do it's thing here? Good news though, is that these interactions are almost all satisfying and not usually immersion breaking, with the exception of that dang hand laser. The interactions with said laser go like this: press button to activate laser, cut away painfully obviously marked area of metal, put laser away. Oh yeah and do that again 1000 times. The worst part, is that when you cut, it uses these system where you cut away little cubes of it like this is Minecraft or something. For how classy and high production value the rest of these parts are I don't know why they decided to do it this way. It's just a little gripe, but for how polished the rest of the game is, this feels oddly out of place, and in turn breaks immersion. Gameplay is good, not perfect. Oh yeah also being able to grab everything and float in zero g is spot on, and I recommend not play echo arena if you plan on playing this because it will seem all the more magical. Also every interaction between you and Olivia is great, and the dialogue method here is perfection.

Graphics:
I played this game on oculus quest 2 via "real" link (cable) with a 1600 af and Rx 580(8gb) (basically gtx 1060). It ran just fine on medium settings with resolution in the oculus software at recommended, and the res in game set to (1.0). Even with my lower end pc, I was still incredibly immersed in most parts and had effective 0 issues with it. I didn't measure to see how many frames were being dropped, but it only seemed to dip when looking at very large, open areas with lost of little details. From a distance the game looked kinda fuzzy (if you have better gpu set the in game settings to res: 2.0) then this will be a non-issue. Up close interactions looked amazing though, taking to characters, picking up objects, and waving at my shadow, which i spent a concerning amount of time doing. Overall, graphics are top notch, on my system this game plates comparible to elite dangerous, and much better than stormland.  

Story:
Now this is the highlight isn't it. The story here is good, I won't lie. This is the first game in years that has got me to feel, sad, happy, scared, and lonely all at the right times, and all like it was really happening. You really do form a bond with the main character and towards the end I really felt concerned for her as though she were real. It's a little scary to think a bond like this can be formed with something completely fake, on a level far beyond that of any movie or tv show I've seen. Vr is really the future of storytelling, and this is the best example of a story in vr (I've played so far). Some parts are so immersive and felt my pulse pounding, and had to remind myself to stay calm, in a game. Wack. 
Overview:
While it's not fine work of art, and has a few kinks here and there, some moments border or spiritual because of just how immerse you become. Can't wait for 2. For those wondering it's about 5 hours long, but is probably the best 40$ you can spend in vr, so buy it.
Thank you devs for creating this beautiful game! Great story, stunning visuals, lots of action. Graphics is super realistic, especially if you have high end GPU. This is a must have game. 👌

It starts kind of slow, but that's ok. You realize that it actually helps because it's setting the story. Hang in there, it picks up quickly. I didn't realize until a couple hours in that I could tag the objective on the list by tapping the little square next to the objective on my wrist menu. It would have helped to know what to do a few times in the beginning. My fault though, the game is amazing.  When it ended I was blown away with the story. I wanted more, and was curious what is next... Will buy Lone Echo 2. For reference I'm 36, have a wife and 2 kids - so I can only play in about 20minute spurts which actually worked out great because I was really eager to know more as I played the story.  Buy the game. It's great. Works well GTX1660 Super and Ryzen 5 2600.

review_title: Definitely a must-have, but with caveat
one_reviews_text:
My score translates into 5 stars but is actually a 4.7

The only reason being that the “dialogue” button to be pressed near objects of interest is absolutely not a natural thing to do and can stuck you at various moments, there are some bugs with some objectives points that keep appearing in A/R although not any longer relevant (so you waste a lot of time getting back and forth in hoping to progress), and other bad game mechanic design choice (or glitch?) with some robots arms or legs assembly which is absolutely not logical.

But overall, this has to be one of the most immersive VR game available even in 2021, with incredible graphics (I never saw an NPC more convincing than Liv!) and a sense of scale that I found nowhere in any other title.

So a must have and play of course, without any doubt.
And right now it’s in promo, you can’t not doing it :-)

I almost rated this review a 4 star, but then I realized I don't really have any reason to give it less than 5. The game was lengthy enough without overstaying its welcome. Had an interesting story and optional objectives. The scenery was awesome to see in VR. Traversal was fun, and the game overall VERY immersive. The UI is one of the most unique and intuitive I've ever used, and best by a mile in VR so far. It wasn't a particularly challenging game but I did feel most of the parts I got stuck/died on were kind of cheesey and annoying and just retracted from the overall experience rather than have any sort of impact. The ending wasn't really a big cliffhanger, so I'm unsure where LE2 will go with the story... but it was a satisfying enough ending. I'll definitely be buying the second game when it is released, and I strongly recommend anyone with an interest in buying this game. Probably my favorite VR game thus far.
Just float around doing menial tasks and listen to your companion talk. Just play Echo VR, much better use of the zero-g gameplay.

ive only just got this game but friggin love it to the max, i saw the trailer for the second game, and if they cancel it, im gonna be annoyed to the max. i love this game, im only about an hout in but still love it, its fun, bootyful. very much would reccomend (i cant spell) now that its ten dollars, if you get it, get the other one when it comes out.

The graphics are really good. Floating around in space is really cool. The gameplay however gets really repetitive and boring. The story is also really cliche. It was fun at the beginning but near the end I was kind of dying for it to just be over. I'm glad I got it on sale because I dont think its worth a triple a price tag. Its still generally enjoyable so if you want a new game and its on sale it might be worth it for you.

Usually, for $40 I expect a longer game, but the quality, story, and visuals make it worth it. At the end of the day, this is a game about finding this and putting it there and twisting that thing and moving that thing. But it really felt like being in space and the interaction between the characters was great. Near the end in a life or death situation I legitimately worried about the outcome of one of the characters. Would I be fast enough to save the day?
Best Oculus VR Game, graphics, story, dialogues and playability makes this game by far one of the better VR games and the best Oculus Game. Localization adds the cherry on the cake.

I think this game was very good, the story was interesting and visuals are good.  There is no motion sickness whatsoever. Only thing I was missing is a proper musical soundtrack to elevate this game and some of the segments to a higher level. Other than that it was great.

review_title: THIS is what VR is for
one_reviews_text:
A realistic, immersive, AAA experience. 

I've been to outer space. 

That's really what it feels like.

I played on PC tethered to quest 2. It crashed a couple of times, and it was less than 10 hours.

But if you are a gamer excited about VR but then were disappointed to find out that everyone's playing low poly rhythm games because the VR market's too small for "real" games, the kind VR was invented for, that really take you out of this world, you need to give Lone echo a try.

I bought my Quest 2 a week ago and this was the first game i played on it. Finally beat it today and man i cannot wait to play the second one. If you own a VR headset and havent played Lone Echo you are trippin.

Without revealing the game I have to say that the story, setting and implementation of the game is right up my alley. At first it was kinda difficult navigating the environment, but after a while you get so good at it that it feels second nature.

The game engaged me on the same level like Moss and Half Life: Alyx did, and I love that. Can't wait for Lone Echo 2!

review_feedback: Hello, we're sorry to hear you keep crashing in-game. Networking issues/having your ports blocked and overclocking on your PC are common causes for frequent crashing. If you'd like our Devs can help you troubleshoot in the Lone Echo Support Channel of the community Discord. We also have replacement save files available as well that can be found here: http://bit.ly/LE-savefiles

It's been more than a year I began to play VR games, and I only downloaded Lone Echo a month ago. Wish I started up with it at the beginning ! This is far away THE best VR experience I ever played. Even at a regular game price, it worth it. Buy it eyes closed, you can't regret it !

It really is a good VR title, but I can't look past the crashes, and I'm certainly not going to buy Lone Echo 2 at launch, if this is the support I can expect.

At first i didn´t liked this game because of slow pacing at beginning .. but i gave it second chance and i´m happy i did that because as soon as everything starts going sideways in story it´s getting interesting.

Now understand that this game doesn´t have any jumpscares or monsters but still the whole atmosphere makes you uncomfortable and intense as hell ! .. Beautiful game, compelling story and so much to look at.
Starting the game I spent an hour in the first room just looking at stuff.

There's no manual save option and nothing to indicate when the game is saving. If you quit and reload (sometimes necessary because items you need vanish) you find yourself having to listen to a bunch of dialogue and repeat sections/travel.

When you quit it should save where you are, not throw you back 20 minutes!

review_title: I wanted to love it, but...
one_reviews_text:
The game feels pretty raw overall. I get stuck on respawning, controller vibrations seem totally random. I need to wiggle my head almost every time to be able to talk about the thing I want to. Objectives are a mess, and finding what you need right now is painful. Voice recordings and dialogs may play simultaneosly, making it impossible to understand any of them. Save system might throw you back quite significantly in time. Also not having subtitles in the game that consists of dialogues by roughly 50%, while having already implemented parts of the UI that float around you, makes no sense to me.
I don't know, I've played a lot of VR games by now, and usually I can close my eyes on some lack of polish, but this one is too much for me.

I really enjoyed the game from the first moment. I really like the story, the graphics and the mechanics. First I was affraid about the free movement without gravity, but I was surprised I had almost no issue with that. I am looking forward for the sequel!

review_title: My Favorite VR Title so far
one_reviews_text: I have played Half Life Alyx also, and personally I prefer Lone Echo. The storyline seems more intimate and when there is action it's more thrilling and palm sweating. I may be baised because I am not a fan of horror or jump scares, I'm not really trying to spoil, but this is not much of a horror game. No alien jumps out at you in the dark, although, the game does try to scare you by making you go through drak tunnels and solve puzzels whilst in danger, which only adds to the thrill. 15/10 Review. I will be buying Lone Echo 2 when it comes out on August 24th, and I hope you do too.

I wish I had played this game earlier.  It's absolutely stunning with great game play and easy to navigate controls.  I really wish there was a Part 2 in the series.  I loved space walking or taking the ship around to the various sites to perform various missions.  The story unfolded during those missions and was easy to understand.  I was captivated the entire game.  Would recommend to every VR user as the first game they should buy/play.

Just finished playing this game and W O W it is good, especially for a 4 year old VR game: Amazing graphics, reliable controls and an interesting story. My only criticisms would be the high price (I bought the game at the discounted price of £8 and I am unsure if this is permanent) for such a short game (I was able to complete it in roughly 4 hours although I probably did miss a lot of the games finer details such as voicelines, secrets ect). I also enjoyed the game's challenge in areas without ever being trapped. Other people in the reviews reported several crashes but this may be due to not following the recommended specifications. Can't wait for the sequel!

But other than that amazing game 10/10 would buy/play again

Well, I'll be buying any game from Ready at Dawn.  These guys understand VR.

I cannot believe this is a 2017 game, and yet it nails so many of the VR mechanics.    So many titles released even this year (2021) simply can't seem to get VR right like this game does.  Allow me to name just a few that really pleased me:

-  Full IK for arms
-  Full grab mechanics on items
-  Wonderful use of VR for grabing, scanning, etc.

On top of that, the game looks great and just controls really well.  The voice acting is excellent and there's just a level of polish in this game that you struggle to find in VR these days.  I picked this up on sale, but wish I'd payed full price just to support the developers.

If I have a nitpick it's that the story so far is a little boring.  I'm about an hour in and I've just helped restore some downed eqiupment on the ship.  I'd like a little more action and mystery.  So while the VR mechanics are excellent, and the immersion is great, I'd love to see a bit more sense of mystery, exploration, and maybe some combat.
