I wish I knew exactly what was up with this game, and why I had issues playing it (read the original review below), but it's working again, so I guess I should be happy about that.

So far, this game is great, Manuvering space is so cool, and the game runs quite well, even over the new AirLink for the Quest 2

-- Original --
The first few minutes are pretty cool, but I want to experience more. However, I can't get past an issue where the game crashes when trying to use the reactive cutter for the first time. Attempting to use it crashes the game. Happens every time without fail. Re-installing did not help.

If it gets fixed, or something makes it start working again and I actually get to play this game, I'll change the review. Unfortunately, it's completely unplayable as I cannot progress
review_feedback: Hey there, sorry to hear you keep having this issue. If you'd like, we have replacement save files that can be found here: http://bit.ly/LE-savefiles . Our Devs can also help you troubleshoot this issue in the Lone Echo support channel of the community Echo Games Discord.

one_reviews_text: I recommend it

This and Moss are at this time the reason I've waited all this time for VR to be real.  Well actually like 40 years since sitting in front of my TI/99 knowing one day games like this would be possible.  Being possible and making something with it are two different things.  This is apparent at the amount of less then quality titles for VR.
This game though, the way you can grab onto the environment and realistically push off in zero-G.  I love the little details like while gripping a surface and rotating your "hand" it adjusts accordingly, or does it's best.  Something I've still yet to see in any other VR title.  Plus looking at your hands and actually being a robot...I mean c'mon.  How cool can you get. 
Heading "outside" for the first time...my first time I actually just hung out for about 1/2 hour no joke.  Just floating above Saturns rings (not really a spoiler IMO).
A masterpiece truly, especially given it was an early release cuz you'd never know it.  Graphics are outstanding...hell it's just outstanding period.

I really like this game because it’s so unique you don’t have many vr games that are story driven and in zero gravity then the later part of the story is even better but I won’t get into that because of spoilers but if you have a decent pc that can run this game I highly recommend it

This game as alot to say and so much to explore
and the story? fantastic i would say.
I don't get what people saying this was scary?
(SPOILER ALERT)
i don't see any scary, i thought something some jumpscares or aliens what so ever it was just only alot to be careful.

I just can't wait for the part 2! i'm just story hungry, i want some more!
Got all the way to the end just to ecounter a bug that's stopping me from beating the game.
review_feedback: Hey there, sorry you ran into a bug like that. If you'd like, we have replacement save files that can be found here: http://bit.ly/LE-savefiles . Our Devs can also help you troubleshoot this issue in the Lone Echo support channel of the community Echo Games Discord.

one_reviews_text:
The biomass is absolutely terrifying in VR. Heck.

Also I got stuck on a puzzle for 6 hours but it was entirely me being stupid.
(In the room where you can see Liv's emergency beacon through the door I tried to open the door for 6 hours before realizing there's a hole in the ceiling to go through. Not my brightest moment.)

Lone Echo | 2017 | PC | Played for: 8h

Up to HL:Alyx this was the defining VR gaming experience.
The controls, graphics, attention to detail, interesting story, all add up nicely in a very engaging package that will keep you hooked for 6+ hours.

Anyone who enjoys space exploration, is curious where AI might lead us or just wants to drift in zero gravity, welcome aboard!

Story: 9/10
Gameplay: 9/10
Graphics/Physics: 9,6/10
Music/Sound: 8/10
Overall: 9,05/10
fun worth it love it

Thought this would be like a lot of the other "good" games on VR. Glitchy, requires a 1080TI to even run, but man was I wrong, this is 100% one of the greatest experiences possible. The story is wondeerful, the freedom to explore is fantastic, the detail and ability to interact with everything is stellar. THIS GAME IS GREAT everyone on VR needs to play this.

review_title: It took 2 years for me to finish.
one_reviews_text: It's not available in my region. I had to use VPN to download it. It's not availabe on STEAM. It's buggy with the OS and nvidia graphics driver. It crashed so many times without any known reason. It should not be installed on any other drives but C:. I finished it today with the new Air Link which is also buggy. FB will loose the VR race soon. The dev Vice President left the company. Oculus is doome from the beginning~

review_title: Best game I have ever played
one_reviews_text: This is DEFENITELY the BEST game I have ever played, not just the best vr game, but the best single player story game ever. The story was so good, I installed it today and finished it in one playthrough, sadly it was a bit short, but still good. Also this is the game I have been the most immersed EVER, and I played MANY vr games. It sometimes really felt like im in the game. Arena is now kinda unrelated to it but I love it too.

Amazing game, I loved the creepy atmosphere that builds up as you explore. And if you get past fixing up the area at the beginning it becomes a really interesting mystery on what the heck is going on! Definitely recommend for everyone to try

review_title: ...I've missed out untill I plaed this!
one_reviews_text: holly crap! I got this today and let me start off by saying this was amazing. I have played echo arena many times before. this was compleatly diffrent. it was so much better not playing with that one kid who is allways screaming at everyone. 10/10 100% do recomend!

ALERT!! SPOILERS IN REVIEW!

When I first started the game, I was amazed at the imersive experence, and was able to fly through the game pretty fast. It's ablsoultely stunning. It quickly became my top five favorite VR games of all time. Out of 10 I would have given it a 35. Then I ran into the putsy, and incredibly frustrating "alien tunnels" that grab you if you touch them.  The "Biomasses" I run into after reparing the AI in the ship are ridiculous. The openings are so small and tiny to fit through, I quickly forgot how awesome the game was and quickly became frustrated and pissed off. I just haven't been able to get through the trunnels. I love an immersive expreience, and took in all the graphics and gameplay. But again, the tunnles are a little overkill. I've tried over 30 times to get through them and haven't been able to. I've watched walkthroughs and tutorials, and still cannot get through it. I'm not wasting anymore of my time with this game. I wish I could get my money back, but am not able to. I was so looking forward to the sequel, but will not be purchasing that either. It's a shame. For the kind of gamer I am, on all different platforms, this was actualy taking the top spot of all games on all platforms I've played in my lifetime. Such a shame. I'm giving it one star, which is harsh, however I've lost my patience with this crap. Plus the shooting the "spores" with your cutter is unnecessary and creates a distraction that isn't needed. Even if I do end up getting through them, it's completely ruined the expreience.
Until the best of the best part doo

review_title: I'm sure this game is great
one_reviews_text: If only I could play it for more then a half hour without it crashing, I think it needs an RTX update or something, shame I really hate to give it such a low score but its broken for me unfortunately, please patch it DEVS and I will fix this review!
review_feedback: Hey there, sorry to hear you keep crashing! If you join the Lone Echo Support Channel of the community Discord, our Devs can help you troubleshoot this issue.

one_reviews_text: This game has good graphics, but gameplay very boring. You do the same thing again and again.

At the very start of the game when learning to use the laser cutter, it asked me to press a button at the side of my helmet to take it off... I  dont know if the devs are trolling or not but there is no button=== 
Anyway im afraid im going to refund it as its pointless playing something that i can't progress through.

Ok so i feel so stupid, the button the game is asking you to press means touching the headset.. Doh ! So when you guys get up to the part when it ask you to press the button on the left hand side of your head, touch the headset.

One of the very best VR games money can buy. 10/10
review_feedback: Hey there, sorry to hear you're having issues. To toggle on/off most tools you can press the button on either of your wrists. To turn on/off your head lamp you can press near your ear (similar to using an emote in Echo VR). If you're still having issues our Devs would be happy to help you in the Lone Echo Support Channel.

one_reviews_text: Let me paint you a picture, so I bought this game like 3 days ago... I had problems with the install (not because of the game because of my pc) and today I finally played it for the first time. And it was MORE than worth the wait. I would recommend this game to ANYONE that likes VR. Including You :D

Holy Crap this game is actually amazing. The Graphics are amazing, the story is fantastic, and the characters are loveable. This has quickly became one of my favorite video game and I can't wait for Lone Echo 2 to come out.

review_title: Good game but has some glitches
one_reviews_text: Lone echo is a really good game but I constantly get stuck after rebooting because theres no lever for me pull and I spawn outside of the box that you spawn in after obsorbing to much radiation.

review_title: We need more games like this.
one_reviews_text: Lone Echo is the first VR game i played back in 2017, the graphics blew me away, not only that, but the story, and the way the mechanics were implemented were so flawless, that it was the game that pushed to me buy my first VR headset, the rift cv1, thank you ready at dawn, for opening a whole new world of greatness to me.

I'm currently stuck at the Primary Dig Site trying to replace a dead battery that cannot be removed from the socket.

A quick Google search revealed that this bug was first reported back in October 2017, and is still at large.

I was enjoying the game immensely up until this point.  Now I can't progress, and I'm incredibly disappointed with the developer for clearly ignoring feedback on a game stopper.

Please fix this bug, and I will happily amend my review.
review_feedback: Hey there, sorry you ran into a bug like that. If you'd like, we have replacement save files that can be found here: http://bit.ly/LE-savefiles . Our Devs can also help you troubleshoot this issue in the Lone Echo support channel of the community Echo Games Discord.

one_reviews_text: I am ashamed of myself for not buying this when I first bought my rift in 2017. I consider myself a vr vet, i own a valve index, vive pro, vive OG, rift s, rift cv1 and a quest and I've played or own many of the top titles, and I have no idea how this slipped by me, this is on par with Alyx, stormland, hellblade senua, pavlov, i could go on. A must have for the enthusiast, i cant wait for 2 coming out!

review_title: When I hear VR I think "Lone Echo"!
one_reviews_text: This was the first AAA-Title I played in 2017 or so and I still get goosebumps when I think about it. Never have been immersed so much. Graphics are still very good in 2021 and the gameplay/movement is still one of the best we saw in all the years of VR. For 9,99€ it's a steal! Buy it, play it, love it! Lone Echo 2 will be out on 24th of August 2021. I'll buy it on day one.

This game is exactly how I imagined the ultimate VR experience. The graphics are next generation and its so smooth and fluid you forget your in VR. You really feel like the character in this adventure. Theres also tons of details that add to the imersion and make it even more real. At the beiginning I randomly grabbed a toy dinosaur off a desk and threw it at Liv and she playfully makes a comment about what I just did. Its insane.

The story can be quite scary at times away from it's original impression as an explotion sci-fi title. Definately worth a play for anyone, and don't worry about the recommended specs too much. With the right compromises, this ran at 90fps almost all the way through on my 1060 6GB.

For a while I thought that only Half Life Alyx could be considered as a really big and spectacular VR game but boy was I wrong.
This game is amazing, in every way, shape or form, from the story to the gameplay to the sound design. It's a must play for Oculus VR users and now that's on discount, it's the perfect time to enjoy this brilliant game.
Overall I had no technical issues with the game apart from the rare 3 to 5 seconds freezes but that's because the game has no loading screens apart from the main menu one, so that's understandable.
In the end, I totally recommend this game!

review_title: dont put this off just get it
one_reviews_text: 7.99 my best purchase yet. i love space and scifi so i maybe a little bias but this really is what vr gaming is all about just sheer immersion. my first go i used my whole quest2 battery using wireless pc link and was lost in this adventure, its been a very long time since this has happened in any game. i am Jack lol or echo one of course. easily 10 out of 10 and im using a i5 and a gtx1050ti to play it. later ill be playing with a gtx 1660 so ill see if the graphics fidelity improves but i still totally enjoyed my gameplay using 1050ti. if you have ever played echo arena then you have a tiny glimpse into what you get, this is a huge game with lots of tasks ive only scratched the surfaceof whats in store and im already wishing echo 2 was here already to continue the adventure when im done on this game

I have done every possible thing to try and get this game to work. No matter what I do it crashes when trying to load the game. I don;t know if it's a bug or if it is refusing to use my dedicated GPU, but this is rediculous.
review_feedback: Hey there,  common causes for crashes are network issues (ports blocked), antivirus blocking the game, corrupted save files, or overclocking on your PC. If you join the Lone Echo Support Channel in the community Echo Games Discord, our Devs would be happy to help you troubleshoot this issue.

review_title: I played this 4 years later... worth it.
one_reviews_text:
Lone Echo is a single player spacewalking puzzle game with a great story line and a incredible immersive expierence. 

As a fan of Sci Fi the feeling of using the bars to push yourself through coridoors alone makes this game so immersive. Thern having toold such as your scanner and welding tool to fix generators, comms arrays and being thrown into these puzzles makes you feel like your on qa space station. 

The game released in 2017 and being fairly new to VR (getting my Rift S last year 2020) i got my VR legs playing games such as Alyx and boneworks, Lone Echo stands proud at the same quality as then. 

I would say the games priorites are Immersion, Storyline then game play. That doesnt mean that the game isnt fun, the last quarter of the game in my opinion started to get a little repetative on the taks but the sense of urgency and pace of the expierence makes it all worth it. 

In conclusion - It is a great expierence all together, The immersion for me was almost next level. The play time for me was around 6 hours but i feel like i will dive into it again and would encourage my friends to try it too. If you are a fan of Sci-Fi or just need a VR game to enjoy without time pressure then give this a try!!   

I gave it 5 stars but if i could go deeper id give it a 4.6/5

review_title: First Truly "Great" VR Game I've Played
one_reviews_text: VR hasn't been the smoothest adoption for me. It feels like 99% of the market is comprised of charming little indie games that are... neat, but kinda janky and light on content/features. This is really the first VR game I've played that truly "wow"ed me, and actually feels like a team with a decent budget, original ideas, and a cohesive process took a proper crack at things. This game isn't super long but man does it just feel... complete, in a way that others don't, and it doesn't outstay its welcome. Good story, good visuals, good controls (including some very interesting/fun locomotion), good voice acting... it just all fits together in a way that's hard to put into words. A must-play.

Holy cow this feels awesome! It's weird at first then you really get in to the controls. The way new skills are taught at first is a little annoying, but they show you clearly how to use a new tool effectively, without have a 30 min tutorial at the start that is boring and you forget most of what it said. A good amount of humor and fear of getting lost in space. Love it! 

So far this is my second best VR game! Half Life: Alyx comes first. 
Playing this on the Quest 2 Link with an Anker 5m cable. Everything maxed out no issues so far. 
Specs:
i7-8700K
1080ti 11GB 
32GB 3200mhz RAM
Loaded on an SSD

Super cool VR game...now i'm ready to go Mars....

thanks a lot for this experience, amazing moment, only 2 hours and I want to continued the game...

I had wait this game since a long time, but now with this price, because the second arrive...not disappointed !
...how can I change the language? I don`t see a menu for language settings...
review_feedback: Hey there, languages can be changed in the Settings Menu. When you boot up the game and see the title screen, look to the left for a "Settings". Toggle to the left or right using the arrows until you find the "Language" setting. Select your language then close and restart the start the game. If you're still having issues our Devs can help you in the Lone Echo support channel of the community Echo Games Discord.

one_reviews_text:
The game itself is pretty good but its just way too short for the asking price. Took me around 6 hours to complete, and there is no replay value. 

And the game ends just as it starts to get interresting.
Just play it. Incredible experience. I have finished it 2 times and i am going for the 3-rd time. I love this game.

Ill admit i was kinda sceptical when I purchased this thinking it would be a basic concept game, yet it is polished and easy for new and old VR players to get hooked in to.Simple and fun mechanics with great sci fi story that leaves you wanting more. 

Hurry up with Lone Echo 2 already :P

This is the best space game just floating around doing tasks as a robot AWSOME!
im still going to give this game a 5 becuase its not its fualt this has happened many times for while owning a oculus cv1 sometimes when there is a update on any game  and i try to install its says error code i have done every thing to help it but it just wont work oculus please help me this has happened to other games that i really like 
PS[this is not the games fault]
So this Is a great game and I think the Replayability is amazing! I play this so many times and it never gets old! 10 out of 10 game, really recommend.

review_title: this is what VR is for
one_reviews_text: best VR experience ever, by far the most brilliant game i've played on Oculus, we want more games like this one, keep up the splendid work
its a all arund good game

It is a great experience and there are good puzzles to solve.
The zero gravity is just fun to play with.

Glad I was able to pick this up on sale when it was 10$. Definetly an experience that hooked me right off the bat. Sadly this game did have some bugs in it that me restart on some parts but still, a great game for such a cheap price.

review_title: The game I bought a Quest 2 for...
one_reviews_text: First some context, I play a lot of games on PS4 and Xbox and my preference are the AAA Action Adventure so if you have similar tastes perhaps my opinion could be of interest. I've had a PSVR which I enjoyed but I've always wanted to play Lone Echo and decided to get a Quest 2. As someone who enjoys Sci Fi this is an amazing experience from start to finish. It has a great story which keeps you invested and moving forward, the environments are detailed and reasonably varied within the scope of the game and there are actions to accomplish so your actually playing a game as opposed to watching an interactive movie. I tested the game with both Oculus Link and Virtual Desktop and could not tell the difference between the two so played the whole game via Virtual Desktop as being completely wireless was definitely preferable. If you have a PC capable of running Lone Echo and enjoy a story driven sci fi adventure I would recommend this to anyone.

Good VR game, very beautiful and good controls but... 
Slow game and miss translation for other languages like french or at least subtitles could be nice. It's a problem for a game where dialogs are so important....

Disappointment for a "big" game...
One of the best vr games of all time

Even though this game is a few  years old now it could have been released in 2021 and I would still be awed.   The physics are awesome, the graphics are superb, the storyline is cool, and it is a fun game to play and explore.  My only complaint would be that it is a bit on the short side (about 6 hours), but still well worth it and I will definitely be buying the sequel =)

review_title: Cant play it wont even let me launch it
one_reviews_text: everytime i try to launch the game im given a OVR error
review_feedback: Hello, sorry to hear you ran into that error. Our Devs would be happy to help you with this in the Lone Echo Support Channel of the Community Discord.

one_reviews_text: Keep crashing, I can't play it as I have to play again the long story.
This game made my pp grow 2 inches out of 2
Just get the game, it's worth 40$

Lone Echo is definitely one of the best games (VR and flat) I have ever played - and I have played a lot! I won't repeat what so many other reviewers already stated and would only like to say that this is a MUST for every Oculus VR owner, imho.
Yes, there are some minor nuisances, like for example "unfair" save points, but not enough not to give this a 5 star rating.
I'm looking forward to the sequel which will (hopefully!) be released sooner or later.
lone echo allways uninstalls itself whenever i install it
review_feedback: Hey there, Oculus Support will be able to help you with installation issues. You can contact them here: https://support.oculus.com/ .

one_reviews_text: I was very excited for the game, it looks great and I wanted a good space game, I’m sure for a lot of people its great, but I have no sound at all. I uninstalled it many times, repaired oculus app, and uninstalled and oculus a few times with no luck at all. I hope someone finds a way to fix it but for not it will just be a waste of money sitting in my library.
review_feedback: Hey there, sorry to hear you had this issue. Is your sound muted on your PC, routing to a different headset, or turned off in your Oculus Settings? If you join the Lone Echo Support Channel in the community discord, our Devs would be happy to help you troubleshoot this issue.

one_reviews_text: I have played this game twice now and absolutly loved it both times. It is honestly borderline a horror game through the second half of the game. But if you do not have this game, BUY IT. its worth the price!
Totaly worth every penny!

review_title: Probably one of the best VR games
one_reviews_text: Basically a Star Trek Episode in VR. Its sad that this game has flown under the radar of so many VR fans because it is truly an excellent title (albeit somewhat short at roughly 4-5 hours) that holds up even in the same year that games like Half Life Alyx released! NPC interactions are top notch, inverse kinematics works out great for the players virtual arms, grab interactions feel very intuitive even in 2020, and the story is awesome. My only complaint is this game is this game is a bit too short.

review_title: Like being caught inside a Sci-Fi Movie
one_reviews_text:
Lone Echo is simply amazing in all aspects. The dense atmosphere the voice acting and with it's beautiful visuals. 
I felt there was an artificial bond between me as a robot/AI and the captain Olivia Rhodes and I start really want to help her if she is in need of, as the story progresses. Storywise it's not like a super complex space tale, and that's the appeal here, as it feels very genuine in all aspects. The graphic quality support this even further, with very good character models, the facial expression is still the best in VR .
Lone Echo and Half Life Alyx are the shining examples of how VR games should be. Grand, immersive and beautiful with full of love to details, because details are nowhere so important than it is in VR.

Can't wait for Lone Echo 2

This is, hands down, the most incredible gaming experience I have ever had.  I was so thoroughly immersed in the environments, I didn't want to come out of it. That's testimony to how much thought went into the level design. This is a VERY high quality product and if you have a decent rig, you will be blown away on how polished the environments are. Beautifil artwork, the props, the character you interact with is all top shelf stuff. Travelling around on a fury transporter to all the different destinations was absolutely breathtaking.

This was my first real interactive VR experience (2nd purchase after Beat Saber) and I couldn't have asked for a better introduction.  The acting was superb.  The story was amazing. Usually, I would say the price tag is a little steep compared to the length of the story, but after seeing how much work, love, and effort that went into this game by just playing it, I'd say it's worth every penny.
You payed for a VR set.... this game is one of the reasons we did so. A must buy!

review_title: I just finished this on my Oculus Quest
one_reviews_text: All I want to say is OMFG! This was a game changer for me! I may never go back to regular PC gaming again LOL The story was intriguing, the graphics, amazing! I'm hoping for so much more! More stories! Space sims are my favorite. I'm not crazy about the floating realism of space travel in games but it was ok. I prefer this than most games I find on VR. I would be nice to have a space flight game where you can travel to other worlds, land on other worlds...trade, collect, battle....The usual of space travel thing :-)

review_title: Some unpleasing parts last too long
one_reviews_text:
I like the feeling of being on a space station and performing task,  when an "anomily" happens and disrupts your space station operations you have to perpare the damage done by a solar flare-ish anomily.  I would have been fine with just that, as the game really makes you feel like your an astronaught.

The last third of the game has you avoiding Spuds that take over the corridors of another space station.  You test your skills from all that you have learned floating  around the space station.  If you touch the spores they consume you.  

This portion of the game It looked ugly, the corridors where just ugly looking with nothing but red and orange hallways.  It was the most annoying and this portion of the and it game lasted to long for my taste.

review_title: Still one of the best ever!
one_reviews_text: I played this on the original Rift years ago. I just fired it up on the Quest 2 via link and it still looks gorgeous. Everything about this title is awesome. If you have not played this yet or worried that it is too old then fear not and just get it. Still one of the best VR games ever if not the best and I have played a ton of them.
review_feedback: Thanks for sharing your experience with us!

one_reviews_text: This game is somthing I can't put into words. The world everything looks amazing. So much fun easy to replay. Everthing you want in a game if you have the money this is a game you should check out for sure!

review_title: One of the greatest vr experiences
one_reviews_text: Despite being one of the first games of vr this game holds up very well . The environments are very detailed and captures very well the whole zero gravity feeling ! the story is supper motivating and is like watching a movie so uoj want to continue and don’t stop at all !

Overall highly impressed. 

There better be a part two though. We're not just going to leave it there are we?
This game delivers the most flawless immersion I've ever experienced. It's a must.

The immersion is incredible and so realistic that before you realize it hours have passed by. This is a must play if your a sci-fi junkie. My anticipation of a sequel is a definite yes. Please keep more of this type of VR experience in the works.

Still the most polished experience on VR. A perfect representation of the Sci Fi genre with superb graphics, sound, acting, and general ambience. Make no mistake, this is an unbelievably immersive experience which deserves far more attention.

review_title: Best VR game in my library so far!
one_reviews_text:
The learning curve was a bit awkward at first not a big fan of zero G games, until after I played this game!! I would highly recommend this game and here's why,
 
Pros,
excellent graphics
game mechanics
game immersion is too real
Puzzles had the right amount of difficulty.  Anymore and it would have been too discouraging on my part.

Cons,
not really a con, but, the story line was a bit on the short side.

With that said, I really enjoyed this game more then I would have originally expected. So give yourself some time to get through the learning curve and you won't regret it. 

Bravo Oculus!!!

This was the first game i bought after i got my headset, and boy was i in for a treat, the graphics blew me away, i couldnt believe i actually had robot arms :)

the game has you floating around in a spacecraft, then as the story progresses into space.. and beyond.

i was intrigued to see where the story went, and i wasn't disapointed. looking forward to part two.

By far, the best experience I've had in VR.
Characters are well written, and you feel real empathy for them. If I had any criticism, it would be that it could have been longer, though that's perhaps my wanting it not to end. Part 2 is in the works, and I'm really looking forward to it!

One minus would be is that due to the interaction this is the first game where I felt the limitations of the inside-out tracking of the quest 2. 
Other than that this is one of the greatest VR games out there. Graphics are so good that it feels that most developerr ar just doing something wrong or have not updated their games to the resolution of the new generation.
Atmosphere is superb, the locomotion near perfect, story is very good and the overall immersion is incredible. I feel lucky only plaayed for like 20 minutes when I bought the game on Rift CV1.

You play as a robot (albeit a complex one), and the ship's commander is a human. I have NEVER felt a connection to a non-player character as I did in Lone Echo. It surprised me, but it was the first time in any game I felt the NPC I was with wasn't hollow or predictable. From the jokes, asking her about her history from the objects around that show her humanity while on a space station. Caring about her character (like in a good book) makes the connection to the game much more. This is why I consider it one of the best overall game and experience (VR or not), use of mechanics and atmospherics (specificalyl for VR, even for a few years old still is amazing). The sound design is also very good.

review_title: Game is still bugged after 3 years
one_reviews_text:
Played this game all the way up until I got to the primary dig site. Had to replace a battery, only it glitched and got stuck in the place I had to place it. Since I could not go to an earlier save point I am effectively stuck where I am unless I was to start the whole game again and hope the same glitch won't happen again.

It is very frustrating to encounter a bug like this even when it has been out for years and should have been sorted. Unfortunately I cannot get a refund because I played it for more than 30 minutes. Don't buy if you don't want to get sucked in over several hours only to have your investment of time and effort wasted by a glitching bug.

3 years have passed and it is still an absolute peak. HL: A it's cool, everyone knows it, but man - it's so much more immersive. Honestly, I've read about the Lone Echo a long time ago and I think "Hey, the future of gaming should be like this" ... and I bought myself an Oculus. What can I say, just play it.

This game is insanely good. It's more of a narrative style game with puzzle/problem solving mixed in. There are times when you'll be looking for what to do but the game's waypoint system is pretty lenient, sometimes a little too hand-holdy. The story and interactions are great and so are the graphics. It's basically an astronaut simulator with sci-fi elements. The only real issue might be the motion sickness especially for those new with VR. I didn't have any issues as I've played multiple titles by now but I would definitely get motion sickness if this were my first game or one of my first games. This is a must-have for VR definitely.

Amazing, cinematic, beautiful, then ruined by the ending, which is both confusing, annoying, and just ... time consuming.  The end is all about micro moves and trying to maneuver around tiny floating things, rather than the style of the rest of the game and solving puzzles.  And, if that wasn't bad enough, the worst trope of all times arrives - a maze.  Mazes are ways to add time to your game without adding content, but unlike the bread sticks at Olive Garden, it doesn't actually taste good.  Ditch the maze, keep the story, keep the voice acting.  Props for trying.  4/5.

This is a masterpiece of vr gaming. The zero g experience and physics is incredible. It has a great story that just kept me coming back for more. Its a game to be savored. Explore, examine the scenery and objects its so detailed. I also really liked the way the game had no violence, what a refreshing change.
Best VR game so far 02.2021
cant say it enough but one of the best VR games ever, i just cant find anything that captures what this game did and makes you feel when you play it! 5 stars check it out

All i can say is that this was a vr experience i will NOT forget. There were points were i was screaming at the characters because something bad was happening. At some parts (when you are doing assignments in space) I was VERY scared of flying off into the midst of space. I would lose grip of something and start flying away while screaming: NONONONONO!! The story is awesome, the graphics are great (I recommend turning shadows to at least medium if they aren't since it looks much better and I have the minimum for vr so everybody should run fine with shadows off. Just get it, it may seem a bit pricy but it is an experience you will not forget (sorry for bad spelling)

review_title: Game looks amazing, but crashes on me
one_reviews_text: I don't doubt this game is awesome, which is why I was extremely excited to finally try it out. Unfortunately, I haven't even been able to make it past the tutorial because it keeps crashing on me. No other apps do this, my firmware is up to date, and I'm currently at a loss. I have a troubleticket submitted which will hopefully resolve this, but until then the game is not playable.

I am stunned at the level of detail, the all-consuming storyline, and the immersive nature of this game.  The navigation, the universe, the characters (limited though they are), the details, the fluidity, the gameplay - EVERYTHING about this game is insanely well done and over-the-top!  I can't wait for the sequel to come!  Prior to buying it, I read some of the reviews and one said something to the effect of - "just buy it, you won't regret it."  I did, and I don't, and I recommend the same to you.
This game, all though being very short in my opinion is the best VR game I ever played. The story is amazing, the visuals are equally the same. Cannot wait until the second installment!!!

review_title: The Adventures of Captain Liv & Jack
one_reviews_text: One of the games I was most looking forward to play and it did not disappoint. Over three years old and if it would be released today, it would still give HL: Alyx a run for its money as best VR game of the year. Really excited for Lone Echo II.

Since I had purchased my quest 2, I wanted to play this game. So I bought the game during sale and I LOVED IT. I had no issues using quest 2 with link. However I could not finish the game due to A BUG. I had to watch the ending through youtube video which was about 5 mins or so. I still had lots of fun during play and I would definately recommend this to other people. I'm so excited for the sequel coming out next year!

Absolutely loved the story and the mechanics, Moving through space was weird but I loved it. The twist at the end was very unexpected and there is some replay value in doing some collecting and doing the optional tasks. Very excited about the sequel! Can't wait for it to be ready definetly getting it as soon as It comes out!!

Absolutely love this game. However at this point with the Quest 2. There is zero excuses that can be made to put this full game on the Quest. At this point if you can get the multiplayer going, I cared more for the campaign myself. Love the multiplayer, but I loved the combat mode more. That as well needs to be on there. So how much longer do we have to wait? It’s sad the people you have playing this game, don’t even know that there was a story.

review_title: Hands down the best VR game right now
one_reviews_text: If you have $40 to spend, get this game. Even if you want a different game for the same price of cheaper, don't, get this game. This is the best VR experience i've had so far, it's better than job simulator which is an absolute blast! If you're looking for a good VR narrative look no further, this is as of writing this the pinnacle (except for HL: Alyx i haven't played that yet.) it has an incredibly immersive full body model and when you (android Echo 1) get damaged it actually shows! Not only that but it has 10+ hours of story WITH a multiplayer PvP mode. My only complaint is that after playing this I feel like it's spoiled me. Every game I've played since just has seemed incredibly unpolished compared to this masterpiece.
Greate game. I want more space, more explore, more experience. Nice mechanics but need litle improvment (realistic) in controll.
I guess I can only handle games with teleport movement. Could'nt play this, complete waste of money

The experience of floating around was very unique and the visual experience impressive, this is why I gave it 3 stars. The second half of the game play felt a little creepy and dark which I personally didn't care for. I was really just looking to get through the game later in the experience because I really wasn't enjoying it that much.  I wanted to see a cool ending to the whole thing, but it just ended without much of anything. The whole experience is the game itself. Don't expect a grand fanally ending because you won't get it.  If you aren't enjoying playing the game just stop playing because it won't get any better. I'm glad I got this on a black friday deal because otherwise I would be disappointed. This was a neat experience but I can't say I would recommend taking the time to do this, unless you have lots of time to burn (which I don't). Overall, impressive VR immersion, but I didn't really enjoy the ending or the last half of the experience.
Everything about lone echo is vr perfection.
This is really the first single player game that I have bought for VR.  I am worried now that it has set too high of a standard for any new games.  Money well spent.

review_title: Up there with half life alyx
one_reviews_text: I got the Rift CV1 on day 1 and only just got around to picking this game up, Now playing it on the Quest 2 and it looks unreal, the story is movie quality and the game play is so absorbing. I am a big fan of half life alyx but this sweet baby is right up there with it! don't punish yourself, buy it, now...!

I just finished playing playing lone echo and I’m really glad I bought it. One of the best games I’ve played on the rift, thoroughly captures you imagination excellent graphics and a storyline that makes it hard you put down get this game you won’t regret it. 
￼

I’ve read about it here but no one‘s telling exactly where to get the save file to advance I’m early again in the oxygen garden I have done all three tasks that are required and the computer says it flow control balance of power and the transformer but yet there’s no way to advance I’ve read that it’s a known glitch and you just need to save file that takes you right after that checkpoint because every time I have to start over and it takes time and I’ve done it 10 times over please help￼. No matter which one of the three I push the dial to it says that it’s already fixed and that I should set it to something else but there’s nothing else to set it to and she just continues to work on the wires and there’s no way to advance

I recently got into VR and got spoiled for high-quality VR titles thanks to Lone Echo, Boneworks and Half-life Alyx!! The only problem I have about Lone Echo is the story is too short. But other than that the zero-gravity is done perfectly well. The graphics, shadowing and animations of your arms, torso and legs being seen is extra immersive.
Would recommend 10 out of 10!! Will buy sequel once released :^)

review_title: What part was supposed to be enjoyable?
one_reviews_text: The ratings were so good i had to try this. The environment was really great. But the game itself is like having a second job. You have to fix everything. I did and expected the game to start properly. Alas no .. the game ended. Spend the time doing your chores at home.. it will be more satisfying than this.

review_title: Crash, bug, crash, crash. I quit
one_reviews_text: The game is awsome when it is not crashing. I think I have a descent setup (2020) that run with all other games I have, but I can't play Lone Echo. Even if I lower the graphiscs, it constantly crashes over and over again. I'ts a shame to pay 40 box for this!
review_feedback: Hey there, sorry to hear you ran into some bugs in-game. If you join the Lone Echo Support Channel of the community Discord, our Devs would be happy to help you troubleshoot the issues you're having.

one_reviews_text: Game is brilliant but hasnt been updated over time and its now unplayable for me on a modern computer rtx 2080ti, game crashes from every 5mins to every 30mins, unplayable. Searching around, alot of people have reported the same recently.
review_feedback: Hey there, sorry to hear you keep crashing. The most common types of crashes are due to overclocking, the game being blocked by an antivirus software, or network issues resolved by port forwarding. If you join the Lone Echo Support Channel in the Community Discord, our Devs would be happy to help you troubleshoot the crashing your experiencing.

one_reviews_text: At first I thought this game was bugged to hell, however this was just me being stupid as this game does make you think. Amazing experience at first but soon becomes dull and repetative having to simply avoid the annoying red blobs for hours while navigating an empty spaceship
review_feedback: Hey there, sorry to hear you ran into some bugs in-game. If you join the Lone Echo Support Channel of the community Discord, our Devs would be happy to help you troubleshoot the issues you're having. :)

review_title: One of the very best VR games ever
one_reviews_text: This experience is breath taking. Beautiful sound and visuals, a compelling story, great experience of zero G, and also n00b friendly..

Overall this was one of my favorite games I’ve played other than HL:A. Very immersive.

The one downside and reason for 4 stars is that it crashed probably 10-15 times for me before I finished it and sometimes had to replay large chunks between the last auto save. No clue why it kept crashing, I haven’t really had issues with other games and have a pretty good system.

Very good story. Not too easy, not too difficult. Nice auto-save feature. Very good graphics. And when you toggle some items in the settings, you can even more enjoy the feeling of floating in a zero-gravity environment. Wonderful!

This is a fantastic game, no doubt about it... until the last moments of the game. There is a game breaking bug around a certain hectic sequence of events that prevents progression. I had to watch a playthrough to see the ending because I couldn't finish the game myself. For a game that came out years ago this should have been addressed by now. It is the only thing preventing me giving it 5 stars.

I’ve been sa renting this game since 2016 and I finally built myself a pc so I was able to rig it up to my quest 2 and it looks amazing. It took me about two weeks to complete it as I played it in moderation. Sill one of the best VR games 4 years later

review_title: Best Vr game in my opinion
one_reviews_text: I loved the first time I played this game. I've played this game so much that I don't even remember how many times I've completed it. The game has some of the best graphics I have seen in vr so far. The view of Saturn is beautiful. The game is also very interactive. I can't wait for Lone Echo 2, THIS is the future of Vr.

The content is nice, but I'm very disappointed in movement handling. I cannot even rotate my body with both hands. Down is always down, nothing is rotating by itself, momentums from wrist-thrusters do not add up properly (and do not apply any rotation to my body). That's not how space works. "Mission:ISS" felt much more immersive. I do understand that introducing real physics may confuse many people (and possibly cause motion sickness), but it should still be an option for enthusiasts.
Translate ITA please!!!!!

review_title: an amazing game no doubt about it
one_reviews_text: if you have got the money for this game and love a story, this game will give you it, its action packed and you get stuck into the story i loved the story line and i beg for one day they bring a number two out!
TOO AWSOME!!!!!!!

Pros: Really good puzzle game, best 40 dollars I spent. Float around in Zero-G,
Pilot a spaceship, Just a really great game. Everything is a physical object, even the NPC's. Also good for any ages. Why are you looking at reviews, just buy the game! Its amazing! Cons: I don't reccomend if you get motion sick easily, also there is a part where you have to turn on a flashlight and go around some dark rooms. Otherwise its really good!

Just bought an Oculus Quest 2 that can be used as a Rift and played this game, even after so many years it’s still an absolutely stunning game. Great graphics, immersive and well built game.

Awesome story to follow.

Congratulations for the team who built this.

review_title: One of the best games i have ever played
one_reviews_text: When I first started playing on VR, i was searching for some really good, top quality games, and i'm so glad i bought this one.
I really wish i would not have waited untill 10 months after i got my Rift s to play this becuase it is simply amazing.
This is a must play for anyone owning vr set!
Not sure why it took me years to complete.  I started on the rift and then for some reason never went back.  Now finished on the quest 2 and its outstanding.  Really hope they make number 2!
I was on the fence about getting it in part due to its age but its the best game  i  have played in VR
Definitely one of the best VR games up there, probably in my top 5. Story is intriguing and the mechanics work great.

review_title: Oculus's magnum opus game, still today.
one_reviews_text: If you haven't played this, it's hard to really know how it stacks up against everything else offered in VR. I'm telling you that the next best thing to Half-Life: Alyx in terms of a grand, AAA adventure game - the MUST-have for gamers on the Oculus platform. One thing to note though - take your time with it because it's definitely not the lengthiest game in the world, but exploring certain sections- especially in open outer space-is very rewarding.

Beautiful Game! Easily one of the best I've played on VR, if not THE best. The game play and controls are simple. The story is great and kept me coming back for more. It really impressed me. I sincerely hope that there is more to come

Wonderful game. i dont see how this game can be bettered. superb in all respects. 
Love Liv! Asked her for a date but think she was too busy! Haha!

review_title: It will be a timeless VR experience
one_reviews_text: What can I say that everybody else has not... I'll just start.  It looks amazing, great voice acting, great controls, great animations, great shock and awe moments... it's just great.  If you own VR, like a good adventure but don't own this game, you are doing it a disservice!
I found at the beginning a little boring with all the tasks, I preferred action
Very fun. Zero gravity problem solving. Interesting story line.  I cant wait to see the next installment.

Wow, just Wow! This was such a new, intense, extremely good game-experience. I play PC-Games for about 22 years, played a good deal of all the blockbusters and I'm not easy to impress. This was such great entertainment from start to finish and a perfect demonstration, how intense and awesome VR can be! Because the game has so many nice details, I took my time to explore and often just watched the stunning environment, therefore my playtime is easily above 5 hours and I didn't reach the end yet.
And the gr8 story and the relationship to the other NPC, can't remember having played something like this in such a special setting! Everything looks and feels extremely real and believable. That's exactly what I'm looking for, not the 14th title of a game-series, but a game that feels so fresh and intense that I'm so curious what will happen next!
Half-Life: Alyx completely flashed me, now Lone Echo is totally awesome too! A must-play!

If you are looking for a game that gives you a great sense of presence, has wonderful characters, beautiful graphics and oozes spaceship atmosphere, you should stop right here and plunk down those 40 bucks!

This is what Virtual Reality is made for.

review_title: Wow! This and HL: Alyx have convinced me
one_reviews_text: I bought a quest 2 specifically to play HL: ALyx and after finishing it I began looking for another game with a similar level of polish. I came across Lone Echo and holy crap it was awesome! Cannot wait for Lone Echo 2! If you havent played this game it is a MUST!

this is the interstellar of videogames everything is amazing and interesting even the simplest tasks,and the first time when i got out in space it felt so cool and felt like i would just fall into saturn
A very good game,just as simple as that!
Amazing storyline, fun task's and good voice acting

review_title: A masterpiece w crashing and bad support
one_reviews_text: This was potentially one of the best games for the Oculus hands down. But then the crashes started occuring. I was seriously impressed with how creative the users got trying to work around these problems. The primary reason they had to is because of a lack of communication from the devs. I personally tried a myriad of things but the game crashes regularly (on 2 different gaming rigs), and at the same spot for lots of people (like exiting the initially training). I'll wait to see what the feedback is for Lone Echo 2 before moving forward. If it doesn't crash on you, the experience is amazing. Good luck.
review_feedback: We’re sorry to hear you’re having issues with crashing. The most common crashes can be resolved by uninstalling/reinstalling the game, checking if your PC has overclocking on, and checking if the game is being blocked by your antivirus or other software. If you’re still having issues, our team would be happy to help you troubleshoot in the Lone Echo Support channel of the community Discord.

one_reviews_text: One of the best vr games I've ever played. It has a great story, fun gameplay and I felt on edge the entire time I played it.

review_title: great game wish they release lone echo 2
one_reviews_text: great game wish they release lone echo 2

its an amazing game to play. the storyline is very good and there is a suprizing amount of freedom. the way you move in this game is a lot of fun but also quit disorienting. just a shame its not a very long storyline.
Excellent game! Can't wait for the second episode. This is what VR is all about.

I am new to VR and to be honest I was not expecting much.  I saw this game on a clip and I believed it offered more than the pick up a gun point and shoot style games I would expect to play on VR.  Not that this game could not lend itself to that type of game in the sequel but you honestly feel like you are floating in space performing the tasks you have been given.  The suspense seems real and on occasion you forget you are playing a game.  This should be the game that all other VR games should be measured.  The story is fantastic and you defiantly get your monies worth.  I look forward to next one.

One of the first VR games I've ever played and it's great. Movement system is comfortable, I never had any motion sickness in this game. Game has simple mechanics for current standarts, but it's highly oriented on exploration and has huge enviroments to explore. The story is simple, but still interesting. Plot developing is a bit slow, but it adds some charm to the game. It has a few characters and they have interesting interaction during the game. Unfortunately it has no russian translation.

The graphics and movement in this game are absolutely beautiful. Definitely feels like I'm a robot in space.

The story pulled me in too, it was exciting and I was curious what'd happen.

However, the amount of tedious, boring, absolutely pointless tasks made me dislike the game somewhat. Hours were spent flying around certain obstacles (spoilers), having to restart whenever I accidentally touched one. Even longer was spent finding some random object that barely progressed the story.

Conclusion: Atmosphere great, story was too slow due to the ridiculous number of pointless tasks.

Lone Echo is my firsrt major VR purchase ($40).  I was not disappointed.  The number one thing I love about this game is that you have an entire body, not just a pair of hands while you play.  The visuals are amazing and the game has a great mix of puzzle solving, interacting with the main character, story, movement, and uncovering new and intresting experiences.  You feel truly immersed in this game and it plays very well.  I have a Quest and I have played this game wirelessly through Virtual Desktop and connected through Oculus Link.  Although I hate the wire, the game was much more complex and layered using the link cable.  As my first time playing a true VR experience, I am happy to say that for $40 I got my money's worth.  Thanks for really making a great game!

review_title: no even eng subs or rus localization
one_reviews_text: The game is above all praise, but, well, I understand that the Russian market may be too small and there is no point in investing in Russian localization, but at least English subtitles. I am extremely disappointed. Why games from a leading vr studio without normal adaptation to non-English speakers. Three stars only for this reason, although it was necessary to put one.

I'm not going to lie, at the start I thought this game was as simple as you're in space, do missions and boom. But no. This game is so, so so gripping and realistic. This game is what VR needs more, the story is amazing, the way it's told really makes you hooked to the game and to the characters in them, some funny humour as well along the way and also amazing voice actors. I recommend this game to everyone. I do not regret my purchase, it was either this or Stormland and I can 100% say I do not regret getting this game. Amazing! I even clapped at the end with my controllers it was so good xD!

Having just refunded Boneworks with its landscape of hurried, stock and spartan visuals, i found Lone Echo to be engaging and movie like. Not exactly fast action but at times deeply visceral and emotionally engaging. Cannot wait for the sequel !

This is easily my top pick for VR. In fact, this is my favourite computer game, period. Lone Echo has an amazing story, graphics, gameplay and next level immersion. I'm a sci-fi nerd, so perhaps I'm biased about the story, but this is undeniably a AAA game worth every penny.

There's probably 6- 8 hours of gameplay here and it keeps you intrigued and on your toes right to the end. And although it's a few years old, it still holds it's own against new titles. If you haven't guessed already, I highly recommend Lone Echo.

review_title: i can not  install  .    i paid by ViSA.
one_reviews_text: paid by visa completed  but uninstall program
review_feedback: Hey there, we're sorry to hear you're having issues installing the game. Troubleshooting steps for this issue can be found on our FAQ page here: https://medium.com/echo-games-blog/faq-e36285480f35#70c9 . If you continue to have this issue, our Devs would be happy to help you troubleshoot in the Lone Echo Support Channel of the community Discord.

one_reviews_text: i felt like i was really in space this game is the best. worth every cent.

review_title: Thankyou for a great Sci Fi experience
one_reviews_text: Alot of the reviews for this game are justified that it is hard trying to add a new view to a beautiful amazing interesting game. I didnt know what to expect when I first bought this game yet even the lack of shooting and killing which I love about most first person games still didnt take away from the great gameplay that was Lone echo. Although it does take a little while to get your space legs in this game you soon learn how to navigate around zero G and stop and gaze in awe at the graphics of the ship your on and even the view of Saturn. The graphics would have to be the games strongest strength but the game play which involves doing astronaut sort stuff makes for a fun ride. I feel the game length was just right as not to start doing the same astronuat activities over and over again. I didnt notice any bugs during the game except perhaps a purple sphere which surronds you as you ride on one of the space crafts known as furies. That still didnt detract away from the game in anyway shape or form. I highly recommend this for all you SCI FI junkies out there or anyone who wants to play a good VR game.
Everyone should get this game! Story hooked me in from the start. Intuitive controls, great zero-g mechanics and the game looks great on the rift S.
Amazing graphics and really good gameplay. The story is really good and it is really hard to stop playing. I really hope there will be a Lone Echo 2 soon!

the story was amazing and full of emotion and mistery. one of the biggest problems with some vr games is that the feel like demos but not this one it was absulutly amazing the graghics are great and you will not regre this purcase.
Simply my favourite VR game so far. If one likes sci-fi environment would like it most probably.

+ Absolutly the best way to move around in VR!
+ Great interation with your female colleage! What is next? ;-)
+ If you love space movies...you will love this!
+ Great graphics ! even if it was new game .

- Can't stop playing after you started

It's a good game but I don't feel right saying it's 5 star worthy for the price. I liked the graphics and the zero gravity! Just lost interest on the task after task. I prefer  the interaction with the captain. Gameplay Great!

Honestly, I am continuously blown away by this game.  The visual quality, the emersion, and the uniqueness of the game play are magnificent, and I am so happy that a game like this exists.  I cannot wait for the sequel.
I thoroughly enjoyed this game.  It is among the best so far.  Hope to see another episode.  Keep up the good work!

review_title: Easily the best $40 I've ever spent
one_reviews_text: The graphics alone were stunning enough to actually almost make me cry. I deeply love space and it's vast beauty. The movement is easily my favorite way to travel in VR, it's so smoothe, and immersive. The storyline on top of it makes you connect to the characters so much, I loved every second of this game. Thank you for making this.

I've been reading low star reviews, some talk about not liking how its simply fixing the station and nothing more, but its WAY MORE. If someone reading this is about to give a 1 star review for that silly reason, keep playing, it gets INTENSLY BETTER. dont mean to spoil, but the ending really hit me and im so hooked for lone echo 2

I don't normally have the time to write too many reviews but it is hard to ignore the fantastic work that has gone into putting this game together. So many of the reviews have nailed it but for those still looking for the short summary of what makes this game so good, it is the beautiful environments they have constructed, the great dialogue and story, floating around in zero G while interacting with the environment and yep you got legs and full body.  If you have ever had the dream of becoming an astronaut and visiting a space station then this is probably the closest to that you are ever going to get. Highly recommended.

review_title: A true VR game, not just an experience.
one_reviews_text:
Played on an Oculus Quest using the Link Cable.

Man where do I start. I spent an entire day, over 8+ hours, going through the main story (I didn't feel like hunting down the optional collectables because the map is BIG) and I didnt even realize it had been that long I was so immersed into the character I was playing.

The visuals in this game are stunning. The movement of Zero Gravity is perfectly translated into VR in a smooth and comfortable way. The quips here and there with the dialoge choice system is done fantasticly and gives the main character some personality that a lot of VR titles are missing. The main story is great to experience. 
This is one of the first VR games that has actualy felt like i just played through an actual game with a fully fleshed story and not just a fancy tech demo showing what VR is capable of, void of any real substance.

The only, ONLY real complaint I have, is the lack of subtitles. Thats it. I just would have liked some form of subtitles and this game would be a perfect 10/10. But without, it is still a 9/10, and worth the price.
review_feedback: Hey there, thanks for taking the time to share your experience playing Lone Echo on the Quest via the Oculus Link Beta! :)

one_reviews_text: Have you ever wanted to jump right into a space movie, like the Martian, Interstellar, or Ad Astra? This game brings it to life, let's you experience space first hand! With amazing story, lots of detail and hauntingly beautiful scenery, it's hard to put it down! I played on the Quest through Oculus Link, ran perfectly. Easily the best vr game I've ever played, 100% recommended!

I'm really enjoying this game between crashes. I've played for 45 minutes and had 3 crashes so far. This was very unexpected for a game of this maturity and rating. I've got a moderately powerful PC (RTX 2080 and I7-9700). Running v23 software on my Rift S.

I'll update the review if things improve

ok so the game was amazing loved it. but i kinda wish there was a longer story. I finnshed the entire game in one day witch i would of liked to spend more time on it. hopefully they will come out with a sequel or somthing. but other than that great game!

review_title: A masterpiece & must-have title for VR.
one_reviews_text: Lone Echo is definitely worth it's value, the high price tag makes you discouraged to buy it, but please ignore that. The graphics are just astonishing, even in 2020, compared to it's release in 2017. The balance between mechanics, gameplay and story all blends so well.

review_title: The most realistic game on Oculus
one_reviews_text: This game has literally blown my mind, the way they made the astroids and the spaceship are unbelievable and the making of the hands and body texture. Do you mind adding this game to SteamVR? That would be really appriciated incase people have SteamVR.

This is a really good game. The way you move around is really cool and I prefer it from the standard teleport way of moving in VR. Although that is only possible and makes sense as it is set at a zero gravity environment. If you are new to VR you may not want to start with this game as it does takes some time to get used to it. However, if you are a fast learner and you like a bit of a challenge then go for it. The graphics and lighting is very realistic so you will not be dissapointed if you are looking for good graphics. The story is also very engaging and you will not be bored. This is NOT another VR shooting game - thank god ! Shooting at things is not the only way to have fun in VR. I hope developers focus more in creating immersive experiences rather than a point an shoot game so many are focusing on. Not everyone likes violence. I like being transported in beautiful worlds that only VR can trully offer.

I will be using this game to compare other VR games to determine if they measure up. The story,gameplay, and graphics in this game are absoultely amazing! Strongly recommend to anyone who enjoys a sci-fi/space game and wants a good story to go along with the view.
I love the story of this game and how it unfolds but the gamplay (interacting with objects and puzzles) boils down to flicking levers and pushing butions. I still love this game.

The game tries to be realistic by providing little guidance, but ends up making it impossible to know what to do at some points, repeating the same mission phrase over and over. You'll need to be an expert in made up space-sounding terms... or look up what to do on YouTube and completely ruin immersion, ruining the point of the game.

I got this game back when the Touch controllers first came out, but hadn't gotten around to playing it until a few days ago. I am ashamed to admit that I didn't give it the time back then, as this is an utterly incredible, captivating experience which absolutely holds up and surpasses most games, VR or otherwise, even today; well and truly ahead of its time.

The graphics, controls, mechanics and story are almost flawless, minus the ever so few janky physics glitches or the slightly drawn out last third of the story, but make no mistake, this is a milestone achievement for VR and represents the standard by which other VR titles should aspire to.

For the first time ever I lost time in VR. It was blue skies and sunny when I went in, and night when I came out. Never for me has a VR game been so completely captivating.

This is an essential VR title for ALL VR users. If you don't have it yet, it's absolutely worth the full asking price, but if it appears on a sale don't hesitate for a second.

review_title: most epic game ive ever played
one_reviews_text: Im playing this game on a gtx 15050 and a core i5 preocessor its not smooth but its very well optimised and apart from that the game play is probably the best ive ever played 10/10

The zero g physics are amazing, overall one of the best movement systems VR has produced. The game itself can be a bit of a slog after you leave the station imo. Once you get into outer space the slow movement and constant deaths by radiation offset some of the joy of floating through space.

One of the strongest parts of the game is the experience of building companionship with your partner. It's a dynamic that few VR or Non-VR have been able to nail as well as Lone Echo.
This game is epic. Story is interesting so far but the mechanisms are so freaking good. If my neck didn't give up I would probably be in there for hours haha

Half Life ALyx my a$$! The graphics, mm! I have an RX 580 and was using Oculus Link but it still looked stunning. The part towards the end when you fly on the frieght ship thing through the cavernous part of the big ship brings everything to scale and its insane. The fact that, while it would be slow, I couldve actually flown myself and explored all the way from the station to the ship is crazy. Now, the story-line really had you connect to the characters and I felt myself really relating to Jack. I kind of expected an evil side from the ship AI but it turned out to have a relatively kind heart. 10/10 cant wait for LE2

review_title: What VR Should be all about
one_reviews_text: Easily one of the best games i have played on vr. It was visualy amazing with a great story and compelling characters.
never finshed the intro, crashes every time. Google it, it is extreamly common
review_feedback: Hey there, sorry to hear you keep crashing. If you join the Lone Echo Support Channel in the Community Discord, our Devs would be happy to help you troubleshoot this issue.

one_reviews_text:
Good game. High quality, very polished, impressive setting. 

I would have preferred a bit more action however. I know this not a shooter or similar but gameplay at times (especially in the first part) does feel a little bit dull and boring.

This is a vr game i wish every one could play and if you have the oppertunity pounce on it this is by far not just the best vr story of all time but i think the best experiance this is well woth the download and $40 if you have a chance to get this game use it

This is my first review pretty much ever, I never write reviews but this is an exception. I haven't finished the game yet at the time of this review. I have a solid 3 hours in the game and this is one of the most immersive vr experiences to this date. I found it funny when I went out into space my laptop couldn't handle it. It's not the developers fault for me not having the recommended specs for the game, but it shows how much they put into the game. So much so that it made me lag. I would compare your specs to the recommended specs to be certain before buying.

Sidenote, to get the best experience. I would recommend setting up your sensors for 360 degree tracking. I preferred turning in real life over using the joystick. It's way better and more immersive that way, trust me.

In conclusion; Great game, very minor flaws, one of the most immersive titles out there. Must buy.

Edit: I just finished the game. What I said still stands and it holds up very well for today's standards. Even with lower than recommended specs, the "low quality" graphics look so great. I had one bug which if i said it would spoil the game if you haven't played it. So I'll just say the bug didn't let me progress and I had to exit to menu and go back to my last save point. After that I got past it and finished the game. This most likely wont happen to you but if the game wont let you progress for some reason just go to the menu and go back. It'll go to your last save point and you'll be fine. 

Also, it took me 5 hours to complete the game so expect 4-8 hours of gameplay.
This is the best space theme VR experience Ive ever played! so much potential out of this game. Keep on the good work!

I liked this game a great deal.  The dialogue was good... the game play was fun... and the visuals were quite good.   The physics 'feels' like you are in space on a space station.   I really really liked this game.

So why only 4 stars?  Well I was outside the space station and I went back to the station and just as I got there everything crashed...  I don't mean by the anomaly I mean the program itself.

Ok so just re-run it and continue... but it lost the saves and wanted me to restart all over again from the very beginning.

That is why the 4 stars... who wants to go through all of that again?   

Anyway such is life and I will probably pick it up again and replay it... after a week or so.   

Maybe it was a Oculus Quest/Link issue... I don't know.

one_reviews_text:
well I'm new to vr, but I make sure to buy all the game top charted on vr, I don't know how, playing this doesn't make me motion sick at all, I play the new hot game HF:Alyx, and it make me literally want to puke playing only few minute, and I don't know what developer do in this game, that make it, 100% make me no motion sickness at all, great job!

I love scifi, and scifi base in current understanding technology, physic and design of real life, the concept of this game is support I love looking every detail in object they place, the lightning, and sound design is also supperb, making me feel in actual space, the story is rather short, but heck, is worth all money I throw to it, I love the character, the exchange dialog, the feel of unknown, I love it all, CAN'T WAIT FOR LONE ECHO 2, I HOPE IT WILL BE MUCH LONGER THAN THIS <3
review_feedback: Thank you for sharing your honest opinion with us. We're happy to hear you loved playing Lone Echo and are excited to play Lone Echo II! :)

one_reviews_text: the gameplay is awesome and the story is awesome what more could you want.

review_title: This is the most emmersive vr game!
one_reviews_text: Holy cow this game is amazing!!🤯👍

I decided to give this game a shot. I wish I had bought it sooner. It is incredible!!  eye candy!!! This game draws you in and you are in for a ride. Running it on a oculus quest with the link cable along with a Asus Strix 5700xt with max setting with no issues! I am excited to check out more games from this developer!

Ok so the game is amazing and I loved it when I got it back in the start when it was released, and yes I would give this a 5 star hands down with out a second thought. 

the only reason its at 3 stars right now is that the game no longer works. I have uninstalled and reinstalled a number of times. I dont know if its my computers but it used to work amazing without any issues about a year ago. now I wanted to play it again just about a week ago. went to start it up and I cant even get it to load without a crash. Click start, right to crash No loading. not sure whats going on but I just cant seem to get any info online with my searches...

This may be a problem thats is Localized to me and maybe a few others. but would Like to know How to fix if I can. the game is worth the money you spend on it and its an Amazing play through and story. I would buy More from these devs. 

If there is a Dev reading this. anyway I can get some help to see if this maybe a hardware issue on my end. like I said this games worked without any flaws at all in the past. so it may just be me?

one_reviews_text: way late to the party but 5 stars. 10 outta 10

review_title: Why did I wait so long to play this
one_reviews_text:
I recently finished Lone Echo and I loved every minute. The space and ship enviroments are great, I love the lonely spooky atmosphere . 
I found the maneuvering in zero g a little tricky at first but I got used to it, story is great as is the voice acting,  I was immediately drawn into how the game would unfold. It still looks great for a game released in 2017, I started playing on less than recommended setting but it still looked great, much better now I've upgraded. 

I only wish it was a little longer I finished it in a little under 6 hours and I was left wanting more. (I did not go looking for all the little side quest items so maybe longer if you're a completionist)

Can't wait for the sequel!! I'll be getting it the moment it is released.
My english languege very bad =( And i whait tshis game translate 2 years =( Plz translate echo 2 on strart and i buy in first date. =/

review_title: Loose all saves on last update
one_reviews_text: A really cool game. If you loose your saves, you can find saves in the oculus forum.
One off the best games!

Great engaging story & cool graphics. Using the oculus link with the charging cable & i7 1660ti on medium worked perfectly smooth. I’m surprised at how good it looks. After playing quite a few simple quest games this feels like what a real VR game should be. Awesome, will buy lone echo 2 when it releases. 10/10.

review_title: I Regret.... Not getting this sooner!
one_reviews_text:
The Immersion the devs put into this game. the clear focus and an amazing choice to. I found myself really caring for the characters. and reacting without even thinking about it. 

I do hope more games like this come out!

My only ONLY issue is that it ends. but thats somthing that cannot really be helped.

review_title: Must have VR - but it ends too soon
one_reviews_text:
I could not believe it ended when it did. Kind of getting annoyed at all these AAA VR games which end after only a few hours (in game) play time. Still, it's a must have, and I can't wait for the sequel.

Update: Devs, just charge us 3x the price, if we get 3x longer story I'll take it!
The grephics are good but the game crashed 2 times.
