one_reviews_text: Great immersion and a cool story but not worth $50 in my opinion
Hope there will be a second part or something.

review_title: A M A Z I N G
one_reviews_text: This game is the only reason i bought oculus. and man i dont regret it one bit. Game is unreal. bump up your supersampling and enjoy the ride. game is beatiful. i'd give it 10 stars if i could. Well done

review_title: Absolutely fantastic but WAY too short!
one_reviews_text:
Okay, I  absolutely loved every single second I played this game. The use of VR is probably as good as it gets (at least I can't imagine anything better), graphics are lovely and controls are really smooth.  The story is good SciFi standard and it's something really new, not one of those have-seen-that-many-times-before experiences. I really was curious how it ends and "didn't see it coming".
BUT the gamet is soooo short. I played for maybe 10 hours to finish it. That's really not much, given the price. But still a 5 star rating from me. Better short and good than long an boring, right? :-)
Hope there will be more from those developers....
the best game ever can not wait for the second lone echo
The game was fun but I only got about 1.5 hours in. The mix of VR experience with the anti-gravity really packs a punch. I was motion sick for hours. I regret this buy.

Perfect in every way. 

Pros:
Optimization, I had no tech issues at all. 
Graphics and Audio, simply amazing.
Story and Immersion, I was there. This was the deepest I have ever been in VR.

Cons: 
For the sake of adding a Con,...     ...it could have been longer.

I can't wait for part 2!!!

This is mainly an exploration game. The story and graphics are rather good but there is almost no difficulty and the puzzles are not really interesting (the hunt for the little sattelites is even boring). The movements quickly made me sick.
Lone Echo what Vr is all about really enjoyed it . Can't wait for the second one.

I have a lot of VR games that are so much fun, but Lone Echo tops them all.  Such a great feeling of immersion and fun.  I started it around 9pm and didn't stop till like 4:30am.  The feeling of floating and moving around is fantastic!  When I finally finished I felt like I just finished a space walk.  Love it!  If you're on the fence - GO FOR IT!  It's an amazing game!!!
Love the game, hoping there is going to be another.

review_title: This is what you got VR for.
one_reviews_text:
First off let me say your already wasting to much time reading my review when you could already be playing this instant classic. 
Lone Echo puts you in the place of Jack. A seemingly AI robot with gadgets galore. Gadgets include a Scanner, Thursters, A laser Cutter, And a EVA pack that alows massive boosts of speed, as well as thrusted braking. But thats not what matters here. With the Oculus touch controls this game is Crazy immersive. Being able to grab and pull or push myself throughout the enviroment was oh so satisfying. Easily my favorite part of this game is just maneuvering throughout this stunning world. The game does have a pretty solid Story line as well if story is your thing. The missions are fun. While quite easy, maybe to easy. But it didnt bother me. The game was a little short, as seems to be a trend with VR titles. But not to the so short you feel jipped point. I selfishly just wasnt ready for the adventure to end. I hear Lone Echo 2 is coming so im so excited to see where they take this promising franchise. NOTE this was the first game i played when i got my VR and not much else has come come close to the feeling i get when playing this game. So in short, just buy the game already, seriously im not joking click buy.
wow

one_reviews_text: Instantly engaging and expertly put together from top to bottom.

Really a great game, motion is very comfortable, and the feeling to be in the space is fully reached... 
Plot is good and the gameplay is funny. One of the best VR choices...
this...game... is... THE BEST!!!!!!!!!!! great visuals awesome story omfg words can not describe this
locomotion in this game is great; I loved grabbing onto walls and stuff to float over to my destination. The story is great too. All around, a very immersive experience

This is the first game I purchased after getting the rift, so here's my rookie review: IT'S STUNNING!  I'm usually a shooter player but in VR stories are so much more captivating.  No shooting here but that's perfectly fine.  The environment and the humanity of the plot was just spectacular!  Can't wait for the second installment!

This game is really good.  Problem is that it keeps constantly crashing.  I've tried other VR games and no issues.  Running an RTX 2070 with Ryzen 7 2700x and 16 GB RAM and don't even have all the graphics on max.  Hopefully this will get fixed.

one_reviews_text: What can I say, this is true VR. Love the game, very few problems, so immersive that I  almost can't belive it.

review_title: Pretty, but gameplay is not good.
one_reviews_text:
Specifically the 'floor is lava' element of gameplay thats introduced about halfwaay through, and contintues the rest of the game is not fun at all. And the environment the second half of the game takes place in is so incredibly bland and uninteresting.

Honestly I would have preferred it just be a 'walking sim'. I hope with Lone Echo 2 RAD doesn't double down on 'the floor is lava' gameplay, and find another mechanic to pad the game with. Hopefully one that's fun.

Come on mah dude, ya'll over rating tf out this game. Yea it's got cool visuals and good movement,  but the puzzles(?) be sucking balls. Half the game feel like a job. Everytime the story get fire, somebody go tell you to find a battery. COME ON MAH DUDE. Many times I did things the hard way because I figured it would be hard, but turn out it was right in yo face. I guessed what the deal was in the trailer when they show a ship come out the anomaly. And dat ending was some trash. Ya'll hipster VR fools over rating tf out this game. Respek me.

The actual game is  fairly  mundane. But  the setting and the  feeling is so  good that you  hardly  notice.  Olivia is an awesome  character.
I  had a  party the other night and  all my guests were  passing  the  headset  around  so they could  get the  feeling of  being in  space.
If you don't have this game you have  wasted  your money on the  rift you  bought.
Please don't  turn  no2 into a  shooter

Took me 9 hours to finish and ended with cliffhanger, so I want more.
Can't wait for Lone Echo 2.
The space walk is amazing, very good story and nice main character. Very good voice acting.
I have to thank developers for not making this yet another boring space shooter!
The last thing you want in this story driven game is some dumb shooting targets.
Very good game, worth every penny.

Jeez, where do I even start?
I'll start with: I played this in a standing mode but will play again with roomscale very soon.
This game is beyond anything I expected. The graphics are tremendous. The story is wondrous and full of twists which makes it engrossing to play.
The Zero-G feel is as real as it gets. I had far too much fun propelling myself around by grabbing things and flinging myself forward.
When it comes to any game, especially in space, immersion is paramount for a good time and this one nailed it right on the head. There were a few times I forgot I wasn't in space (cheesy, but true). I had a hard time taking the headset off for water or snack breaks.

The story starts simple and peaceful and works its way into something much more than I expected. Let me tell you, I am a complete sucker for plot twists and unpredictable moments. I enjoy being thrown off what I believe is going to happen. It keeps me on my toes ;)
Another nice touch is the amount of graphics options in the settings menu. I have a high-end rig and ran into some latency issues but I was able to adjust it over the course of 5-10 minutes to dial it right in and avoid any motion sickness.

My only hatred (which isn't worth deducting a star), is the saving system. I was hunting down some objectives before moving on in the game and decided to take a break to the real world, something came up and I had to quit. I was disappointed when I came back to see all that work had been undone. The ability to add a manual save would be a nice touch.

I've already recommended this to a few friends, and I can confidently suggest it to anyone looking to buy it. I'm a stingey buyer and was hestitant to drop $40 on a game but I am beyond happy that I did. If you're hestiant, don't be. Buy this, play this, love this and at the end, be prepared to be impatient and counting the clock for Lone Echo 2.

Everything about this game is well done and highly polished.  Gameplay is fun and easy to learn.  Story is entertaining and keeps moving at a good pace to keep it interesting.  The graphics are simply stunning.  This is what we were always promised a VR experence would be

This game was an amazing experience. The scope and feel of the game was so surreal it was at some points terrifying and wonderous. Most importantly, the game was long enough for me to enjoy this story for hours, where most vr games seem to be rather short. As a sci-fi fan, this game is my personal favorite so far in my vr experience. HIGHLY recommend.

This game is so amazing! I was a bit worried after I bought it as the trailer made it seem kinda corny but the gameplay is very neat. The game definately has bugs here and there and I feel additional guidance at times would be nice. But overall it was a very good game and I definately wish it was longer, really hoping for a second one.
Believe I have played it for 5 hours and even though there are many 5 star reviews it should not be. Spend your money somewhere else or get it on sale like me for 15 bucks.
AWESOME GAME!  Best I've played so for for the rift.  I hope they do another!!

Truly a remarkable game, with a hooking story, and outstanding characters. Being able to float through space, adn go on an adventure like this is a once in a lifetime. I'd recomend it to anyone getting into VR, the story is soooo dang good, i cant stress that enough, and the experience is so immersive! the atmosphere changes from light hearted and wonderful, to errie and creppy so smoothly. I would give up all of my oculus library, just to be able to experience this game again, with no knowledge of it.

review_title: Game was a beuty to play
one_reviews_text:
Gameplay 5 stars story (not including the ending) 5 stars... that ending though left more questions than it answered... its a non-ending which frustrated me to no end and thats why i cant give it 5 stars but otherwise its a great game... it made me actualy care for the captain olivia which was nice

If you dont mind cliffhangers get this game it trully shows what VR can be

This is the best game I have played so far in VR. You can tell it has been designed specifically for VR, and this makes a huge difference. For instance, you can move your character in the 3D space in any direction by activating some thrusters, and the character actually floats from position A to B, while in other games you kind of get teleported to the next position, which breaks the immersion.
The story is superb, the atmosphere perfect, and the graphics and designs are really cool. The game itself is not than long, compared to console games, but it is the longest I have played so far in VR. If you own an Oculus headset, this game is a must! And after having played it,it has set a new standard for VR games, one that i’m having a hard time finding other titles to compare to.

I've played through over a dozen games and probably another dozen experiences.  This one left me with a grin on my face the entire time.  This is what makes Virtual Reality the future... total immersion into a world that is unlike anything you can ever experience in person.

Your interactions throughout the ship feel as close to real as anything in VR can.  Gameplay wise, it may not seem like a lot.  But the game is enhanced by the fact that you can do things yourself.  It's not like many console games, where you press "A" to activate something.  In this, if you need to flip a lever you do it.  Need to scan something?  Press your wrist activated scanner, aim at the target, and pull the trigger.  It sounds commically simple, but in VR it works so well to bring you one step deeper into the game experience and lose yourself in the narrative.

This is the type of experience I got into VR for. A great story, amazing graphics, excellent movement controls, all seamlessly put together in a beautiful package. 

I usually only play VR games for about thirty minutes, this game had me playing for hours. My heart was racing at moments and mind working like crazy at others.  

If you're thinking about this game, just pick it up. It is worth every dollar. 

I hear that a sequel is in the works and should be coming out in 2019.  I will pick that game up day one. 

Thank you to the developers for putting together such a masterpiece. This is what VR games should be like.
AMAZING

review_title: Pretty fly for a space game!
one_reviews_text:
So, various reviews praise the game for doing impressive work with the VR we have going on right now - They're right! It's surprisingly impressive in how it handles a lot of stuff going on, and I kinda wish it were longer, but for the work put in, I got a great story out of it. Just means i"ll have to hope for the best for the sequel!

I played it on lower settings via how it installed, but it still looked pretty darn nice. Imagine what the high Performance must be like? One or two bugs worried me at first, but I got the game cooperating shortly afterwards. For supposedly playing with less than suggested specs, I did quite well with it.

Hiccups may happen, but if you can get around them, you'll have a great time with this game if you like space and a bit of story.

All Hail Capt. Jack!
Really enjoyed playing this. One of the top Rift games.
Wow. The story, The visuals, the immersion. If you got the rig to super sample this bad boy, just wow.....cannot recommend enough.

review_title: One of the best VR experience
one_reviews_text: An immersive space game in Zero G environment...nice details, fluid and a good storyline,  Can't wait for the second one.

I somehow missed this when it was first released, but then saw the announcement of the sequel and decided I needed to try it. Boy am I glad I did!

This kind of experience is what VR was made for - everything just works beautifully together, from the movement system to the story, the acting to the environments - just brilliant. Just like many of the other reviews say, if you have Rift + Touch and you don't have Lone Echo - you are missing out. 

There are so many great moments in the game, but if I had to pick one it's when you first go out of the airlock and leave the station. I just had to stop and look around for a bit. The sensation of floating there, alone, with the rings of Saturn beneath you and the planet ahead is wonderful, and deserved to be savoured.

Massively looking forward to LE2 now, and just hoping it's not a shooter.....

I'll begin by saying that I'm more or less speechless. After a lot of different VR games, some better than others - this blew me away. I was awe struck by all of the interactions, the dialogue, the writing, the controls - everything! So far I'm 1½ hours in, which feels like 10  minutes have passed. Don't worry about motion sickness, just make sure to have a beefy computer (which I guess you already have playing VR). No horror, no shooting - just a fantastic immersive story with an element of puzzle in the mix and a lot of interactions. Oh and do be careful while playing, I got so immersed I almost lost my balance when trying to catch something in 0 G.

Once again, I cannot recommend this enough - go ahead and buy it, it'll be the best money you've ever spent on a VR Game. A huge thank you to the developers! Please do another game, in this style.

Probably best game, and best developed game, for the Rift right now. Mechanics are excellent and interaction with environment and objects is near flawless. I really didn't notice any bugs or glitches. Visuals are good and game runs exceptionally well. This is the first VR game I've finished. Can't wait until the 2nd.

I was initially put off buying the game by the minimum PC specs and other reviews which made me think it wouldn't work on my PC. However, I'm so pleased I bought it anyway becuase it loaded and worked perfectly with no stutter, lag or other apparent issues and I have not needed to tweak any settings (i7-3770 3.4GHz CPU, 16GM RAM with MSI GTX 1060 6GT OCV2 GPU). Graphics and VR immersion are amazing. Storyline is okay and quests are not particularly difficult, but I have only been playing for about 4 hours. Sometimes the clues/indicators make it a little too easy. Overall I'm really happy I bought this game and are thoroughly enjoying the experience and adventure.

review_title: You MUST have this for VR!
one_reviews_text:
It's fun and great expirence for VR, graphics are amazing, story is great!.

I spend yesterday 4 hours playing this game non stop, it was great to follow story mode. Havent finished the game but so far it's been a great expirence. This is what VR games should be in quality and expirence for users. 

I also higly recomend Echo VR (ARENA). It's some kind of spinof of this game designed for multiplayer PVP combat in space. Notice there is a free version of echo VR where you fight to score points by crossing a disk to score a goal but inside that game you can purchase Arena mode. And thats what I reccommend for PVP.

Few people say this game is boring, but that depends on what you expect. There is no shooting, no monsters, no action. Yes, you are just a robot repairing things. But what makes this game so special is its 100 % immersion. You can go everywhere, take your time to look at things. Grab things, get their description, and interact with them. The gaphics are really perfect, the movements are very realistic. You get your missions, and can do them in the time you want. If you don't care, then just walk around the ship and enjoy the view. It's great. After a very short time you feel like you're really there.
The idea of being the mind of a robot is a good solution for the gameplay: if you die, your mind is just transferred to a new robot. This makes you really feel like being that AI instead of just dying and going back to the previous level.
Also, there is no big tutorial at the beginning. instead, you learn new functions during the game, like an update of your personal AI software. They really thought about everything in this game.

Such a great game. The whole experience is just so much better than most other VR games that I have played to date. I really hope we get more stuff like this and I am really looking forward to the 2nd part.
My first playthrough took me 5 hours, which is more than some other games in the same price category, but still not alot if you compare it to non VR games.
I really recommend this game to people that love adventure and games with lots of objectives.

Very promising start, but the immersion goes out of the window with the laggy performance, and that's even with everything set to minimum. The recommended requesites are way too optimistic.

A pity that I paid what I paid for it. I could have waited a year or two playing other things (none of which have given me performance problems until now) and then buy it cheaper when I have a better machine.

Don't let yourself be distracted by everyone telling you that this is THE VR game. Make sure that you have a strong machine first.
review_feedback: Thanks for your feedback! If you head on over to the Lone Echo Support Channel in the community Echo Games Discord, we can investigate the issues you're having and try to find a solution.

one_reviews_text:
I cannot tell in how many ways this game amazed me. Graphics,Immersion,Interaction,Physics,story,textures and details.EVERYTHING.
I know that it is different for every player, but this game is really special. Just all the physics and interacions with the enviroment and just with your own wrists iwhich have many functions and all of those functions are ambidextrious.The physics of everything is outstanding.The in vacuum movements annd animations and physics are flawless.You can grab onto any material in and outside the station.And just repairing and interacting with various machines and locks and everything where in other games even in vr would be just a press of a button.Here? Nope! in here its so satisfaying that i was begging for next section like that.Story is amazing and pretty long for a vr game. I can detect bad story and this is really not one.So great job developers on this one.ANd in this form i beg you for another this high quality game in best case lone echo 2 where the story continues.Which is totally possible with the ending. If you could do lone echo 2 you can bet every one would buy it. i would buy even two copies if i could!

I find myself just fooling around and not listening to objectives. I enjoy all the dialog and banter. At one point the game was so stunning a got goosebumps. I'm just standing in awe of how beautiful the game looks. My computer can run the game comfortably on a mixture of mostly medium settings and one high setting on FX texture and it still just knocks it out of the park.

I avoided this game for a long time because I knew it was supposed to be the best VR experience, and other games wouldn't feel as good afterwards. It's kind of true. The sense of immersion, story, interaction is fantastic. The first time I played for a couple hours at once and then took my headset off, I wanted to keep floating around the room pushing off of the walls. 

Fantastic voice acting, story, fun interaction, extremely polished, etc. 

Truly one of the best VR games to date.

review_title: Best game ever made for VR!
one_reviews_text:
This game is perfection, when I first got VR there were some good titles like Robo Recall and superhot but there were also a lot of poor quality titles which were made really bad with bad graphics and bad VR hands and mechanics etc.

This game on the otherhand is amazing in every way, graphics, gameplay, VR mechanics and hands, everthing. This is a full game with a story and the theme in space fits VR perfectly.

I defo give this game 10/10 and recommend to all!

Most people I believe would say this is the no.1 game in VR right now with lots of polish and also the multiplayer is great too.

I cannot express my amazement at how good this game is. I have never been this emmersed and emotionally controlled in amy game I've ever played (and that includes VR games aswell). This game is absolutely, undeniably the best one on the market. I have played Echo Arena and Combat but this is undoubtedly the best by far. I can't wait until Lone Echo II comes out. I'm certain it'll be amazing.

the 0 gravity feature is very cool. but the game isn't very specific on where to go and the finding your captain part near the end of the game is very tedious. not worth $30 though, probably a few dollars less. The game is very laggy and crashes a few times every 3 hours. I kinda regret buying this.

This game is a bloody masterpiece.

Though the story is only a couple of hours long, it's still long enough to entertain you for three or four sittings at least. It's beautifully told, in a way that could only work in VR. You *are* Jack. There is no doubt about that fact. The VR experience greatly enhances the way this story is experienced. There is no way the impact this story has would work in the same way had this been a normal video game.

But where this game truly shines is the gameplay. Many VR games have a way of locomotion that can make you feel motion sickness or, as some even call it, VR-sickness caused by the disconnect between the "you" in the game and the "you" moving around in real life. Echo (and some other games as well) eliminate this entirely by, in a sense, having no locomotion at all. Movement is done through hand movements almost exclusively by putting you in Zero-G. You push off walls or use wrist jets to move forward. There is no disconnect between your real and virtual legs because you don't use your virtual legs at all.

The game is perfect in its simple gameplay, and enhanced by its beautiful storytelling. The story was short and left many questions unanswered, but I'm sure the upcoming sequel will take care of that issue.

review_title: Great 1st half - a real slog in 2nd half
one_reviews_text:
I'm not quite through this but for pure visually stunning and immersive graphics and open world environment, I would give the first half of this story a solid 5+ stars.  

Unfortunately the sim suffers mightily in the second half (so far) due to the ongoing repetitive and boring tasks I've had to endure.  It really has turned in to a slog that has caused me to care less about the environment and the game play and more about just getting through and getting it over with.  I can say with conviction that if the second half of the game occured in the first half, I wouldn't have made it more than 20-30 minutes before giving up.  

Having invested this much time however, I will see it to the end and hope that the finale redeems the overall experience.  If that's the case, I may consider raising my rating from three stars to four.

EDIT 1-20-19 -    DNF.  I tried several times to go back in and finish this game but I just couldn't get past the boredom of the second half.  To make matters worse, I thought I would force myself to finish it tonight but when I went in, the game had set me back by at least two save points for some inexplicable reason.  No way was I going to endure all that lava-floor/walls nonsense I had made it through, again.

I'm leaving my rating at three stars just because I really enjoyed the first half so much.  I may even come back and play that part again some day.  After I get my fill of Brass Tactics.

This is a truly awesome VR experience. The gameplay can be somewhat repetitive at times, but it never leads to a point of total annoyance. The visual presentation and atmosphere are immersive and fantastic. The storyline is gripping. Worth every dollar spent.

Absolutely fantastic! This is the sort of thing that VR needs more of, you can't replicate an experience like this anywhere else but in VR. It's obvious the developers really have put their hearts and souls into every the detail of this game - it even runs well on older hardware. A must-have!

Great game to play to memory bug issues need to be fix. my pc running on amd ryzen 7 1700x, 2x8 3000mhz ram, msi gaming x plus gtx1080 and msi x370 carbon pro motherboard . i love the game just go to bios go no higher 3.80ghz cpu clock speed lone echo, im going to get some more ram memory ram put into my systems to see how it works on 32 ram still the same on 32 of memory ram no good this game made for hich end cpus. 8 cores is no good to play this game,  The 
best processor to go for ryzen threadripper 2920x with 12 cores 24 threads or intel i9 9900k if you konw whats the best CPU th go for this game ?
I am atuck on a level for about 8 hours now. I beleive there is a glitch
review_feedback: Hello there, thank you for your feedback! If you join the Support Channel in the community Echo Games Discord, we’d be happy to investigate your issue.

one_reviews_text: I haven't finished it yet (must not be too short, I've been playing for a while), but it's great so far. The zero gravity mechanics are awesome, just like the multiplayer echo arena. The scenery in this game is breathtaking. You can really sense the scale of the objects in space as you move around. Voice acting is well done. A very immersive and engaging experience. Not sure if replay value is here, but echo arena is a perfect compliment to this single player experience. A sequel is also confirmed. Easy to recommend. Well worth the price.

review_title: The best VR game I ever played.
one_reviews_text: The atmosphere is phenomenal, great graphics, great writing  / voice acting. For a VR game a good amount of content.  It's so polished, I think I never encountered a bug on my playthrough.

This game could be absolutely amazing if not for a game breaking bug when visiting the Primary Dig Site for the first time. It makes it literally impossible to progress further in the game. I don't know if I'm just unlucky or what, but I've found posts about the same issue I'm having from as far back as October of 2017, and the only way they found to get around it was by using someone else's save file. Apparently, over a year later, the issue still hasn't been fixed, so I have no hope that it will be fixed any time soon. As of this moment, I can't give this game a full, fair review, because I can't play the full game. I have apparently played more than 2 hours, but if I could I would have gotten a refund.
review_feedback: Hey there! Thanks for your feedback, and for reaching out. If you head on over to the Lone Echo Support Channel in the Community Echo Games Discord, we can investigate your issue and try to find a solution.

one_reviews_text: it has great graphics for vr better than most other games its worth no big issues

review_title: MUST own for Rift+Touch+3 Sensor setup!
one_reviews_text: This is one of the best VR games currently available, period. The storytelling is phenomenal, and the gameplay is great. It is not an action title, so if you are expecting to blow things up or shoot- it may not be for you. It is focused on the storytelling and character relationship building. If I didn't have a 360 degree 3 sensor setup I could see this being frustrating, but having full tracking made this title worthy.  Do yourself and get this game if you want to see what VR is capable of. I absolutely can't wait for the sequel!!!

This game has been by far one of the greatest games I have bought. Very fun, graphics are great. I understand that to make a game like this, it requires countless hours, and dollars. When I got this game, I took time to do most of the side quests, and just explore the map, but I still finished it in under five hours. I am not saying that this is a bad game, I loved it, what I am saying is, paying $40 for a game (no matter how well made) that lasted 5 hours, is dissapointing. Once again, loved the game, keep up the good work

review_title: What a great way to experience VR
one_reviews_text: I completly enjed that game !! Well done. Cant wait for Nr. 2 with maybe som shooter action ;)

review_title: very good game BUT motion sickness

The main reason I bought an oculus rift and it was worth every penny.  Amazing experience!  Can't wait for part 2!!
This is a must-have. Such a great game and story.

This is an actual video game.  Not a tech demo to show off some fancy VR features.  

It is a complete gaming adventure and one that can only be done in VR.  It is easily worth the price of admission and it one of the greatest experiences you can have with your headset.  

I hope this is a taste of where this technology wil take us in the future
I'll keep it short, I love this game. When I'm not playing it, I imagine I'm still inside and interacting.
Insipiring, breathtaking and fun

Space adventure for the rest of us. 

Can't wait for the sequel.

Keep up the good work!

If you want to experience a real VR experience, this is it.
Great story, great game play.
Cannot wait for the sequal.

The best game you can buy for VR (namely for Oculus Rift) of all time (for now). Perfectly developed interaction with environment and the movement leads you into a great story. You can touch everything (even the captain, but she will pull you away and say something "nice" to you). You can hit walls and objects with your head, so do not expect looking through textures, which is typical for some else VR games.
In this game is created whole your robotic body and its physic in zero gravity is very real. Graphic is very nice too, you will be amazed by more or less open outer space and by the interiors of mining station Kronos II. Graphic of characters (well, graphic of only one living person on this station – captain Olivia Rhodes) is very nice too.
The game is mostly an adventure, it has heavy mood of the unknown and of outer space. It is definitely not FPS. There are quests about searching, creating, connecting objects or energies together, etc.
First walkthrough is around 4 - 6 hours, which is pretty good since it is VR game. Lone Echo is perfect presentation of how powerfull VR games could be and how they should look and work.

Gaming set: GTX 970 4GB G1 / Intel I7 6770K 4GHZ / 16 GB RAM DDR4
I could not set the highest details, for smooth play I had to choose some medium details, some higher.
Several Times, i will put back to Oculus and a error report will be sent. I assume that happens if i do not follow the normal story flow, e.g. if i fly do the wrong place.
review_feedback: Hey there! Thanks for your feedback, and for reaching out. If you head on over to the Lone Echo Support Channel in the Community Echo Games Discord, we can investigate your issue and try to find a solution.

one_reviews_text: As others said this sets the benchmark for VR games.
You use your arms to throw yourself through 0g space. Cool game, gets slow towards the end. All in all one of my fav vr games

This game is so stupidly amazing that I almost cried when it was over, although the gameplay is basic, it completely fills your focus and the storyline and graphics are amazing, I intend on being the first to buy Lone Echo II when it comes out!

The two biggest things that struck me immediately are [1] how incredible everything looks and [2] how much it really feels like I'm in a weightless environment. The way you can pull yourself along and push off from surfaces is just fantastic. The only thing that was a little odd, was that you can't rotate by pushing with one hand and pulling with the other (which should turn you towards the "pulling" side). Since it is possible to rotate with the sticks, it doesn't impair gameplay, but it did detract (very slightly) from the total immersive feel.

I have seen some complaints that the missions are just "busy work", but to me that was part of the immersion. I really felt like I was zipping through space making repairs and I found it to be a lot of fun.  I also liked the way it used "calibration" as a way of introducing the various controls.

All in all, it's one of my favourite games on the Rift, and I'm very much looking forward to Lone Echo 2!

review_title: More likle this is what VR needs.

The only Captain Jack I will ever care about again. 10/10 will force all my friends to play.
The best VR game i've played in a long time. Must have!
just get it

I don't know where to begin with this game.  It was the first VR game I played all the way through and the first to convince me that VR is going to be the future default medium for storytelling, immersive or otherwise.   The art design is beautiful, the movement is smooth as butter thanks to the ingenious zero gravity obstacle-propelling, the story is engaging, and the fingers on the touch controls are made full use of with smooth (really cool) in-game button pressing (maybe not so amazing now that more developers are doing it).  I feel proud to have this as a Rift exclusive (looking the other way, ReVivers).  Do your self a favor and buy this game!

Also can't wait for the sequel, and equally impressed with the multiplayer EchoVR version of this game, which I believe is still free.

I bought a rift because of this game. I saw this game and wanted to experience, so by the end of that week I went and bought it.
  
Sadly I haven't played it since I first beat it. I don't really see it good for multiple playthroughs. But it's really engaging the first time. 
  
One of the better made VR games. Everything about it is so fluid and smooth, and carefully crafted to ensure it's the best experience it can be.
If this the future of VR games to come we wont need reality anymore. This is a must have game in your library!
Best game for VR at the moment :)

Very entertaining and indepth game ,series of "puzzels" to compleat .The thing i like most is you can either play the short game and finish the main parts of the game or you can do the smaller offshoots from the main parts .I must admit that the visor and light on the helmet are hit and miss but the game does play very well . 
gfx are very nice ,i invented my own mini game in Lone Echo ,grabbing Liv as she moves about and see how long i can get a free tug before she swats me off ! 
totally 10/10 from me and makes a huge difference from the usual point and shoot to kill something game ,lets be honest ,how long can you shoot something before it gets very boring but at 53 years old ,this is more my pace and yes ,i do have shooting games
This was my first game on my new Oculus. I realy like this game :) I think I will play it again. I want Lone Echo 2.

this is the best game I have bought, the game was amazing. I loved that it was in space, and that there was a body for the charecter you play as. It looked amazing and the small puzzles were fun. If you don't have this game you should buy it. Five stars!
It's really good, but $40 is a bit much. Buy it anyways. Best vr game I've ever played!
an amazing game & experience. i just want more!
I havent havent even played it but it is great.

Truly enjoyable experience. The creators made a wise choice centering their whole investment on one character - Olivia, and you really get drawn into the story emotionally. This is the ultimate proof-of-concept for VR storytelling.

review_title: Not much game here despite the good
one_reviews_text:
Pros:
Visually stunning
Great sound and voice acting
Wonderful VR implementation/interaction

Cons:
Not much in the way of gameplay to be found, and what there is, isn't fun, rather it is more like tedious busy work.

Verdict:
If you are looking for a fantastic narrative VR story experience with a bit of exploration and light puzzle/gameplay elements, this is 4-5 stars and worth the full price.  If you are looking for gameplay/challenge/similar then definately pass on this and play Echo Arena and/or Echo Combat instead.
Very interesting controls, probably should have a 3 camera system to avoid some frustration, looking forward to the sequel

review_title: Awesome, cant wait for Lone Echo 2
one_reviews_text:
Im impressed by everything in this game. The graphics are top notch, atmosphere just as it should be, the way you move works perfect but most of all what made me most impressed is the actors voices and their lines. Im stunned to actually feel the connection between the two and the feeling grows with the story. I'm not finished yet even though I have played many hours. 

I put it like this. You go out on a pub and spend quite much cash for some hours to have fun or you can get this gem and spend many more for less so its def worth the price. Can't wait for Lone Echo 2. Good job guys!
Hands down the best VR experience thus far.. my only hope is that most developers hold this standard when developing a game.
Easily one of my favorites. I'm really looking forward to more of these types of games in VR.

I can only say that not only is this a great VR title, it's also a great story!  Yes, it's not everyones speed, but it is a very well done science fiction story with characters you can't help but love.  This game is proof that not every game has to have a multiplayer component to be good.  I cannot wait for part 2.  Will be a day one purchase for me.  If you are new to VR and love SCI-FI you can't go wrong with this one.

Thoroughly enjoyed every moment of this game. There were some moments that I struggled to solve (I'm not a puzzle guy), but overall it was fantastic. All the way up to the very end. Speaking of the end: Maybe because the rest of the experience was so amazing, the ending was a huge let down. Maybe they're working on a sequal. I don't know, but the very last moments did not feel like a true ending. It was like  "well...here we are, now what?" and then roll credits. I really hope there will be a next chapter.

The controls were very intuitive. The movement was smooth and the graphics are excellent. No trouble running at high settings (AMD Ryzen 7 1800x : Geforce 1070oc).  Definitely recommend this if you're looking for a chill space adventure.
Absolutly fell in love with the zero-g environment and completely enthralled with the plot.  I ended up playing through the night too many times because I just got so immersed in this game!

When you get tired of smashing in Gorn heads and want to take a break from yourself. This so far has to be epitome of what VR is meant to be. The Liv character was the best I have seen in game tech for realism. Jaw dropping, massive space scenes. Top notch voice acting. Had a good story to tell. A bit promtheus-esce. I couldn't ask for a better space experience. Found myself just taking in the sceneery. Trying to cop a feel from Liv was always entertaining. The game is long lasting. Left mee tearig up in the end. Darn you guys for playing with my emotions! I actually was blown away with the light speed jump and reactor powering up. All kinds of novel and effective ways for you to work controls in VR.  I am glad I played this before the Lone Echo 2 comes out. Hope to see more ultra-realistic characters in the next!!!!

This is one of the best VR experiences ever. Lone Echo is an epic adventure that uses the VR possibilities of this moment in a more than special way. I have played the game twice now. The first time completely seized by the exciting storyline. The second time more in an exploratory way. And even after two times it seems worthwhile to relive this virtual universe one more time again. And my avatar Jack .... definitly more than a robot .... Experience it yourself. Enjoy!

Throughout the years certain games have come to define a genre of game or piece of hardware and this feels like one of those.   This game feels beautifully designed - the experience could only be done in VR.  

The control method, the story, the gorgeous graphics, the depth - all come together to show what can be done in VR when great minds come together with a purpose.

It's not cheap but it's worth every penny - the game lasts a long time and you fully get your moneys worth.  It's no longer a new game but even playing in now made we stare in wonder at some of the effects and design.

I have to give it 5 stars but it is not perfect.  The gameplay is a little simplistic and often repetititve and you get frustrated at times when you cannot proceed and get stuck but the story drives you on as there feels like a real purpose to your mission.

We simply need more games with this amount of polish and craft to really make VR take off - for me the VR market feels like the old 8 bit days when every man and his dog was having a go making a quick buck.  This is different - it feels like an epic - you should not hesitate in buying it.
This was one of my first experiances and this is amazing. I have i5,1060 3GB i had the graphics low but still  the 0 gravity experiance and the story is a wow mind blowing.

review_title: The most believable VR experience ever
one_reviews_text: Because the motion mechanic involves using your hands to move, you really feel like you're there moving around. The story is excelent and voice acting superb. The outer space sequences are completely breathtaking.

This is one of the very few VR games that have felt like a AAA finished release. An excellent example of the quality and polish that all VR games should strive to reach. If you have an Oculus Rift or like me you have the better alternative that shall remain nameless as not to be censored. This game is a must have for all VR owners. Get it now.

One of the most visually stunning titles in VR, so far...It's a reason to invest in the technology. Gameplay is tight and focused and you never feel that you arent in control of your avatar. As I am only a hour or more into the game as of this review what I have experienced is a AAA level VR game that is a true showcase of what's possible with a good developer behind it.

Lastly... know that you WILL need a good cpu and gpu to run this game, but if you have the goods then be prepared to be wowed visually and sonically. I can't recommend this game enough.

review_title: by far the best VR game I've played
one_reviews_text: This game is so well crafted and balanced that the moment you enter you really feel like you're flying around Jupiter , I'm not gonna lie then I say that these game made my heartrate go up quite often but the story and and world is amazing , if you like adventure games this one is for you !
This game is the reason why VR is awesome! Very Immersive, and great story line! I had a ton of fun playing it!

This games is so immersive that it makes your real life feel virtual.
It is truly astonishing. Graphics, Mechanics & story 10/10.

I was hesitant to drop $40 on a game that would only last me 6-9 hours, but I do not regret it one bit. This game is a fantastic story-driven game with a massive focus on experience, atmosphere, and ambience. You play as Echo One, a robot with exceptional intelligence aiding a station's captain, Olivia. You wake up on Olivia's last week as an interstellar anomaly knocks the station's systems awry. 

This game's appeal is the huge steps towards adding immersion it takes. Your whole robot body is rendered, from head to foot, and your body collides with the environment. Since you are in space, the movement system basically treats your robot hands as if you were Spiderman, allowing you to grab any anchored object to propel yourself forward. You also have 3 sets of thrusters to perform small boosts, large boosts, and braking boosts. The movement system combined with the full-body rendering create an instantly immersive experience that had me grabbing the air to move if I dropped my controller.

The gameplay and story are solid as well. The gameplay mostly consists of doing cool space stuff, exploring, and repairing things. The story takes a huge focus on your (Jack's) relationship with the captain, Olivia. Olivia is the only human you ever talk to at length and one of only 5 or so characters with dialogue. This doesn't detract at all, and it serves to aid the game's theme.

Overall, this game defies numerical rating. It is a must-play game and experience that is easily a killer app for the Rift.

There are a lot of great games in many styles (Beat saber, Robo Recall are other must have). 

Bust this one is the most immersive, story driven game I played in VR. 

If you like Sci-Fi, buy it. If you don't buy it anyway and try it for 2 hours, you can refund it, but in my opinion, it is a "must-have" game.
Please fix issue with r9 290 graphic card ! can't play more than 20 sec before crashing -_-'
review_feedback: Hey there! Thanks for your feedback and for reaching out. If you join the community Echo Games Discord, we'd be happy to investigate your issue and try to find a solution.

one_reviews_text:
This was one of the first VR experiences I've had, and sadly, it's kind of spoiled me. It wasn't until I started playing a handful of other VR games did I not begin to really appreciate the design of this game. The concept of free floating, and being able to grab anything and interact with them, although might be a small detail, but just brings the whole experience to life.

The movement and controls is what really blew me away the first time around. Being in Zero G, the mechanics of grabing onto, well, anything, and pushing and pulling yourself, is such an immersive and fluid feeling. The gadgets on your wrist and how you use them throughout the game is very well implimented, you feel like a repair droid, and everything just feels like it's all in your control.

The visuals are absolutely stunning. Going for a more realistic look, space has never looked so gorgous, and being able to float around and explore outside of your ship, you get a serious sense of scale and how vast space is, it's stunning.

It's true, this game doesn't have much to offer in the way of "missions", it's the common "fix this, get that" type, but the story behind everything, and the character you play as and you play with, are very well done, along with the stunning visuals and smooth gameplay, you actually *want* to do these "chores". The story is really interesting, and does keep you thinking as you play through the game.

Simply an amazing experience for a VR game, I absolutely recommend it to anyone into VR.
One of the best VR game i played so far

review_title: A wonderful preview of things to come.
one_reviews_text:
This was such a great VR experience. Immersive cannot begin to describe. Made my investment in VR much more worthwhile.

The game itself if you stripped it down to bare bones is a job simulator (complete tasks under various pressures and circumstances), but the environment and narrative bring it to a whole other level. The voice acting is superb, and the attention to detail is great. 

Great controls that really bring you into the game. I cannot say enough good things about it. If you have an Oculus you owe it to yourself to play this game. More like this and you have my money all day long.

review_title: A must have experience in VR
one_reviews_text: after more than 10h of gameplay I can only say that I am close to speachless with this game other than saying that its one of the most great realisation made in vr for vr.  visually and gameplay are at the top of what can be created today as for top quality.   You feel that you are a robot you feel the space, the zero g gameplay and the story it very intriguing and enjoyable from start to finish. A must have imo for the greatest VR experience made until today.
This is the pinnacle of VR at the moment. The team behind it have done an amazing job with the story, art, gameplay, UI, audio, you name it. Look forward to number 2!

This is a must-have for vr. The zero-g physics are amazing, the scenary and graphics left me in awe at times, and the relationship between Jack and Liv is phenomenal. It is one of the best games I have ever played. Maybe I just say that because I've been searching for a realistic game on a space station forever, but I love the game nontheless. My specs are:

NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 6GB
Intel Core i7-7700
Corsair 16 GB DDR4-3000 Memory

This is what VR was made for, an experience you cannot do in RL. I know the videos make the graphics look a little dated but seriously, once you are in there that fades. The movement and story... OMG.

Stunning grapics. Amazing adventure, story and activities to perform. The immersion is so good, with only a few moments in the game you feel engaged, you have a sens of responsability, stress, everything.... you are 100% part of the adventure.
I only review exceptional games, this one of greats, great graphics, great plot, great characters and extremely immersive.

review_title: One of the best VR games
one_reviews_text: I had an amazing time with this title. My favorite game along with Robo Recall.

This was such an amazing experience from the start and only kept getting better and better as you progressed, especially once you complete all the tutorial "modules". A must-have if you own a rift. Gripping story and fantastically immersive gameplay. I would definitely recommend buying this.
Best Story Based VR game ever, Can't wait for the Sequel ! ! !

I've played all the "best" games available at the time in VR. This is for sure the best one, with native support. The other one which I'd put there, for totally different merits, is Fallout 4 VR. You can't go wrong with this game, buy it without thinking. I have very big expectations about Lone Echo 2.. Hope developers are doing their best to push the bar further!

review_title: If you are new to VR, play this first.
one_reviews_text:
This was one of my first VR full game experiences and holy was it ever one.

Right from the beginning i knew i was going to like this game, flying around in Zero-G on the space station doing little tasks, then out in space doing other little tasks could have been an awesome game in its own...then half way through something happens and it just goes from awesome to amazing.

Dont watch the trailers, dont look anything up, go in blind and just enjoy this game, if you like space and want a really immersive space exploration game, get this ASAP. Best game on Oculus.

review_title: Simply Great VR game w loads of Fun
one_reviews_text: IMO it is the showcase of VR graphics with an AMD RX580 oc'd and Ryzen 5 CPU 16GB DDR4 settings maxed out and very smooth FPS. Its roughly 5hrs of story driven gameplay and has some amazing film like qualities that keep you engaged. You can play at your own pace at certain points throughout the story however, you find yourself racing the clock a fair amount as well which makes sense in regards to the overall story plot. The last 1-2 hours of the game will remind you of certain Halo/Mass effect moments along with maybe "event horizon" vibes that I really appreciated and kept me sucked into the VR experience.

review_title: you certainly get what you pay for!
one_reviews_text:
Incredible game, absolutely fantastic presentation both graphics and sound, the attention to detail in places is amazing. The responses from completely random interactions are so genuine you can't help but have a chuckle to yourself.

best use of the touch controllers by far, physically touching your wirst with your index finger to open your scanner, something as simple as that when done right makes it incredibly immersive, just finished the story and it took me 8 hours to complete! That's about 2 hour straight sessions, never been pulled into a vr game for so long!

Will be playing through again to see what other conversations can be had.

Don't hesitate like I did, BUY THIS GAME over any of the other higher priced titles, I promise you they wont be anywhere near as polished as this game is.
just do it

I read so many reviews of this game (mostly positive) so I decided to give it a try. I was NOT dissappointed. This is the type of game this system was built for, it shows the many different ways that VR can be utilized. The gameplay was captivating, the very second I was in the game I was hooked. Played the game with only two bathroom breaks, could not break away from the story. If you haven't bought this game yet, you should seriously consider it and see what VR can really do!

Really really wanted to put 5 stars.

This game is fantastic.  It's not for those that are looking for action packed, it's for those wanting to feel fully immersed in another reality, where what you do has more meaning than just killing stuff off.

It has a great story going for it and as I got deeper into it I was even more anxious to hear the rest.

Graphics are hella nice.  I'm running them at full everything and the debug tool with my setup, but even before I had a more powerful card I was impressed.

Now why not 5 stars?  Well, there is some redundancy to it.  That part is not too bad though but what really cost the star was when I got deep into the story there were parts where I spent more time hunting for items than actually progressing the story.  I haven't completed the game yet but I definitely will and look forward to the ending.
One of the best VR games I've ever played, love the robot design and I love the ability to answer and ask questions to Liv, really amazing game and can't wait for Lone Echo 2! My robot body is READY!
This was the first game I bought for my Rift and it's the best so far. It's fully immersive, the interactivity with the environment is outstanding, and the plot is thoroughly enjoyable.

review_title: Amazing!! Lenovo VR Steam Revive app.
one_reviews_text:
Played on Lenovo Win VR through Steam on Revive App
Good story and brilliant game play, how VR should be done. I was able to run at quite high settings, so the graphics are the best I have seen from a VR game and the immersion that you’re in space and weightless is brilliantly done. The views of the space around the station are beautiful. For a non-combat game focusing on survival I was amazed how much fun it was and would love them to make another. 
More of this please!
Played on Lenovo Win VR through Steam on Revive App, GTX1080 graphics but still crashed first couple of times after 5min of game play, I turned the Ultra-high Beta graphics off and it would then crash after 2hr of solid gameplay restarting at the last save point, long enough in VR. I Think it was crashing due to having to  run SteamVR, windowsVR , Oculus Revive and the Game all at the same time on a i5 6600 CPU.
As others have said, this game is definately worth getting. I could not stop playing. This is AAA quality stuff. If you enjoy sci-fi or not, I would highly suggest getting it.
I'ts a real amazing experience with a good plot in a very stunning enviroment. I was expecting something more complex... or long.. 40 euro for 4 hours of play is too much...

I must be unique because even though there are a lot of great reviews I found this game to be super boring.  The graphics are cool and the interface is nice but the story and game play are far from intersting and exciting (at least as far as I played). I played for 45 painful minutes and simply could not bring myself to endure it anymore.

Perhaps I am just not the kind of person this game is targeted to. I like some action and excitement. If you like just floating around doing menial tasks this might be for you.

This is a great space adventure, I just hope the make more of it. Overall a super nice game. There are a few quarks of irritation but just fiddla a bit and it will work perfectly. Interaction with some items (batteries) worker legs (attaching them) are a bit tricky. Worth playing....

review_title: The best single player experience in VR
one_reviews_text: The control design and character interaction is amazing. Doing tasks around the station and in space introduce you to important concepts that you use throughout the game later as things get more and more interesting. I can't wait to see what Ready at Dawn does next with this IP.

Staggeringly good game.

The most detailed and immersive experience in VR so far.

Awesome twists and some brilliant moments. 

This is one to buy.

review_title: A Terrific Experience, A Mediocre Game
one_reviews_text:
Lone Echo is an excellent VR experience that really shows how immersive the medium can be and what it can bring to the table that is different from traditional gaming.  The character interactions and the way you interact with the environment are fantastic, particularly in the early sections.  It is not an action packed game: on the contrary, it's at its best when it's simply tasking you with doing normal things in this other world.

Unfortunately, it tries to be more of an actual game in the 2nd half: the storytelling fades into the background and there's ways to die everywhere.  Without spoiling too much, the game does away with its great traversal system where you can throw yourself off of objects by making 90% of surfaces punish you for touching them.  It's not as harsh as it sounds (if you take it slow, it's not that difficult), but it begins to feel very tedious and despite the game's length of 5 hours, the repetitive nature of the 2nd half actually made me wish the game were shorter.

Overall, it's an experience you must try to really see what VR is capable of.  However, due to the second half feeling fairly weak, I would recommend waiting until it drops to $30 instead of the standard $40 price.
That's the real deal!!

I don't usually write reviews for VR games, but this game was just too good. Amazing story, breathtaking graphics, great mechanics, and floating around in zero gravity is just awesome in virtual reality. Definitely a must have for the Oculus.
Excellent journey, you will love this game.. take it at your own pace and enjoy the total emersion... Just a wonderful experience and a must have in your collection.

This was THE game i was looking forward to in VR and it did not dissapoint.  The visuals really bring you into the world and the way they covered movement really immerses you in a zero-G enviroment.  There aren't really any puzzles, just tasks to do and things to interact with.  But the core of the game is the relationship they build between the characters.  You start to form a real bond with your partner, the storytelling is really well done.

I bought it full price and lasted about 9 hours.   If you can get this on sale, which i've only seen it on sale once, you should definatly grab it.
One of the best games on Oculus, a must buy. Great story, graphics and mechanics. This game has to have a sequel... Please!!!!

All i have to say is you really need to buy this games 
it is so worth the money .
Excellent and immersive VR experience. Loved the space mechanic gameplay some other people seem to be bashing.

The gameplay is fun with the feeling of being in zero gravity
The graphics were amazing to look at
and the story was developed well with lots of depth to it
all in all one of my favourite games

This game made me sad...because it ended :(

It only took me about 6ish hours to finish so keep that in mind. However it was entertaining and immersive the entire experience. 40 bucks seems high but I feel like it's a game I'd play through again in the future or show off to friends. DEFINITELY get it if it's on sale. It rarely does though. This is one of those rare games that feels worth the full price tag to me. 

When it ended I was disappointed. Not because it was a bad ending but because I wanted it to keep going. Would buy a sequal or prequal in a heart beat. Please make more games like this! :) 

Nice job to everyone who was involved on this project!

Not sure who in their right mind own's an Oculus Rift and hasn't bought this yet, just wanted to add another 5* review as game deserves it.
Perfect use of VR, brilliant locomotion, great immersion, unique gameplay not shooty, great everything yada yada why are you still reading this buy it already!
This game is just great and very immersive
I'm quite enjoying this game and how well VR works with it. I would definitly recommend it.
A must have game for anyone with a VR

This game does use many VR opportunuties in a lot of different ways and shows what this type of gaming can achieve. It is an incredible example and should be used as reference for future games.
Although I did not really like the ending I still think the whole thing was an incredible experience and should be in everyone's occulus library.
Buy this.
game play comfortable, amazing graphic, phissic cool! we wanna more games like this!
What can I say that hasn't already been said? One of the absolute best VR games made. If you don't own this what are you doing?!?

review_title: This is what VR gaming is about
one_reviews_text: It has the quality of being the forerunner for VR games of the future. This is VR as it SHOULD be.  Amazing interactivity, amazing storyline, epic scenery, exploration and just... I can't recommend this game enough.  So much detail, so much fun, I was gutted when the adventure ended.  Probably one of the best games I have ever played.  More like this please.

review_title: This is a MUST HAVE game for VR
one_reviews_text: When I finally decided to purchase a VR headset it was with much trepidation.  I feared that I was blowing money on something that would just collect dust when the novelty wore off.  At first I thought I was right after starting off with a few free and budget titles.  Then I purchased Lone Echo and found my investment in VR to be completely validated. To me this game embodies the potential of VR as a first class  gaming platform.   This game really feels like it was built from the ground up to be in VR and the controls were thoughtfully developed for the medium.  Ambulating in the zero-g environment is so intuitive and and fun it quickly becomes second nature.  As the difficulty curve starts to set in you'll find find yourself using the grab, boost, and thrust controls to negotiate your way through challenging and dangerous environments with a sense of purpose.  Your hands aren't just virtual pointers like many of the other games I've tried.  They are completely integrated into the experience.   Heads up display?  Nope.  They keep your mind grounded in the environment by making you look at your wrist to check your status.  Even the dialogue options are cleverly integrated into the game space using a virtual menu interface.  All of this adds up to a truly immersive experience when it comes to how you interact with the game world but how is the story?  I'm glad you asked.  Lone Echo isn't some grand opus that expects you to invest yourself in it's world history and culture.  It's an episode and a well done one at that.   The story is strong enough within this finite space that you  actually become invested in it without being encumbered with excess baggage.  I could go on but I'm running out of space so I'll finish with a pointer.  The view control is "stepped" as a default.  I highly recommend changing it to a more fluid setting.  If motion sickness is a concern I recommend using Sea-Bands.  I got mine for less than $10 and they worked like a charm.

As the first VR game experience it was a mind blowing, fantatic introduction to VR. Easy to manuever game mechanics and good story line in a totally immersive, shockingly expansive environment. I'm hooked!

review_title: Best game VR has to offer to-date.
one_reviews_text: From the very beginning, I was hooked.  The story pulls you right in and the play control is just complex enough to give you the control you want without having to completely reteach yourself everytime you take a break for a few days.  Very Intense!

review_title: Fun to play, not that good of a story
one_reviews_text: (SPOILERS AHEAD) The gameplay mechanics were fun, and there were some intense moments in the story, however, the story itself was simple and dull, the ending was not great and could have been easily tweaked to make it better. The expierence was enjoyable, but not worth the 40$ I spent on it.

This is one of the first VR games I have ever played and I really hope this is where the bar will be set.  It's great not just because of  the VR experience, but VR is what made me feel so tiny and insignificant when you finally get out in the open.  There's so many questions introduced to you, and after 8 or 9 hours, the game came to a great conclusion, answering as much as I could have hoped for, while only giving me new questions in the very last minutes to hopefully be answered by a sequel.

review_title: Play for the controls / VR mechanics
one_reviews_text: ...and the story as the cherry on top.  This felt so immersive and intuitive.  Want more challenge getting around?  There are other options you'll find... do some digging if you want different locomotion, very fun.

What a game... It's shot only because I so badly wanted more and more... 8 hours was enough for me to say that I'd pay a subscripion for this AND the full price fee. This is a AAA developer in the making.

Simply put: This is the best VR game available. Incredible atmosphere, incredible graphics, incredible immersion, incredible controls... This is exactly what VR is made for. Congratulations to the dev team for this masterpiece.

This game of exploration, discovery and repair is fun and breathteaking every step of the way. So emersive you can easily forget you are playing a game. A minor glitch when I progressed too fast and had to backtrack to trigger the next step of the story so I give it a 9.5/10. I can't put it down.

Wow...
Ive been gaming for 30 years and this is by far, without a single doubt the most immersive and amazing experience in my entire gaming history!
The movement around in zero g is flawless, the graphics are incredible and the story is excellent.
I simply can not reccomend this game enough.

This is what VR is all about - superb immersion, twisting, dragging, love to detail and the best locomotion movement there is. I could watch the hand grab surfaces all my life and enjoy the view. Please make this a multiplayer Khronos II Survival Station!

review_title: One of the greatest, a must-have
one_reviews_text: Don't let that price tag discourage you, this game, with it's near flawless locomation, excellent characters, compelling story, and the wide open enviroment  you get to experience later in the game, I highly, HIGHLY, recommend this to anyone looking for a good VR game, there are even some nice easter-egg hunts which allow for replayability, and if you get bored of this, it's free sibling-game echo-vr is also a spectacular blast!

review_title: The very best VR game to date.
one_reviews_text: Even after this long time since release.
Honestly just doing a lot of boring tasks (fix this, cut this, scan this).  But the plot is somewhat intriguing and you can grab ANYTHING so that's fun

I would recommend this game as one of your VR starter pack for the following reasons:
- Great storytelling 
- Fair amount of play time (around 15 hrs)
- Plenty of VR controls (thruster, grabbing, laser, etc)
- Plenty to explore (good map size)
- Great for experiencing VR

This is a game I feel the developers really dedicated their effort.

This is the best Game in VR jet made. I play it on the Samsung Odissey via "Revive". It works perfect!
The Graphics are absolutelly gorgeous. The Immersion in this game is perfect. Everything! 
If you dont own it, buy it! It is absolutely worth it. 
Happy to see Lone Echo 2 soon.
Thanks to the Developers for this great experience.
Very well done.

If you want a singleplayer sci-fi, story-driven fps with free locomotion for VR. This is about as good as it gets. But it's also the only game available on Oculus that has these features :). It's not perfect and feels a bit grindy at times, but it's definitely one worthy of your vr-rig. And most VR games do not.

Hands down the best VR game I've played to date. The quality game mechanics, atmosphere and captivating story make for an extremely immersive and fun experience. The only negative for me is that this game sets the bar so high, that most other VR games now pale in comparison. I can't wait for a sequel!
So far one of the most outstanding experiences on the rift.  Very well done. Nice graphics, nice story, nice movment. Everything fits. So blasted. Recommend the buy.

review_title: Expect to make a new friend
one_reviews_text: Amazing mechanics and one of the best VR games to date.

review_title: Ruined other VR games for me.
one_reviews_text:
Let me explain, the story and the VR experience were so good that most other games aren't on the same level.
I still haven't finished the story yet! But i never want it to end! The gameplay and movement is amazing! the puzzle solving is fun and the story is gripping! The only reason it loses a star is due to issues with it crashing at a certain point. I don't want to give any of the story away, but if you experience the same, google the problem and there were plenty of threads which helped me carry on playing!

review_title: This is how VR games should be!
one_reviews_text:
... in any measure:
- Top graphics
- Top gameplay
- Top story
- Top controls

Everybody who is not allergic to space should play this in my opinion

Of all the vr games I've played, this is by far the best. Smooth controls, very immersive, the story is interesting, and visually stunning. I'm scared no games will compare. If someone mixes this feel with a full RPG, I think I'll have found my perfect game...

I've only been able to make it past three of the calibration (tutorial scenes) before the lag and stuttering comes into play. The FPS drops incredible amounts and the game is no longer playable. I have some of the best specs for a PC and this is the only VR game I can't play. I'm sure the story is great, but this game needs to be optimized before I can give it 5 stars. I'd like to get my money back.

This was the first title I played in VR because I'm a sucker for Sci-Fi and this experience did not disappoint. It has atmosphere in spades, oodles of interactivity and a captivating narrative. It's not too short or too long. I had hoped for a mind-blowing, 2001-esque finale, because the game certainly puts all the building blocks in place for such an ending, but I loved it all the same. Here's hoping that the second installment, if there ever is one, rises to my expectations. This was money well spent.

This is the first game where I can just chill in it floating around for hours in space and forget I'm sitting in a chair in my house.   The setup for the story is excellent, and before you know it, the game ends. I really wish it had more gameplay.  I hope they make expansion packs for this.
Deeply touching at many levels, great space to explore, awesome immersion. Great job folks!

I just finished the game and I am very happy I purchased this, it was amazing. I wish there were more games like this one. Great voice acting, great gameplay even though it got just a tad repetitive towards the end but it was still fun. Story was written well as well but I think that the game ended a bit too soon or abruptly but it is not really that big of a deal. I think its just that I wanted to play for longer.
The easter eggs are hilarious
Amazing experience.
Play this game for an hour or two and try not pushing away from the walls when you walk through your house :)

review_title: i really want to love this game
one_reviews_text: ive never been one to get easily queasy, but the moving system in this drifiting through space just gets me the right way where i just simply cant enjoy this game. i was really excited about getting into a good story on oculus, but its really unfortunate i just cant get past the nausea.

This game feels great and has very comfortable and natural zero G movement.  The story seems a little short, but each scenario manages to create some new stress without being scary.  I thought the puzzles were a little shallow, but the movement is what's really cool about this game.  And the movement is REALLY cool.

Easily earns 5 stars.

(A third sensor probably would have been nice, but I personally got used to the thumbstick turning pretty quickly and never felt disadvantaged.)

review_title: A Must Play For Oculus Owners
one_reviews_text: After the First 60 Seconds Of Gameplay was blown' away by what was seen and done. Need more brilliant VR games like this, and Lone Echo is the 1st example to hopefully many to come!

I'm really not quite sure why this game gets so much praise, aside from it being one of the few AAA full-length VR games there really isn't much going for it. The VR controls, although very fluid are used for just repetative and trivial tasks. Sure I appreciate the change of pace from typical VR shooty games but this goes too far the other direction making me just feel like a mechanic. 

This wouldn't be so bad if the tasks you have to do didn't feel so overtly video-gamey; a moment that comes to mind was when a character gave me the objective of "activate these three consols in less than 70 seconds, or the system resets!"

Story wise its pretty typical sci-fi stuff, and although its all quite well acted its thurougly predictable and you'll know pretty much how its going to go by the half way mark if you're well-versed in the genre. 

I appreciate the attempt to make a full-lengh "ground-up" VR game and we certainly need more of these but if it weren't for this game being one of the first I really don't think it would be so highly regarded.

review_title: Far and away the best VR game
one_reviews_text:
The graphics are unbelievable considering the available resolution. The game has beautiful assets that will just blow you away. The mechanics work almost perfectly, the feeling of immersion is the best you can get right now and the hand animation... Oh, the hand animation. Sometimes I would just stop and look at my hands for like 10 minutes straight. The detail and realism are just unbelievable.  The story offers a lot, even if they could have gotten even more out of their narrative design with a bit more planning ahead of time.
The locomotion is revolutionary, the same goes for user interface. It's a complete game changer and the fact that this kind of intuitive control is even possible ensures the future of this medium. Thank you, dear creators, for making this game. (The only thing left to work on here is the flat menu)
My only major complaint: Why would you put a jar of peanuts on the ship, fit the animation gesture perfectly and then make it impossible to open??? Every single person who has tried this game on my system has tried to open it. That would be the little cherry on top of the regular cherry on top of the sundae of awesome that is this game.
Now go play Lone Echo.

review_title: Best VR game I've played so far.
one_reviews_text:
This game is phenomenal. Bought it full price and its certainly worth it. The gameplay and story are both great. 

You might feel a bit nauseous at first but you quickly get used to it. The game is zero G but the devs have provided you with a 'down' at all times, which makes it very bearable (So don't worry if you played anything like the ISS sim and got sick, its not like that) but still retains the feeling of floating around. 

Performance wise you might have some hiccups as it is quite demanding. However, I managed to play it just fine on low on a 780 ti. Some unofficial tricks are to minimize the mirror view of the game on your regular monitor, which I've found to help me quite a lot. Should you start having FPS drops restarting might help. If I played for an extended period and as a result loaded quite some areas (going outside was the first instance of this happening) I noticed the game began bogging down, which a restart fixed, albeit temporarily, in my case. This is was only a problem early on in the game, later areas I could play for 3-4 hours without a restart.

The story is captivating and the interactions are great, I'm unsure if different reactions give you different endings though.

Truly worth a try, and if you're still unsure, pick it up during sales and you won't regret it.

I... hardly can say how great this THING is. It is not just a game. Great sci-fi story. I just love it. Will definitelly play again. This game is must for all people who like sci-fi, space...  There is just one thing I'd recommend to improve. They should supply some watertank with it to improve the feeling of weightlessness. :-) Movement is so natural there that after two days of this game I am touching things around as I walk even in real life. :-) Thanks Ready at dawn! (Even read the credits, thanks for tips on tools)

review_title: Best VR adventure game, hands down
one_reviews_text:
Best VR game to date I've played. Narrative is strong, acting and scenarios are very good too. There's a bit of a learning curve here as you adapt to adventure games in VR, but with some time you get a knack for it.

If you're looking for the best adventure experience in VR, this is it.
This game is like Cthulhu...it cant be described ;D The immersion is 11/10 ....this is the future of entertainment....

I decided to buy this game finally, was waiting for a sale but decided why not just get it for 40$. Has more bugs than fortnite and thats free!
