I made 1 campaign run just tonight and got to the part where you first go into space to fix the 3 broken areas. Well, the primary dig site battery is glitched I can't pull it out of the case. The processing line coils are permanently stuck I can't move them at all (like before in the botany area), but miraculously the container area had no bugs. Sweet, so I just put in 3 hours for nothing cause I'll have to make a save from scratch since i'm stuck. I bet i'll run into the bugs again! There are other bugs I've read about but haven't seen yet so i'm excited. Ya maybe I don't have 16gb of ram but who fn does seriously! Stick to echo arena that has no bugs

review_title: Brilliant! Works great on my old rig
one_reviews_text: The game is just brilliant. New to VR world since a few weeks, this is my fav game so far. All the interaction with Liv is awesome, funny and impressive, details of texture and environement is awesome. Story is cool. I cannot even describe how nice it is, awesome job done there from all teams (DEV, Artists, scripters/writers etc..). As for system wise, i was pulling back from buying the game because all the review readings i'Ve made, since i'm having an old system. Since people mostly said they started getting massive FPS issues when going outside. I then decided to give a try and bought it, put all settings on medium as most people with less recent cpu and stuff were having better results. I just got outside tonight and things were runing so smooth, i decided to give a try and put all settings to High, well can'T say the FPS has i dunno how to show it in the Rift, but as my eyes can say, it's running as smooth as a hot knife through butter, i cannot complain, so as the guy a few post from me said, with a high end system/computer, he can't even pass the calibration because he gets massive FPS lost, and on my side, my old I7-2600k 3.4 GHz stock not OCed, 16g RAM, EVGA GTX 1070sc 8g on windows 10 (system and games on SSD's) runs all smooth on High settings, so on my side, i,m happy to gave a chance to the game and bought it. Sad some people are having issues. :(

You play as an advanced robot with AI personality, stuck aboard a mining station near Saturn with your human captain when a weird anomaly disrupts your daily routine and causes significant damage to the station. The next hours will be spent fixing broken systems, scanning disabled cube sats and navigating hazardous spaces filled with radiation or mineral cutting laser beams. All in zero G and beautiful graphics.

But that's not the highlight - the story and its presentation is. The voice work is flawless and you will immediately bond with your human partner, having actual conversations with smalltalk, jokes and emotional or thrilling moments. And just when you THINK the game is about to end, there's another three to four hours of content waiting for you to master in an unexpected finale.

Granted, this last act is probably the weakest. The Khronos II mining stations is spectacular and varied - both on the inside and outside. The last environment, however, looks a bit too repetitive, making navigation harder and annoying. It's still good, but not AS good as before and it starts to drag and repeat itself in the last hour or so.

Controls are near flawless and the game can be played both seated or in roomscale. Rarely I could feel a bit motion sick, but it never got too bad and I definitely had a few multi-hour play sessions without pauses. Just... just don't use the "vomit comet" too much (you'll know what I mean when you find it).

Yeah, most immersive VR game yet, which is not just a simple shooting gallery, but a full-blown game making good use of everything that VR has to offer. Great storytelling and characters, lots of stuff to do, amazing graphics and pretty long playtime (about 8-10 hours I'd guess). Seriously, get it.
I love sci-fi stories and this one made me feel I was in the story. I just wish it were longer. I hope they make a sequel or something.

Abosolutely mind blowing "game".
Amazing voice acting, great and unique locomotion and cool setting of the world space.

* Great movement controls and puzzle mechanics.
* Great dialogue system
* Great story
* Excellent graphics
* I also liked how we can see our own body, the respawn in-game realism, the fact that when dying the previous android is still there later and the human-interaction with Liv.
WE NEED MORE GAMES LIKE THIS!!!!!              PART 2???

I am kind of a technic neard, so VR was an absolute must have. And when I am playing a game I am not missing anything: Grafics, Sounds, Gameplay, Story, Characters, ect. it has to be perfect (nearly).

But Lone Echo is the absolutley most advanced, immersive, beautiful and greatest games I have EVER played. The developers are doing something magic with the characters of Liv and Jack, which I can't explain. It's freaking amazing ...
Took me 10 hours to complete but boy was it a ride. Perfect VR game mechanics and story.

If you don't purchase this game you are missing out on one of the best VR experiences you can have. Simply amazing! Don't make the mistake of passing it up even at full price. Goes on sale occasionally but worth every penny. Buy it, you won't regret it.

It's great
It's long enought, intriguing plot, a bit of mystery that got unveiled.
Good mechanics, engaging environment, space.
A bit repetitve, but not too much.
I like it, I would give 4.5 stars.
Haven't seen better story game on Oculus.
brilliant !!! set s the standard ... and nothing else compares

review_title: Probably one of the best VR games
one_reviews_text: Really inmersive. Good story and intercations. However, some of the areas in which you have to avoid (SPOILER) that can one hit kill you, was one of the most boring gamplay experiences in the game for me. Also, the ending was a little bit lacking, even tho what lead to the ending was really good. In short, it's still a solid VR game and it's a must have, specially if it's on sale.

This is by far the best VR game I've played yet. It's highly polished and beautiful with a great story. Here's a link to my video playthrough.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GX0xDozpkKc
The game is one the best, most atmospheric vr game I have. But there's this one part that I just can't get past because I'm just too afraid to.

Very good game. The graphics are so good and the content is quite long (around 14h straight). There is no motion sickness and the characters are lovable. There is a good attention to detail. Even the last scene is quite dramatic.

I look so forward to the sequel if there's one.

As soon as I booted it up, I was immediately blown away by the feeling of weightlessness (and slight nausea) that came with flinging myself around in zero-g.  But as soon as I exited the base, the game became a stuttering mess. My rig is well beyond the recommended spec, but I can't seem to find a solution (or cause for that matter) for the stuttering. Unplayable.
i loved this game, it was beautiful and the narrative between characters was amazing, i uploaded my playthough on youtube and i think it was 100% worth the time. would definatly reccomend!! <3
Could you add Japanese subtitles to this game?

The game looked fantasticly promising. In orbit around Saturn? A magnetic anomaly? That'll be awesome! I can't wait! And... you turn out to be a bloody maintenance robot that must fix all kind of stuff around the station. The end. Deception of the year award. Technically, yeah... Impressive. But so boring and disappointing that even the technique can't save it.

I am not into Sci-fi games and this is my first VR game, I thought it was awesome. So immersive. At first it gave me chronic dizzyness but I soon got past that. Very strange after only a short period of playing the controls are so intuitive and natural. 

Only negative is that the story mode was not very long and it ends pretty abruptly. If they provided add-ons to extend the story mode I would definitely 
purchase.

review_title: I had my doubts about Oculus before this
one_reviews_text: This game utilizes the Oculus headset to its full potential. When compared to other games that involve floating in space, this one won't make you ill. Muted environments seem to help a lot. The experience feels solid overall. If I were to offer any useful criticism, it would be that the game has quite a few 'fetch' missions. Fetch a power cell and put it there ... for this reason, I'm glad the game ended when it did. It has limited staying power and very limited replayability. Nonetheless, it deserves 5 stars for a cohesive and impressive experience.

If this is the only reason to own an Oculus, you've got your money's worth.  The freedom of it all combined with the attention-grabbing story was addicting.  Just be careful, play this long enough and you'll start wanting to push and pull yourself around the not-so-zero-gravity that is ACTUAL reality.
Probably one of the best VR games out there. Great story and dialogues, stunning graphics, amazing atmosphere. Must buy.

review_title: Finally, a real game for VR
one_reviews_text: I'm having trouble adjusting to 1g on Earth now. Excellent game.

Lone Echo paves the way for the future of VR!!! Immersive, Innovative, good narrative and gameplay with excellent production quality! This is a must own for anyone getting into VR. I want my memory wiped so I can experience it all over again.
Fantastic VR experience.  I hope to see more games like this in the future.

review_title: One of the best VR experiences IMO
one_reviews_text: So far this title has been the standard that I compare other VR titles to. I've yet to play a game that captivated me the way that this game did. From the graphics, story, locomotion, etc. This game desrves the good reviews. Well packaged and good promise for the future of this franchise.
One of the best VR games so far; some great sci-fi ideas and a proof that you can make interesting game and story without one shot being fired.

review_title: Should have been the 1st Title I Bought
one_reviews_text: I put off buying this due to price  but in all honesty if I knew how good this was I would have bought a Rift for this one game alone. If you want to experiance what VR can really offer over 2D then look no further. I would personally give it 6 stars. I will defo play through again at a later date

review_title: Best use of my store credit
one_reviews_text: I was on the fence for a while about spending so much on this game, especially because VR is such a new tech and the software is definitely still developing. I ended up using my $15 "run-time error" store credit to buy this game and it was the best choice I could have made. Such an incredible experience, but I will warn it is a fair bit stressful. If you can handle a little freakiness, this game is an amazing choice. 9.5/10 would recommmend

The problem with many VR titles is that they feels like glorified tech demos. They're cool and interesting but lack a feeling of "fullness". This game does not have that problem. I dont feel like I was paying a VR premium for a game that would be worth less normally. It earned its price as a game and the VR simply let it soar. There are few games that i give a flat general recomendation for, but this is one of them. 100% worth the buy.

review_title: Very pretty and immersive, but gameplay?
one_reviews_text:
Eagerly bought very soon after getting my rift as it had such good reviews and it is a very pretty game which has a very promising start.
Unfortunately the actual gameplay is very mundane with simple tasks that get repetitive very quickly. Lots of filler which artificially makes what should be a 2-3 hour experience take around 6-8 hours. I found myself wishing for the game to end pretty soon after starting the second act. 

The story is basic and told well enough, but nothing revolutionary. The basic flow is go to location A, story event happens, you have to find 3-4 things and put them in the right places, continue story by moving to next location. The last room had 3 or 4 mundane actions to perform and as I was so bored by this point the story lost any emotional impact.

I liked the world and the "experience" of being there, but wished the actual gameplay and pacing was a lot more intersting. For a VR experience it is very polished, as a game it left a lot to be desired.

Impressive space adventure, it shows the huge potential of storytelling of VR that is beyound anything you can experience on an ordinary monitor experience. The feeling of presence changes everything!

review_title: One of the best VR experiences
one_reviews_text: I finished Lone Echo 2 days ago. It was sad it was over. I really love that game. Graphics, controlls, gameplay, story - everything is awesome. I hope there will be a successor game.
After having VR for 2 yrs now, it left me speechless and overwhelmed a few times. A MUST PLAY !!!
Shows off how awesome VR can be.  I paid full price and it was worth every penny.
Amazing, it was an emotional roller coaster the whole way through. Amazing graphics, great acting, and well thought out story. If you have the money to buy it i say go for it. It's well worth it.
I can recommend it

Let me start off by saying, this is the best looking VR game I have played and the most immersive. In the early part of the game when I'm going around with Liv to repair systems, the immersiveness is intense. I was home alone playing this when someone outside the house made some sort of loud noise and it startled me, I turned around looking for something in the darkness of the area I was in, when I realized I'm in a game and that the noise was coming from the real world. It's that immersive and the graphics are the best you are going to see on the Rift. 


The troublesome part is that the controls can be maddeningly frustrating. There are some parts where you are trying to do something and it's incredibly frustrating. You drop something and it will just go floating off whereever because of the zero gravity. Dealing with stuff like that and getting frustrated will get you motion sick very quickly. Last time I played it I had to quit and felt very sick. And I rarely get motion sickness in VR. A real shame because it's a really great game if not for the controls.

review_title: This is how a VR game SHOULD feel.
one_reviews_text:
**Warning incoming wall of text**
Lone Echo has a good plot, settings, character, etc, etc. But that's not what I want to talk about. I want to talk about how this game FEELS, especially in terms of movement.

In most other VR games how you move through the world is usually the primary immersion breaker. Lone Echo's movement doesn't break you out at all. The game takes place in a 100% zero G environment, movement is performed the way anyone would in such a situation. You grab something and you push off of it. No joystick wiggling, no pointing there and teleporting. It's so intuitive and natural I would have paid money for this if it was purely an environment exploration simulator. The game reacts properly to the amount of force you use and the timing of letting go of a surface. Once I had the hang of it, it was like magic... err science. I could send myself shooting directly across a span of empty space with near pin point accuracy, or simply push myself into a parallel glide along the surface I had just been holding onto. Since my body was creating the motion in reality it always expected the motion that was occurring in VR, so I experienced no disorientation or nausea, except for rare situations with sudden unexpected stops. Usually because I wasn't looking where I was going. Having completed the game, I find myself simply wanting to start over, progress the plot to a certain point where I have access to all the areas in the game and then simply leave that save there so I can come back and play in enviroment whenever I want to. THAT is how good navigating in this game is. I want to come back JUST so I can move around in it.

review_title: One of best title for oculus
one_reviews_text:
Sublime and clean graphics,no motion sickness,immersion in total relax,i wait for the sequel.
Experience to buy absolutely
10+

Ok, this game is just...10/10.
Real VR.

W O W

This is the best and most certainly prettyest looking VR experience i had so far, the story is emersive and the feeling of flying arround in 0G is done perfectly, although it might take a bit of getting used to at first. 
Nothing else to say besides i loved it and wish to see more of such kind
Lone Echo alone made the purchase of my Oculus worth it.  If you have any tendency towards being a space geek, this title is a must have.  I'll be buying any sequel on launch day.  6/5

I almost never write reviews, but I had to for Lone Echo. The game does an incredible job of transporting you to another place and making you actually think you are there. It makes you actually care about the person you are supposed to care about. My only real complaint is that there are a few times in the game where you are supposed to be doing something that is urgent and I had a hard time finding the quest objectives which made me become frustrated, shattered the sense of urgency, and really took me out of the game. Despite those frustrating moments, it is still one of the best experiences in gaming I've ever had.

review_title: I really wish there was a teleport mode
one_reviews_text: The game itself looks stunning and i heard lots of positiv feedback, but i couldn't even play it for 10 minutes. The locomotion is really bad for me, i got really sick because of it. For me teleport just works best. I still have small hopes, that there will be an update which allows you to use teleport. But till then i can't play the game which is really sad. Well all i can say is, it's probably a good game if you won't get motion sick of it.

I own quite a few VR titles now, and this is BY FAR the most fascinating and riveting experience I've ever had with my Oculus. The game is flawless, the story is incredibly engaging, and the sense of accomplishment was amazing. I even found myself reacting emotionally at the end of the story. No other game compares to this, in my opinion. Very well done!!
wow

I think so.  Well, so far.  The Climb is still my favorite, but I concede this game has it beat on creativity, storytelling, and content.  A must buy.  That said, I will offer a little criticism: the mechanics get a little repetitive after a while.  There apparently isn't a problem in the universe that scanning or cutting won't solve.  Also, while the game does a good job announcing where you need to go, it's not always clear if you put the game down for a few days and lose track of what you were doing.  Also the checkpoints can be a bit sparse--aw, heck.  Minor issues.  Forget I said anything.  BUY. THIS. GAME.

A truly amazing game not a hard game but not an easy one either graphics are amazing I encountered a couple of glitches but nothing major the controls are really easy to use and movement is smooth if you don't have this game I suggest you buy it because there is nothing else on VR that could compare to this the interaction is amazing even with the humanoid olivia she responds to touches which is quite amusing :-D and responds to being bumped into the tasks are quite demanding and extremly immersive it's as close to being there as your going to get right now. I would really like an update to make the game longer or even a 2nd, 3rd, 4th game really well done devs thank you for an amazing game and experience.

Lone Echo is literally the best game I have played, thus far, in VR. It is the only game where I completely forgot that I was in VR, or that I was playing a game at all. This became real to me. I cared about Olivia, I cared about myself as Jack, I felt like I was in a place, living an adventure. I became lost in the narrative, and in the experience itself. This, above all other VR games and apps, showed me what VR really means to the future.

I can only dream of this basic construction being given an open-world treatment. To be able to own a ship, configure and repair it, to exist in a universe with other on-line players, to trade and explore, to live in this game world - oh, if only Oculus would do that! This is how space in VR should be done. This made me feel like I was truly 'there'.

But even in a single story, even within a finite experience, Lone Echo is magnificent. Everything is done with the hands - opening hatches, cutting metal, repairing technology, using buttons and pressing numbers on keypads - or throwing a rubber toy against a wall. The physics are brilliant, objects spin and move in zero gravity, and everything is just like one sees in NASA video from real-life orbit.

I recommend unleashing yourself from snap-turning, always level, no rotation, and all the other 'Oh God, It's VR, Beware!' constraints. The movement is best when it is natural and smooth. I only wish pitch and roll could have been made as natural as yaw can be set to be. That said, gliding about from hand-hold to hand-hold is as close as anyone will get to being in real Zero-G.

This, above all, is a game, with a story and characters that matter, it is intelligently written and absolutely worth anyone's time. It is like a fairly good science fiction film, only the player is allowed to live it. The interface is fantastic, and everything quickly becomes as natural as breathing to operate, use, and interact with. 

This is a must-play, must-get wonderment that everyone should play.

I don't like horror games or bio-horror.  Unfortunately the last part of this game has horror elements that were too intentense for me or my family.  There are parts where you have to carefully maneuver around these pulsating pod things and if you're not careful you'll get treated to a jump scare of the thing pulling you in.  It made someone tear the rift off and throw it on the floor.

I wish I could get my money back since I'll never ever finish it.  They need a warning about the intense elements at the end of this game.  Otherwise I loved the beginning and middle parts.

review_title: I wish I could finish this game.
one_reviews_text:
This game was great during my first sitting. I sat down with it most of a Saturday and got to a stopping point that I would assume is pretty far into the storyline. The problem is that I tried to pick this game back up a week later and it had become unplayable.

Nothing had changed in my hardware or software since I had sat down with Lone Echo the weekend prior. But suddenly I was experiencing excessive screen freezes and stuttering while trying to continue, even on the main menu. It made me sick to my stomach pretty quickly and made it hard to even have the app running. 

I dropped all of the in-game settings down to their lowest and it didn't seem to affect anything. I loaded prior saves and it did nothing. I even uninstalled and reinstalled, sacrificing my progress in the game, and nothing changed. I'd wonder if it were something on my end if it weren't for the fact that Lone Echo is the only app that's had this issue. Even Echo Arena still runs the same as always.

Don't get me wrong, it was a fantastic experience while I was actually able to play it, but now I'm stuck with a broken app and half the experience I paid for.

Please fix this.

review_title: A must play for Oculus Touch
one_reviews_text:
The best VR game I have played so far for a couple of reasons:
1: It's fairly long and diverse. It is a story driven VR game that took me around 6-8 hours to complete, and in that time, you navigate different environments as the story progresses.
2: Best... Touch integration... Ever. The way you use your fingers to press buttons and activate tools is just great. Tapping the top or bottom of your wrist for instance, activates different features. The fact that you literally use your fingers for this helps the immersion tremendously, and the game makes great use of this. Other interactions of grabbing and moving stuff around works well and really fits in this game.
3: NO TELEPORTATION. Since the entire game plays in microgravity, you float! The game introduces you to this with very subtle movement where you drag yourself around from point to point at first. It steps it up a little by adding subtle boosters to help you. A bit later it ads a bigger boost to help you move quicker etc etc. It really helped me ease into it, and has made me more resilliant in other "less comfortable" VR titles. And after I finished Lone Echo, Teleporting felt just lame. The fact that this game is a fluent motion from start to finish also helps with the immersion.
FINALLY: Whether this is the game for you will depend on what you think of the story and the setting. But as far as VR integration goes, this game is at the top of my list. This is what I want in VR titles.

review_title: One of the best games I have ever tried!
one_reviews_text: I would love to see more from this game, because the feeling of being there is just nailed! Make a sandbox kinda dlc that would let you keep the station and dig sites up and running. Making repairs, helping out extracting helium 3 and make reparis to the station. More more more please!

review_title: Must get for First Time VR Gamer
one_reviews_text:
This is a must play game for the best VR gaming experiences. It is truly immersive and you can sit or stand 360 roomscale. Story is 8-9 hours long, if you want to achieve 100%, it might bring it up to 10 hours but it is difficult with tight space environment. This also come with Echo Arena, there is a new Echo game announced not too long ago namely Echo Combat.

There is also a potiential Lone Echo 2, finger crossed. :)

The story is top notch!
So.... When is the sequel due? :D

...and immersive. Never seen such a great virtual environment before. 
Wonderful!!!
this is pure VR-experience!! Love it.
amazing

Lone Echo is THE VR experience you've been waiting for. Amazing story, incredible immersive gameplay, and promises of more content to come. This is the bar for VR the developers should be attempting to match.
This game has a true potential to invite more users to try out VR!

review_title: The greatest game since Doom in 1994!
one_reviews_text:
Sometimes games arrive that revolutionize a genre. To me that happened with Doom in 1994, 3dfx Voodoo Graphics Tomb Raider in 1996 and now Lone Echo in 2017 (ok maybe Outcast in 1999 too ;-) 
Lone Echo is the first VR game to get top rankings on Metacritic: to me true VR gaming was born the minute the first native VR game reached such hights among reviewers. Thus true VR gaming was born with Lone Echo, and I can't express in words what I've felt playing this game. Lone Echo is an experience, I'm thankful to Oculus and the Lone Echo developers for making such visions come to life. 
I've been running the game using a i7 7700K cpu, 16GB 3200 Mhz ram and a MSI GTX 1080 Gaming X 8GB (factory overclocked). I've set the supersampling to 2.0 in game and deactivated MSAA (couldn't see any changes without MSAA). The game has run flawlessly, even outside the station. This is a game that'll push your hardware to the max, you'll need 3 sensors, and do increase the resolution (=supersampling) all you can, it makes the game so much more beautiful!
This isn't a 5/5 rated game, it's 10/5 ;-) I've completed the game and there's no doubt it's the best computer game ever made - the game is so far ahead of everything else that currently there is no competition. Completing this game was worth every $ I payed for the Rift - and more.

This game renewed my love of VR! Great graphics, controls that work so well they get out of the way, characters you can connect with and a story that's really paced and atmospheric. More of this please!

review_title: The best game yet made for VR
one_reviews_text: They figured out no-teleportation motion in a way that doesn't make you sick. The story is cool, the visuals are astounding. Just buy it already.

Well I have to say that this game is samething special. Buying Oculus, only for this game, it's worth it. Seriously, if you don't have this game, buy it INMEDIATELY! The story, the effects, the ambient, graphics... etc. etc. etc. It's like you were living in a science-fiction movie. PLEASE, SECOND PART SOON!!! I do not have word to express the sensations that this game has given me... puff!!... AMAZING
This game was MADE for VR.  Its a great game/experience and the controls are pretty intuitive once you learn them.   I have a full review here https://bite2byte.com/2018/04/01/lone-echo-vr/
This game made the Rift worth it for me. A truly incredible experience, even though my PC could only handle it on the lowest settings. I will never, ever forget this game. You MUST buy this game.

review_title: Best Vr Game I Ever Played!!!
one_reviews_text: This is a great gaming experience, being able to do space walks and missions! Very neat and fun game and I loved every part of it! Great job, this is what all vr games should look up to!

Simply stunning. This is easily the best VR game I've played. Not only is it beautiful and incredibly immersive but it has a great story and the gameplay is amazing. It's also a game that could only been done in VR. Traditionally this has no real 'gameplay' (i.e. there's no shooting, fighting, collectin, etc.) but the fact that you just inhabitat  the world so fully and the incredible sense of floating around its environments totally immerses you and plays to VR's strengths perfectly. It really is that good. I'm just praying they're making a sequel.
An amazing story and gameplay

The graphics, the lighting, the controls, the interactions, the sound, all of it top notch an part of an interesting storyline.  Little to no motion sickness dispite flying around the space station like a mad man.

This is one of the best games ive ever played hands down i would play this game if it wasnt VR being that it is VR makes u feel like you are actually doing what Jack is doing in the game 100% recommend getting Lone Echo best game on VR to date hands down and i have been gaming for 20+ years

I've only been playing for about an hour and had to take a break from standing and figured I would write a review for this. So far I have gotten a little bit into the game and it is by far the best game I have bought! I love the movement, floating around in space, and the controls are very intuitive. I also like how they integrate the tutorials into the game, making it feel more immersive and not breaking from the story. I can tell this one is gonna take some time to finish and I am looking forward to completing it!
Lone Echo is the best game I have played in some time. Its basically decent-to-solid sci-fi with good controls.
i remember the ready at dawn name from 1886 which was prob one of the best games ever...  great way to make a splash in vr!!!

review_title: The most immersive VR game I've played
one_reviews_text:
The graphics are stunning, the story is hyper immersive and everything really feels natural. I was not playing a game, I was living it!

I highly recommend it!

review_title: One of the best games for VR
one_reviews_text: This is probably the best if not one of the best games for VR out right now. It has amazing mechanics. The quality of this game is amazing! I cannot put the headset down. Amazing storyline as well.
Great game!

review_title: This is the reason to buy a Rift
one_reviews_text: If you have been waiting for the killer game or experience to come along before getting a Rift then this is it! Stunning visuals, intuative controls and a great sense of presence. Its also very comfortable to play, I just felt a little dizzy when moving way to fast but there is really no need. Just take your time and enjoy it. Wonderful! Thank you.

Shortly after getting my Rift, I became a bit dissappointed that every title was either another shooter or movie trailer spam.  This game is everything I hoped VR could be.  The immersion is second to nothing else I've experienced.  The touch integration is incredible.  The mechanics, graphics, sound, environment, voice acting, are all top notch.  Considering the full price is still less than a lot of games that provide way less value, there's no reason to even wait for a sale on this one - it's worth every penny.  Other developers take note; this is game production done right.
I've had a PSVR and played most games on it, I've played a lot on the Oculus. This is the best VR game I've played. The story, the movement, everything just works great. 10/10
Enough said.

This is the best exclusive game for the rift -hands down! It's a perfect example of good blend of art and technology. The movement in zero G is excellent and its a pure pleasure to just fly in space! No more stupid shooting gallery games. Just give us smart experiences with interesting mechanics/characters/places to explore like in this game. A perfect example what I want from VR game. Oculus should give ReadyAtDawn more money to do another Echo!

review_title: What is there left to say?
one_reviews_text:
Everybody knows, this game is good. Great locomotion, graphics, characters, get it! All that being said, I will mention a  minor issue that I, personally had (most people wouldn't care). 

*****************Mild Spoiler Alert*********************


I am a completionist, so I was hunting those cube sats like a crazy person. I got all of them except---- 2. But then the game propels you into the second act and there is no way to get the last 2. I wish there was some warning, I guess? Like I said, small issue. Or after beating the game, allow the person to go back to the first act specifically to finish the cube sat mission.

Btw, I enjoyed the first act way more than the second act. The second act felt like any sci fi action game (in visual aesthetic) like Halo or Dead Space, but the first act had real heart and a feeling of open world exploration. One thing that I'm discovering really helps VR is if a space feels lived in as opposed to the usual computer graphic's default-- which to me is often sterile. One way to accomplish this is to litter the area with personal stuff that real people accumalte while living life- in various states of wear and tear. This game did that well in the first act. It also had technology that was closer to our own,- I bought into THAT world more. This is just my opinion and I am just some dude on the internet. I leave reviews to support the medium.

Once I started this game I could not break away, literally played for hours!
5 stars!
Just great

I am guilty of relying on reviews before I make a purchase and forgetting to leave a review myself for others on games/apps I play. This game made me feel obligated to leave a review. I've been playing video games for 35 years and this is one of the best experiences I've had in video games. The game is not fast paced. It allows for exploration. The locomotion is awesone. The graphics do a great job of creating an immersive atmosphere. Lots of attention to detail. Sound effects are superb. Games will get better than this in time, but for now this is an awesome example of what VR can do in the right hands and it is important to support the developers that take the time and effort and put together something as immersive and playable as this.

Really - buy it! The VR effects are excellent and moreover the story is the best I have experienced so far. Wish I could forget it all and play it naive again! :) - Hopefully they make another episode!!!

I purchased this game on a sale expecting to have to stand for the whole thing, but because of the weightlessness setting, you can actually sit and it doesn't detract from the immersion. I hadn't played any big budget VR games and consequently never really felt convinced about VR as a medium. The level of detail and immersion in this game are unparalleled and I would consider this a must-own for VR. Prepare to be lost in this world.

review_title: Frustrating, but some parts are great
one_reviews_text: Biggest complaint is not about the game but about auto saves (or lack thereof). Redoing some parts over and over because I didn't know where it auto saved. Parts of the game are fantantastic, but othere are super frustrating. There's no clear direction to what you're supposed to be doing.

One of the best games out there and the best VR to date, truly emersive, this Alien meets Moon meets 2001 for atmosfier. The metanics are wonderful and the graphics/sound and voice acting and some of the best in a video game.
really enjoyed it

This game would be a 4 out of 5 for me if it wasn't for a few game breaking bugs.  I won't spoil anything, but towards the end of the game there is supposed to be something happen that never happens in my game, and I've verified this with other youtube playthroughs.  I can't finish the game due to this bug.
This is the best VR game/experience out right now. If you have a Rift you better have Lone Echo in your library.  10/10
This is why you buy VR. Awesome.

I've had Steam since the month it was released. I grew up on SNES, moved to PC when Halflife was born (the original, not 2). I've played everything that caught my interest. Without a doubt, this is my favorite VR and Video Game title to date. It's an honest treat, you owe it to yourself to play it once you've gotten past newcommers' motion sickness.
Very good game. My only critic point would be, that most tasks get repetative, but besides that, its an exceptinal VR game.
One of the best gaming experiences of my life. Enjoyed every minute of it.

Space!!!!
Today I flew through the rings of Saturn. Need I say more?
wdw

review_title: Wonderful game with a few small issues
one_reviews_text:
I'll mention the very few and neglectable bad things first - and please do NOT see them as a reason not to buy this game. It does not in any way ruin the experience, and I'm pretty sure it will be fixed with a simple patch:
- The game has a few bugs. Sometimes a battery you put into something suddenly sticks out again, or an animation might not play right away (example: "wake someone up" - when said character is not yet shown as sleeping, and then suddenly jumps to sleeping animation once interacted with).
- The side quest with the cube sats should have a clear warning that you can't ever find the first 5 cubes again once you left the station. Also, this side quest was not fun, it was tedious and annoying, especially when you don't want to miss the pretty cool audio logs that provide some nice backstory. It's optional though, and I recomment simply using a guide from youtube for that.

Now to the awesome stuff:
+First VR game with a compelling story and protagonists you really care about. You grow to like them and care for them very quickly, and the game has left me smiling or cuckling on many occasions, and on other occasions, terrified, because I feared losing "my" crewmembers. 
+Both Olivia and Jack seem very "real" and believable. Even though it is a SciFi Story it doesn't feel "unreal".
+The graphics are fantastic
+The developers managed to turn all the downsides of VR into actual features that enhance immersion - for example the awesome solutions for locomotion, or the fact that you are a robot, and thus have a "digital display" so the so called "VR mesh" feels like it's simply the camera tech of your ingame visor.
+The story is solid and feels finished with a great ending, while leaving space for potential sequels - without NEEDING sequels.
+The game starts out a bit slow, which gives you time to adapt and marvel at the scenery, before it accelerates and gets way more dramatic.
+Controls feel very natural and intuitive

All in all a must buy for SciFi Fans!

Exceptional, incredible, magnificent. The best game in VR I've tried to date and I've already had a few.

A musthave sure!. Triple A.

review_title: Best Game i've ever played in VR
one_reviews_text: this game is the most advanced Storytelling, playing and immersive game ever. I can fully recommend it as a reference, entertainment and recommendation for developers to see how to handle Locomotion and movement in VR. Simply Whow!

Must say so far its one of the most awesome VR experiences I've had in singelplayer VR games so far. The game runs smooth on my MSI 960 4GB. And the game is totally immersive. There are so much objects to inspect. And so much fun to navigate in Zero-G. Interesting story as well and a nice game to let friends try when they visit. I would totally play it again.

... as ever with a lot of solo player games (the part I bought it for) it's much too short. I loved the enviornments and the story and just wanted more, more more! Finished in 8 hours which maybe isn't the shorttest solo campaign ever but I really wanted more. However, to get more would have required new stuff to do too, as there was a fair bit of repetition. If I sound mixed, well, I mostly loved it, but minor criticisms would be repetition/variety of tasks and length.

This is the first paid game I got for the Rift. I've never had a better experience in a game. Well worth it.  I started gaming with Doom and Half-Life.  This story is as much fun, and the full immersion zero gravity effect kept  me coming back.  I hope to see more like this in the future.  The not very distant future.  My thanks to the creators.

I am a smoker. I find it hard to go for more than an hour without having a cigarette break no matter what I'm doing, so when I finally emerged from this experience after 5 hours, I had to say, I was impressed. There's not much in this world that'll hold my attention for that long without the addiction dragging my concentration away.

I originally started with the free Echo Arena, and I was so impressed with the game mechanics and interactivity I decided I had to give Lone Echo a look, and I'm really glad I did. It has the most natural-feeling interactivity with the environment that I've ever experienced in any title, ever. Zero-gravity really is the best movement mechanic for VR, hands down.

The design and graphics and are beautiful - it's possible to just float around admiring the view for much of the time, and there are only a few parts in the story where the game presses you for time, so you can take your time to explore as much as you like. All the smallest details stand up to even the closest scrutiny.

The story is extremely engaging, as implied in my first paragraph, with a play-through time of 5-7 hours depending on your aptitude. I disagree with some here who say it's too short. I sometimes like a game with a definite beginning-middle-ending structure - similar to a movie or to a book that can be read in one sitting. The original Portal is another example of how a short-format game can work really well.

All-in-all, an amazing adventure with a great feeling of accomplishment at the end of it. I'm so glad that the storytelling has caught up with the tech-demo culture of VR, and I can't wait to see what comes next.

i dont often write review, because im more of a do-er...but this game was amazing.I played it through in a course of 3 days (6hrs total) and i can honestly say this is incredible even better than what mass effects has become. You star off pretty slow as the game starts and gradually take more controll as you progress and while you progress you get imensly imersed by the characters making a masterpeice which even companys like Dice and EA faild to capture. this game invests you with the characters and makes you actually care about them.
ill admit the whole thing sorta doesnt make sense untill you reach the ending howerver.
the game has you running around doing little missions which on their own seem like chores but ones you realise the end game and reunite with your captain etc everything falls into place and makes sense.

if i could rate higher i would
5/5 experience
4.5/5 controlls - can be cluncky sometimes otherwise are brilliant
5/5 character development - made me actually care about the well being of them
3/5 story due to alot only making sense at the end
           |
          V
         some people may not have the stanima to wade through everything 
         untill it eventually makes sense

this is a must buy for the oculus 9.6/10
(does require a relitivly good pc system)
if anyone thinks im missing anything out them msg me and ill add it.

(for the money this was worth it)
this game is so intense! buy it. story is amazing, immersion is freaking awesome. there needs to be more VR games like this one.

I never write reviews, im just too lazy. This here is my first review because Lone Echo was a blast for me! The immersion was absolutely awesome. 
If you are into sci-fi and can enjoy adventure style games you must play Lone Echo, period! :)
This game shows what VR is meant to be.

review_title: Why are you still reading this?
one_reviews_text: Everyone says its a must buy. It is. So stop reading reviews and get this masterpiece.
One of the best vr games ever made.

review_title: If this game didn't crash every 5 mins
one_reviews_text: If this game didn't crash every 5 minutes it would be mind blowing.  I love the physics in the game and even the graphics are great it just can't seem to run for more than a few minutes without crashing.  Usually right when I load the first holo diagram of the first mishap the game crashes and I have to do the whole sequence over again just to have it crash again.  I've edited my page file size and it doesn't help.  I've dumbed down the graphics and it doesn't help.  My rig is OP and still this game crashes.  Please fix this developers and I will change my review.

When I first had a desire to get into VR, my biggest worry was whether or not there would be any games that would garner my attention, for most of what I saw seemed rudimentary at best. Fast forward to one week after the purchase of an Oculus Rift and of all the games I have played (both in VR and not) I am unbelievebly astonished by what Ready At Dawn has created.

Visuals: ...I honestly don't have the words. I have never (let me repeat myself - NEVER) played a game that has been more immersive, more beautiful, or more terrifying at the same time. I don't know whose concept this was, but if they get the notion to make a sequel, and it could be $100, if it possesses the kind of visual fidelity and presence this game has, I'll pay it without hesitation.

Gameplay: The zero-G movement mechanic is simply brilliant. Teleporting wouldn't have worked for this game. Oddly enough, neither would a gamepad. I love the feeling of pulling across and pushing against objects in space. They nailed this.

Story: Though it's not an excessively long story (and I haven't finished it yet) it is beyond engaging. You start to care about the characters - few though there are - and what happens to them.

All in all, this has to be the most surreal gaming experience I've ever had, but the money and time spent on this VR classic was entirely worth it. I'm ready for round two...

This is hands down the best, most immersive VR game on the market.  Great story, no warping, intuitive movement, and overall fun to play.  
This was one of the first games I played after getting my Occulus, and I have been searching for another game like it ever since, to no avail.

review_title: Best VR game I've played so far
one_reviews_text: This game stands out from every other vr game available. The controlls and movement are great and the story is well done.

I'm 37 years old. This is the first time I've cried playing a video game. 
I felt emotionally so intense because I really care about her. 
I can't believe. This game is witchcraft.

Very immersive. Controls feel good are very intuitive. Extremely atmospheric. I'm not a fan of the 'scarier' types of VR game (Alien isolation just became unplayable) but this has the right amount of fear factor.  

Took a good while to complete (about the same as Arizona Sunshine in my opinion).

Graphic design was superb. Storyline was original.

I'd rate it in the top 3 VR games out there (as of today 26/1/18).
plz make sequel! this game was awesome!!!!!!!!!!!!! want more vr from ready at dawn!

Wow. Just bought this in the sale. To anybody sitting on the fence today; I've barely started the story so can't speak to the narrative or longitivity etc. but the environment and mechanics are incredibly impressive. I've picked up a few Oculus exculsive titles in the Christmas sales and I'm discovering that those premium prices (previously slightly resented) are actually justified; there's a level of polish and quality beyond the other content I've seen out there. For context; Arizona Sunshine and Dead Effect 2 VR were both very good, but Lone Echo and Arktika.1 feel like they're a level above them.

I think this is a fantastic game, but miss a language pack in other major language (italian, german, france), and miss a subtittles (ok no language pack, but english sub,,,),
The story and the ambient is great, really, The missions are of correct difficulty, but one is really hard (the first long walk through the exploding spores is excessively difficult, at the limit of leaving the game).
I hope the dev write a sequel, because this ambient is really wanderful. I lone echo arena and i love lone echo, and i will buy all echo series, sure! (but please, insert subtitles!)

The first 1-3 hours are simply amazing! Possibly the most immersive VR I've played aside from Heart of the Emberstone / Call of the Starseed. You feel like you're living out Event Horizon or your favorite sci-fi fixing the ship as things continue to become stranger. Movement is almost perfect as I only felt a slight twinge of motion sickness maybe twice ever for a split second. Amazing accomplishment considering almost everything else uses a teleportation system or causes motion sickness with full motion.

I was going to give this 5 stars, but the middle and end of the game drag. Plus, there's no mapping system, so you can get lost occasionally and not know where all the missing objects are. There is lots of repitition with what you are actually doing and the control panels and such.
A truly wonderful, immersive sci-fi game. Well worth the money.
An unique and fantastic experience, nothing else I played so far compares to it. As cliche as it may sound, it is still true that this feels like the future of gaming.

This game is wonderful from beginning to end. Initially I had bad performance issues, enough that I thought I'd have to set the game aside. But then I found out that minimizing the desktop window gives a massive performance boost, and after that, everything was silky smooth. I'm so glad I found that tip, because this is probably the best game I've played yet on the Rift. It would have been a shame to not have seen it all the way through. I hope there's a sequel!

This is the VR game I was really waiting for (and as a matter of fact was one of the main reasons I bought an Oculus Rift and high-end gaming pc in the first place). Excellent inverse kinematics, locomotion (they basically cracked the locomotion problem within a zero-G environment), story, atmosphere, character design, interactivity and a decent lenght (although it could always be longer, because I dont want this to end ;-). Unless you really hate (slow paced) space (adventures) it's a must-buy and worth every penny/dollar/euro/... Enjoy and I'm looking forward to more innovative, inspired, real VR titles! (and apparently there's more to come regarding Lone Echo... cant wait) ... Keep up the good work and many thanks for this great VR-adventure!
Its Amazing
Very nice game!
Unlike most other games out there, this game was built for VR.    And it really shows.  take full advantage of the VR experience.  I wish it were longer...Best VR game i've played

I have got to the point were i need to sync the containers outside the station during a very long EVA. Ok when you go out of that airlock for the first time you are met with complete awe of what you see. I can even thrust my echo 1 towards distant asteroids with out getting too close to that crazy looking space anamoly. This game truly is amazing and sets the bar extremely high for VR games today and more than likely any time soon in the future.

review_title: Triple A Game for the Oculus
one_reviews_text: If you don't necessarily need guns to have an awesome first person experience, this is a must have for the rift.

review_title: This is the best VR game out there!!
one_reviews_text: Seriously, you need this, trust me.

Incredible game in every way except the game doesn't save nearly often enough.  Tie that with the frequent crashes I've been having there is a LOT of do-overs for no good reason.  Scan a comm-sat, autosave.  Finish a round of dialogue, autosave.
2017. AAA. AWESOME. Finally translated.

If you are looking for a game that is making the best use of VR, this is it. 

Lone Echo is a  fine suspense thriller that lets you go to space with likeable characters that I could root for. 

More than once I wondered at the environments, gazed at the stars or rocketed around with the Vomit Comet (nice NASA reference, too) you can find.

The controls are mostly excellent, whether you drift across a room, handle tools or carry a box - sometimes items you grab act a bit wonky as they try to align with your hand. Which, amazingly, does feel like your hand, even though you are an android!

The game itself I would classify as a linear adventure, although the sense of agency you have is amazing, probably due to the relatable writing. The genre typical puzzles in this adventure repairing, assembling and operating various machinery.

I deduct one star because to me the puzzles were a bit on the too easy side, if not outright explained step-by-step. I wish there would have been a little more analyzing and thinking involved.

This does not take away from the overall experience, though! If there is a sequel, that maybe also clears Jack's side story, I simply hope this part will get improved.

I also still don't know how the three shells work. :)

The game crash every time now (i7 8700k @5Ghz, 1080ti, 16g ram @3200).
It's a shame...
Edit : MSI Afterburner 4.5.0 was the problem, just closed it to recover a dynamite boosted graphic card !

What else can I say more than the above? This game feels like the full length game that VR needs. Controls are amazing, graphics are breathtaking, voice acting is brilliant, and the story is intense. Multiple times I was gripping onto the outside of a ship, terrified to let go because it really felt like being in space. If you want a story game for VR, then you won't regret buying this.
good game
Hype!!

This is one of the best VR game experiences period. My only minor critisism is that after a while (at least for me), it starts to feel like a job as opposed to a game. I say this because you spend the vast majority of your time repairing things around the space station. That's not to say there isn't any action, but don't expect to be battling armies of aliens with plasma rifles.

I typically do not have the time or energy to write reviews, even when I am pleased with something....  I received the Rift as a Christmas '17 Gift and purchased many of the games.  This, by far, has been the most immersive and engaging exerience, outside of actual reality, for me, to-date.  I'm hoping for not only (a) sequel(s), but other experiences from Ready at Dawn, as well.

Having got my Oculus for Christmas, this was one of the first games that sparked my interest as someone with a love for astronomy and all things space-related. As a single-player campaign this has been the most profound experience I've ever had. The story is incredibly well-paced and the ending was amazing, Olivia is a great character and seeing Jack's development throughout was really cool. I give this all the stars and more.
I agree with most people here: Lone Echo is one of the best VR games out there!

Lone Echo managed a total immersion in space. Storyline, grahics, movements (full arms), humour, it's all there... easy puzzles will keep you going and some difficulties will make the experience a perfectly balanced challenge. VR is in general at it's very early stages, but Lone Echo managed to use all the ressources available to them. Congrats to the team. Worked seamlessly on a GTX 1060 3Gb i7.

This is a great game, story is good, graphics are great  but it lacks any kind of replay value.  once you have completed the game, thats it; there is nothing else except the pointless task of starting all over again.
Also since they removed the multiplayer and made it a free download, it even lacks that element.

We need a free update to extend the value of this game.    customisable character ?  enemies to kill ?  drive ships (instead of just holding on)?  maybe a multiplayer thats better than the arena, for example ,,,  watch or read / 'enders game'  there is a good example of a zero G game.   
but the most important thing... What happens in the next chapter of this story !?

This game was very immersive and requires you to think through problems. It's one of the best VR games around right now. However, I had some tracking problems when not facing my sensors and this game requires you to look in all directions and many times I was having to do all of my work facing away from the sensors. I assume additional sensors can fix this problem, but I have not tried that. (have senors at sides or behind you) Also, with all zero-g games, they can get slightly disorienting after playing for a while, so I'd have to take breaks now and then, not that bad though.

Superb.  Just buy it.  You'll love being *in* a Sci-fi film.  The art direction and graphics are top notch too, which is the icing on the cake.   For reference -  I think my play through lasted about 6 hours...

Excellent VR game. Didn't feel short to me but I did spend a decent amount of time just flying around looking at everything. Visuals looks great and controls are very smooth. It is a little dizzy at first if you aren't used to VR games with free movement but after about an hour I was fine and flying at full speed. Definately worth it!
Lone Echos interaction and movement are brilliant, sadly the game itself never gets past the game demo, evade the lasers gameplay. I was really expecting so much more, echo arena is so much better
Must have!

I played a lot of games in my life. And i only end them if the story makes it up. Lone Echo has a really good story and even emotions are building up. It is long ago that i played a game to the end and was sad that i did it :). I hope there will be a second part with these two characters. It is even worth to make a film of this...

My favorite game so far. Graphics are wonderfull . loved every minute.
i found the zero gravity floating easy to get use too. took me a few times on some levels to get through unscathed! just hope they make a lone echo 2.
totally made me forget i was sitting in my living room !  dont think im going to find a vr game to match this any time soon.
A sequel cant come soon enough...

From just the trailers I knew I was going to enjoy this title, however trailers do not do this title justice. I was immersed from the get go, with the rich & detailed environments drawing me in wanting to inspect everything. By the end of the game I genuinely enthralled by the story, I had experienced pure panic, sadness, joy a full range of emotions. I could have easily played through without a break, no discomfort from playing this whatsoever. Great game!
i want more!!

This is a great example of a game which would be still excellent as a regular FPP title but VR takes it to a completely new level of immersion. 
A true AAA title for VR, a benchmark for others to look at, an absolute must have for any Oculus owner out there.

Great story, great characters, great graphics, great visuals.  I do kinda wish that there was more missions around the station itself before the Real Plot gets going, but since you're not really on a clock for the most part you can spend as much time there as you want.

This game is very good, but i have an issue with clicking anything in menu. I recharged my batteries and seems that Oculus can see or feel when im clicking but the game doesnt. I can see my "hands" moving but i can't submit anything in menu. 
Please Help.

Lone Echo captivates from the start. It has very strong characters and your interaction with them makes you care. The story is interesting and well paced. The graphics and audio are of high production quality and keeps you highly immersed in the experience. It's hard to stop playing! Lone Echo is highly recommended.

Enjoyed this game a lot. Nice story that draws you in, except that I was the most clueless pre-programmed robot in the companty ha ha. Lots of nice details. One of the best games I have played in VR so far.
This is the game I let people play when they come over to visit. Honestly don't have anything bad to say about it.

review_title: A title that sets the bar for the rest
one_reviews_text: If you own a VR headset you NEED this game. Beware playing it though, because you will be slightly annoyed and disappointed at other games in VR. Freaking clown shoes compared to this one.

review_title: The best VR title to date
one_reviews_text: For me, this is the kind of VR game that I had always hoped for. Strong sci-fi storyline, amazing clean visuals, immersive interactive environments and intutive functional controls/gameplay mechanics. Looking to take a break from real life? This game really transports your mind to outerspace and cannot be missed. Worth every penny!!

This game is possibly one of the best VR games I have played, and I have played a lot. 
The story is great, the grpahics are amazing and the immersion is stronger than 90% of VR titles becasue you can actually see your arms and body.

However not having cloud saves nowadays is a massive downer, my computer hard drive died recently, and all my steam and origin games were fine and the saves were backed up, all of my rift game saves are now lost.

review_title: A must have in anyone's VR collection
one_reviews_text:
Absolutely loved this game however it was also more than a game - in VR it is also an experience/adventure that would only work in this medium. I won't spoil the story however it grew much larger and more exciting than what I was expecting even though I was already having more than enough fun. The fact that I also share the same name as your VR character was a surreal experience and gave the whole story an extra level of gravitas I have not felt before. 

From a technical standpoint it is beautiful to look at even when playing on medium with my 1070. The touch controls are very solid, not perfect but up there with the best VR tracking there is to offer in games these days. Clever use of gameplay mechanics keep your actions feeling fresh even though they are infact realitively simple - however that is part of the genius in this game's design.

I do hope they make a sequel.

Best VR game out there. I had the privelege of hearing some of the R.A.D. dev team speak at my college, and I can say a lot of thought/skill went into creating this. From the aesthetic to the comfort level, performance and quality, this game is worth every penny. Great story, intuitive and fluid controls.

i obviously havent got a whole lot of playtime on the game at the minute and i am hoping i can change my review to a more positive one in the near future. 

The whole snapping thing when trying to rotate is HORRIBLE! i mean it works but for a game that looks so good in every other area its a shame that something as simple as turning your body ruins the feeling of immersion within the game. I've also come across a few bugs which stop me from progressing at times which is annoying but ill create a new save and see if that helps. If the story blows me away ill happily add another star but at the minute i am slightly dissapointed.
Just. Wow. Amazing game. There are no other titles even close. Period.
This game was the greatest game ive played i my whole life.

So having just finished a play though I've been left with mixed emotions. 

The mechanics are really good, as are the graphics (on the whole) & voice acting. This (as well as Adrift) also gave me the sensation of zero gravity at times which was great. The problem is everything else is just so mundane. 

The story is average at best & the missions and training in particular felt like a chore. Gamers are used to repetition, but you literally do the same 3 things all the way through. Even in VR, the novelty quickly wears off. 

This is also the only game to cause me really bad headaches. I feel this is largely down to the SDE which usally dissipates after 20mins, but seemed ever present in this.

This is a incredible experience that people who love need to play and people who don't know what vr is need to play to be blown away.
No shooting which works for it as its a break from all the other gamers which always have shooting (not that Im against shooting)
Better than watching gravity
I hope this will game will expand in all directions, explore, combat , management, etc. and becomes THE space game for VR.

Bought this a few hours ago and played until I couldn't stand any more.  This title is good, really good - it's already exceeded my expectations and is def worth the price.  Runs super smooth on medium settings on GTX1070.  VR needs more titles like this!  Non-cartoony, interactive, spectacular visuals.  So far I've only done a few of the repair jobs cause I keep getting distracted and keep trying to scan everything in sight.  Only downside is that the main protagonist keeps rejecting my android advances, ha ha.

Just getting started on this title.  Very impressive, immersive and thoroughly engrossing game primarily focused on task based puzzles and actions which moves at your own pace.  A fully imagined world with top notch graphics and character animation/interaction.  Definitely worth the purchase price.  This should be on everyone's list of top VR games/experiences thus far!  Well done!!!

...And a well structured story creates one of the best immersive games you may have ever played!// It's a full game, too, and will take many, many hours.  The VR experience is fantastic and the tech properly utilised: movement, for example.  Other developers should learn from these peeps.  The devs also understand story structure (quite rare in gaming, I find) and they've successfully implemented it into gaming!  Hoorah. // I'm so pleased I bought this game as I wasn't going to, knowing how mediocre VR games are, I didn't fancy wasting 30quid on mediocrity.  But this ain't, it's worth every penny.// I would have liked to write a lot more, but with no carriage returns = wall of text.// Last words?! You better only be reading this whilst the game is installing...
This is easily one of the best gaming experiences I have had. A no brainer purchase. You must see this through to the end! Amazing job on this one!

A very well thought out game with a truly engaging story. I played the majority of the game in one go, couldn't stop, even when after 6 hours my face was hurting from the headset. While the story is short in comparison to non-VR titles, I believe it's worth every penny, especially if you can grab it on sale.

review_title: Best VR title I have played yet!
one_reviews_text: I just finished the story, and my head is still spinning. The story is amazing, the controls are fluid and intuitive, and the scenery is stunning. Yes it is a bit short, but this experience is worth so much more than they are charging. If this isn't in your library, then you have not truly experienced VR.

Great title that keeps you fully immersed and interested all the way to the end! Hope they make a sequel! You'll never get bored of the tasks, fluent control system, storyline and glorious visuals (powerful PC required). I'll play this again to see if I've missed anything! Recommended :-)

I'd hesitate to call this one a game but it's definitely one of the more immersive experiences out there. It took me around 6 or 7 hours of gameplay to beat it, more if you look for all of the collectables, etc. You owe it to yourself to play it. With that said, take it slow. The movement might cause you some nausea at first.

review_title: Most immersive VR Game I've come across
one_reviews_text: So far, this has given me the best vr experience. Just the amount of interactivity of it all. Good graphics and good story, okayish ending, would definitely play again just for the experience.

I don't know, I got bored very quickly, it didn't appeal to me whatsoever. I tried to like it and I'm just disinterested to go back to it. Graphics are generally very good, but why was Jupiter static?
 I found it just floating from one place to another boring and mundane. Refunding.

Recently I will quit using VR for sometime, but before that I wanted to buy and complete this game so I did. Words can not explain how it was..amazing.. a dream..emotional. All the movement, the feeling of space, the intractions are perfect. I am usually very critic but could not find any bad aspects. A masterpiece I need to say, respect for the creators creativity and design.. If more similar things will come for VR I will come back surely.

I've played a few VR games and I can honestly say this is one of those ONLY VR games that I've played where the story pulled me in and I really connected with both the main character and his support character, beautiful story and beautiful interaction.
Get it
This is THE VR game to play.  Should have won GOTY !!!

review_title: Stop rating games based on tech issues.
one_reviews_text: A very desturbing trend is happening where people are rating games based on the performance of their hardware over a games own merrits. If a person buys a game only to find it not working for whatever reason, some believe this rating section is the place to come to vent, and complain, when actually IT IS NOT! If a person has technical issues they should be trying to speak with developers, or re-examining their systems instead on muddying the waters of a game rating section. I personally would only like to read if a game is enjoyable, if the graphics are good, what type of game it is etc.... not whether or not joe-blow couldn't get the game to work on his 8 year old i3 with a 680 gpu.... Giving a game 1 star because you could not get it to work is like rating pizza pizza 1 star because you don't like the taste of starbucks coffee with it.

I was hesitant to buy this because Adrift (a zero g space game) made me nauseous. I am glad I gave this a shot! This was hands down the best vr experience I've had and I experienced no nausea whatsoever.
this game is awesome and fun, with a lot of actions,great graphics and the best story in all the oculus store
On the technical side it the game has some bugs and hiccups. Gameplaywise some missions are frustrating. But overall it is a nice experience, and a good length for a VR game.

review_title: The best VR game for me so far!
one_reviews_text:
This is by far the best VR game i've played yet. Story, pacing, controls, character -
everything is exceptionally done! It really feels like watching a good movie. It's actually so good i played through it twice! You can check out my second full playthrough of this game here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zxPuZYMIzuQ

review_title: Great immersion with a fantastic story
one_reviews_text: Though I first encountered a few frustrations in knowing how to proceed to the next sequence, once I stuck with it, I found a truely fantastic, beautifully made, and addictive game and story. The game really comes into its own when you leave the station so keep going until at least then if you find it a little slow at first. It will be more than worth it.

review_title: Everything I wanted VR to be
one_reviews_text: Oh WOW! Now I wasn't expecting that. I've been holding off pulling the trigger on getting this game for quite some time now. But it's Christmas, so an early gift from me to me. And ho boy! That was AWESOME! If you've given Echo Arena a play, then the controls will feel familiar. Now take that and put it in the centre of an amazing envirment. Thrown in a treasure hunt. I have spent way too long tracking down cube bots. The game just unfolds before you. And just keeps upping the WOW again and again. Yes, I liked it. I'll even play it again. And I'll probably be yelling "**** **!" again. If your not sure about getting this game. Download Echo Arean. Just do the tutorial. Explore the hub zone. I'f your ok with the motion, then buy the game, strap in and get ready for an adventure.

At first, i was thinking is it worth the money because every single vr game is too short (completed in an hour or so,) but when i bought it, and finished it. I think it's the best VR game out there at the moment. Story is amazing, graphics are good and the movement.... ah anti-gravity freedom is great. A must buy to every person who owns VR equipment.

An amazing experience. I strongly recommend!

review_title: best VR game i've played so far
one_reviews_text: Good story , great controls. I was afraid this game would make me motion sick. I did not play vr games for a few months and before i got my vr legs i used to get sick just driving the minecart in obduction. So i was truly amazed at how well this game played.

This was such a pleasant surprise. I enjoyed the heck out of it.
Wish there was more games like this one. Unfortunately it ended too soon, but I can see myself playing this again in the near future.
Please keep making games like this. Thanks!
Just put 30 min. in to this game and it is EPIC. I have placed hours of game play in other games and none have grasped my interest like this one. Two thumbs up :)

review_title: Without a doubt one of the better
one_reviews_text:
This game literally had me in tears at the end (no spoilers), and facinated me the whole darn way through. I would HIGHLY recommend this game to anyone having access to the Oculus. 
Althrough, have a word of caution: you cannot push yourself anywhere after taking off the googles :D
Hands down best VR experience for me to date!
Outstanding game.  Great mechanics, visuals and story.  I really felt like I was in space.  I hope there are more like this to come!  Worth the money spent.

an incredible game, the immersion and story telling is top draw, not particluly action packed, and not normally my kind of game, yet this is the pinnicle of VR, my favourite single player game since Red Dead Redemption, its that good.

I can not wait until for next instalment, and also the upcomming Echo Combat

What this game gets right is show the future of VR, which is immersive story-telling mixed with action gameplay.  Not only do you get an intimate look into the life happenings inside this science fiction world, you live it for yourself.  You're not just in space and experiencing zero-G, you're the protagonist in a fully realized character and plot.  Your gameplay not only has consequences as far as advancing the game, but you feel the weight of those actions.  The visuals, the script, the voice-acting, the gameplay developer decisions, all come together to deliver on the promise of VR: immersive story-telling.
A fantastic game that was almost ruined for me by a glitch right at the end. Fortunately reloading the last chapter fixed it.

This is the first real game I've played since getting my Rift, and it's an experience that I could not recommend enough! This game would probably still be great even without VR support. A fascinating story that wouldn't let me take my headset off.

The game is so well done, i can feel that developers really loved making this game. Attention to detail, beautiful designs, incredible space views and the most important and emotional part that even made me cry - Olivia.

I'm new to VR but had heard so many great things about this game that i couldn't pass it up and boy i'm glad I didn't from start to finish it's an amzing looking game, well voice acted and your sucked right in to the character your playing. I couldn't ask for anymore out of a VR game to me this sets the bar.

Rifinito e piacevole; forse una degli unici giochi "AAA" per la VR. E' però estremamente sopravvalutato: la storia non è niente di imprescindibile e, fosse stato in 2d, nessuno l'avrebbe ritenuto meritevole di più di un paio di ore di gioco.

Got this game on sale (Always a good thing.) but man so far the game is amazing, even though I have to take breaks due to the eye hurting and face hurting. Still.. AMAZING!! 5/5 and 10/10 and whatever else.

review_title: Best game ever if you have a  i7 CPU
one_reviews_text:
This game is not design for i5 users, so don't try to buy this game. Why? Your CPU utilization will  be 100%. This will cause your system to crash or stutter like crazy. I even tried different graphic settings. Nothing. Also, you will definitely need 16GB of ram. No Joke.  my old PC(3 mins old. I switched my procesor today to i7 7700) i5 6500, drr4 8GB and 1060 GTX 6GB. It didn't work well. The only thing that did good was my graphic card. 30% utilization. In other words, my graphic card wasn't trying at all.lol 

Oculus needs to target users that have common system before they move to the next level. It's kind of crazy, though. Beside that... The game is super tight! Once again, don't buy this game if you have a i5 processor.

Very good game, good immersion.
However, the game is very short (+/- 5 hours), and as such the asking price of €40 is way too much.

When it first launched I could not finish it due to crashes. I'm happy to say that's all fixed, for me at  at least. Almost all VR games can learn from the initiative movement presented in this game, it makes everything so much more immersive and natural feeling. 5/5 a must play.

Amazing Game, great story, great graphics, great immersion, had me really excited to get back into the game.  Worth every penny of the normal price, imo, and now i feel bad for getting it at a lower price in a bundle.  Going to check out what other things this studio worked on to see if i can support them further.

Well, I took the plung and bought into the game, I had been toying with it for about a week.  The reason for me holding out was my CPU, I looked at the specs for Echo Areana, they are identical to this game and it ran fine, so I bought and tested it on my AMD FX-9590 Eight Core and it runs abosolutly sweet.
To top that, after a couple of hours of perfect play I bumped all the settings to max, still no noticable slow downs or CPU issues, ROCK SOLID.
My CPU is water cooled, I did not get an idea on how the CPU was taxed but normally my machine under heavy load (Arma3) it will blow out some serious heat, this game was moderate.
The game itself, I am in story mode and can't put the controllers down, I am hooked.  The gameplay is fluid, mentally challanging and the graphics are out of this world (no pun intended).
I would buy it again, I would of bought it sooner if the game was not only tested on an Intel CPU, AMD works good for this game.
Sorry Intel lovers, my CPU cost half of what yours did and does the same.
This game feels so real. Absolute must have.

Great VR controls. Good Story. Game mechanics are more on the casual side of things. No VR sickness for me. Maybe 40€ are a bit pricey for 6-8h of gameplay, but on the other side VR is still a niche market.
I feel like I have just had one of the most amazing experiences of my life; real or virtual.  What an amazing adventure this game is.  It is a real must have for all VR gamers.
