The story and experience will stay with me for a long time. It's a fantastic game and a must for VR gamers. The graphics are great. The first time I looked down and realized I actually had a body, arms etc... I was blown away. It integrates with touch in such a tactile and natural way. The physics, movement and atmosphere are all top notch. I do think there were a few game play segments that were arbitrarily drawn out, but mostly the pacing is done well and will keep you driving through it until the very end. Can't recommend it enough!

I just wish my high end PC would be able to handle scene changes, when going from one location to another it has a hard time transitioning smoothly and I'm sure my frame rates are hit too just haven't checked, otherwise what a joy playing this title!

Zero G and VR seem to be a great fit and this game delivers that perfectly. The limited thrusters, the boost and pushing oneself from walls, doors and other objects just feels very natural!

Will there be a Lone Echo 2 or similar?

incredible VR experience. I would give it 4 and 1/2 stars if I could. Gameplay aspect is a bit lacking, puzzles are simple and the whole experience is a bit short with almost zero replayability. But it nails almost everything you want out of a VR experience. This is a must have for any VR users.

Played this in hourly bites over 2 weeks. The first and last 3rds are the best. Worth the price, AAA production value and visuals. Got the blood pumping a few times, and the mystery aspect hooked me. A bit less maze running would've been nice, but this was an adventure that will stay with me for quite sometime.

A stunning story and a revolutionary gameplay. This game need to be the model for every future VR games.

Two little things : many missions are repetetive and I find this game very expensive for a 5 hours session only.

I loved this game. The VR experience was very immersive and really enjoyable. I played through the whole thing sitting down though lol. I would love for the story to have been extended past the point where it left off though. Such a good story in my opinion. If looking for a good VR game, and like story driven gameplay get this game.

I congrat to the developers, Lone Echo is a masterpiece, maybe the best space thriller I have seen so far, only comparable with Alien Isolation. I wish that other space games I love, like Elite Dangerous or Star Citizen, would have the story and drama in their missions, like any of the chapters of this game!

Btw, I played the game in an i5 7400 and a AMD R9 380x w/4Gb (which is below the minimum oculus specs), and the game ran smooth with 1.50 resolution, and 1.0 Sharpening.

10 years from now, this game will probably be hailed as answering the question "Why does VR exist?"
I started gaming in 1989, and no game since I can remember (Maybe the Witcher 3) has given me more immersion, and enjoyment than this game. It is near perfection. It is the pinnacle of a gaming experience, in my opinion. And so...buy it immediately. That is all. Then play the multiplayer version.....in a large room....

Installed the game twice. Can't get past the loading screen then goes back to lobby. Running Win 10 64 128 Gig Ram Broadwell 6850 X99 Asus Board Titan X Palscal X2 Video. 

Updated all windows drivers and now can play all the Unreal 4 engine games so review rating is updated and not the developers fault it did not originally work. Have more playing to do before I can truly rate it but I'll keep coming back here
only played about 2 hours i think, maybe a bit more. Already would've been worth the price just for the graphics and detail + immersion alone, even if there wasnt any story.
The movement implementation sets the bar for VR motion. Fantastic story. Very immersive! Gorgeous visuals!
i love this game but it nearly bricked my computer and now it won't even open
Legendary game that teaches the world how to make a good VR game. Profoundly historic.

No regrets whatsoever in paying full price for this game.  For the most emersive experience, I definitely recommend buying a 3rd sensor to take advantage of 360 degree tracking.  The only criticism I have is that it would be nice to be able to save between checkpoints in case you get nauseous or too tired to continue playing.  Other than that, I think this is a game that everyone can enjoy regardless of their genre preferences.

A stunning example of good game design for VR. Dynamic functionality in 3D, zero gravity terrain in orbit around Saturn, capturing an absolutely STUNNING view. Optional objectives that pop up naturally along the story, a real sense of wonder and suspense leading up to an intense battle for life and death and a conclusion that feels good. This game wrapped up nicely, and brought with it a rather fantastic feeling of floating around in space with intuitive controls and simple but still enjoyable puzzles. Amongst all of the demo "games" out there for VR right now, this game is complete. I am content knowing I spent money on a game that isn't incomplete or just a tech demo. Thank you Ready At Dawn Studios for this fantastic experience.

THIS needs to be the example for future development of VR games! I could totally get into a MMO of this.  ***!SPOILER-ISH! crash on first airlock - set "Textures" to Medium or Low and restart game - may require computer reboot too - cant remember next checkpoint but you can safely put back to High **if you had it there before** (this is the fix that worked for me i7 6800K + GTX 1080)
An awesome space adventure, with fantastic graphics and art design and perfect VR integration. My first review on the platform because *everyone* with an Oculus should play this.
I had a blast. This is a proper game, with story and everything. Great physics, I played it all the way through.
5 stars anyway.
Never been so immersed in my life, easily one of my top 5 games ever, went straight from the end to a new game because I don't want to play anything else now.

review_title: Best VR game I've ever played
one_reviews_text: Visuals are stunning, storytelling is absolutely incredible, immersion is a 10/10. I l cannot recocommend this game enough if you are looking for the best VR has to offer.
Last update added  French, German, and Spanish but not Italian. really disappointed that my language lacks :-(

best vr experience i have had yet. was so incredibly immersive floating through space and tending to a space station. felt very real. it doesnt necessarily need it... but i think a little bit of combat could have been fun. great game regardless that everyone should buy. support these developers and lets hope they make a second one!!

If you're looking for a true narrative-driven VR game, and not just some "experience", this is it. I had trouble putting it down. It's a gripping story that just makes you want to keep going. Given the zero-g environment, navigation and motion are fairly fun and comfortable, though I have yet to find a VR title that makes me sick, so perhaps it's not saying much. Aside from a few bugs(frustrating, but not gamebreaking) it's a fantastic game.

At the end of the day, this is a must-have VR title. It shows what VR can really bring to the table of gaming, and not just in some gimmicky way.

The way Zero g navigation is done is simply brilliant.
Production value is top.
Action tends to become repetitive, with too many hand carry/interaction, but the sense of scale and the feeling of floating in space is incredible.

Massively immersive, well produced space adventure.  This is just the kind of thing I bought the Oculus *for*.  I'm a VR noob, and got slightly dizzy playing at first.  Had to take a few breaks (which was difficult, since I just wanted to get to the next bit of the story!).  By the end most dizziness subsided and now I think I've nearly found my VR legs.  

As others mentioned, it's a bit short, but to me totally worth the money for the sensation of zero-g staring out over the surface of Saturn alone.

Awesome game! Best VR experience I have had yet. Weightless environment, 360 view and great graphics made me feel as if I were there. All the above and the story itself make me hungry for a part 2. Great job guys/gals. Job well done

Aaron
This game is amazing. so intense and you just keep wanting more and more
In my opinion its the best thing to ever happen to the game industry

review_title: Everyone with a Rift must play this game
one_reviews_text: It's the current benchmark of how to create an immersive game universe.

review_title: Half life esk but in VR!
one_reviews_text: This game has the same puzzle solving adventure that Half-Life has, engaging story and fully immersive gameplay. I was even trying to move around my house thinking I was still in 0 gravity which I found amusing. By and far a game I would recommend for anyone's first VR experience!
This game is worth every penny. What an amazing experience!
That was the best 8 hours I've ever spent. Great game. Great atmosphere. Great game mechanics. And best of all, a really good story. Really enjoyed it. Thanks for a great experience!
MUST purchase! I wish I had bought it sooner. Please make an expansion!!
Great game, lived up to expectations.  Good story, good mechanics, lots of polish.

review_title: One of my favorite games ever.
one_reviews_text:
This is one of my favorite games ever. I enjoyed every single scene, mission. The graphics, the details.
Thank you! Bring us more.

review_title: What I have been looking for in VR
one_reviews_text: This by far is the Best VR game I have played.  Most game I have played feel incomplete and alot like tech demos. There seems to be a lack of story in most VR games at the moment. That is not the case with Lone Echo. The story line is great and there are some very intense moments. Gameplay is fun but the story and story telling is where this game really shines. I felt like I was actually playing as Jack and was emotionally connected with the outcome of the story. This game gives me hope for the future of VR gaming and I hope more games come out that are made to this level of story telling and excellence. Seriously a must play for anyone with a VR system!

I've played tons of VR games. But this is the one to beat them all, this is the absolute killer game for VR. It's so incredible that it almost feels like the platform itself was specifically made for this game and the control scheme. It's so good i even had dreams of being in space when going to bed after playing it. It's the game i show every skeptic. It has the best visuals, story, controls, metacritic score, multiplayer etc... you name it. GET. THIS. GAME.
The best narrative driven single player game you can have in VR. It will last you about 6 hours with little to no replay value. So keep that in mind before putting in the asked price.

There´s a lot of amazing and immersive VR games and there´s Lone Echo wich it is in an other completely different level.Astonishing and amazing are not enough to describe how brilliant is this game,just the best.

this game is so well developed. the last time i was this emotionally immersed into a story was the GOW series. the characters, while very few, each have a very rich backstory. the title says it all, if you own an oculus and you havent bought it what are you waiting for?! it was so good i actually came back to write a review. i actually played through the whole story in one sitting.. it was about 6 hours worth of game not including the hours you can spend exploring the KRONOS II station and collecting cube sats. the cheesy "it was just a game" way the guy pulls off his headset at the end of the trailer is real... i did it myself at least twice

review_title: The Best game on VR, period.
one_reviews_text: The only VR game to date that feels like a complete experience.

Great game until I hit this bug. You cannot proceed any further in the game. I tried reloading different save files, starting again and I get the same bug everytime. Google "Lone Echo Deplete Site Bug" and you'll see posts and videos of this.
The best VR experience to date!

Solid lenght, story, graphics, controls. 
I did find myself at times getting tired of some of the repetitive tasks you were given but the experience itself kept me hooked.

I just started and finished the game in one sitting... Took me about 6 straight hours... I just couldn't stop!!! It's just so immersive! I don't remember seeing a single loading screen or anything, it's all such a seamless transition between objectives and scenarios. It's just this huge world where you're in you feel like you're really there, more so than any other VR game I've played... I never come back to review games ever, but I had to do this one because the people who made this game deserve it! If this was the only game Occulus Rift had... it would still be worth the money, just to be able to play this game.

Really great game, but unfortunately it starts to get very jerky like the garfic card can't handle the workload but setting grafics on low doesn't help. Can't find another way to get in contact with defs... It started first when using the shield refiller in the foreign ship but stops when done. Now I'm in the foreign ships nav room searching the cryo pods and it's that jerky that I get sick and can't play anymore... I would try to delete and reinstall it buy I'm afraid my save files will get lost. - i7-6700K @ 4GHz, 16 GB RAM, NVIDIA GeFroce GTX 980 Ti
- update: First problem solved, but now I can't go on because a power cell sticks in place at some point. Tried to restart the game, but problem stays...

Wonderfull !! La claque !!
Amazing job of the TEAM !!
Lone echo 2 is for long ? :D
Can't wait for the expansion, good story , awesome gameplay. Want more.
Nice story but GTX1070 or above required to enjoy it in good conditions

review_title: Proof VR Works and can be lovable
one_reviews_text: The first time I got into the game, 3.5 hours was passed without me noticing! Comfort, controls and story; all point in the right direction. I finished this game in 3 sits!
i can't go back and play through half of the game again since i had to reformat my computer
The best VR game for me until now.

Hands down the best VR experience currently. There could be more variety in what you can do, maybe some space shooting but still the gameplay is excellent, atmosphere is top notch and the story keeps you playing to find out what the heck is going on. Also: BEST VR HANDS!

By far the best game I've played in a long time, VR or not. The visuals got me hooked from the word go, and the storyline pulls you in deeper and deeper with every moment. This needs to be part of everyones library.
I almost cried at the end part XD

review_title: Been gaming when pong came out!
one_reviews_text: As long I have been gameing this is one of the Best games in my life.  It was like I was part of a movie.  One of the best VR games out there to this date.  Don't miss out on this .
The story and gameplay mechanics where the best I've ever played. I've been wanting another game with it's environment involved around space for a long time.

I've not felt this much excitement, awe and panic playing a game in a long time, VR or otherwise. Great voice acting, beautiful visuals and scenery and very easy and fun to control. The best VR title I've played.
good game !

The cinematic feel is extrodianry. However, the gameplay is pretty lackluster. I felt as if I was rushing through my tasks just to see the next part of the story because said tasks are real dull. Had they thrown in something interesting like puzzles etc, this would have been a full 5 out of 5. Tasks are ''press this'' ''go press that'' ''press that again''.
Expansive, freeroam, all around vr good game. got to love the movement system for this game. My only complaint is that I want to know how the story continues after the end.

Lone Echo seems like the first full-length story-driven game that I’ve ever gotten truly captivated by long enough to completely lose track of time inside of! While other experiences are great, Lone Echo truly shines with its location, characters and character interactions, objectives, and graphical fidelity. It pairs the motion mechanic found in Mission: ISS, and its own improvements to that mechanic, with all the right features of a full-length story-driven game to form a truly immersive experience in VR that had me wondering just how long I had been there. Absolutely a MUST BUY, even at full price! I feel that it is perhaps the single best software investment for VR I’ve had to date. Others might be close behind, but Lone Echo is pretty amazing.
Where is "NEUTRAL SPANISH" language?????

Really intriguing and cool, but keep getting stuck in a glitch in the airlock.. Won't allow me to put the backpack on and they get stuck in mid air to no avail :( 

Want to continue but need a patch update i think!!!

review_title: I don't even have a Rift
one_reviews_text: I don't have a Rift and I still bought this amazing game. At full price. And I love it! Everything about it is great. I almost cried. (And not because of performance issues)

In my opinion,  THIS is the quintessential VR experience.  The graphics,  touch controller integration, story, and atmosphere all come together in that satisfying way so that you think to yourself,  "THIS is what I expected out of VR".   I can't say enough good things about Lone Echo.  It's so polished,  and so immersive that I feel like I've achieved my childhood dream of going into space.  'Spectacular' just doesn't describe how awesome this game is,  where I'm hesitant to call it a 'game'  as it really feels like you've been transported to an alternate reality.  The closer you look at the environment,  the _better_ it looks.  From the little mechanical actuators in Jack's wrist,  to the signs, access hatches,  and fabric textures on Olivia's space suit.  When Olivia first glide/floats over to check on me/Jack,  I was overwhelmed at the sense of realism,  as if an actual person was eyeballing me up close.  It's such an awesome experience that after my first play through,  I didn't immediately hop in to start another game;  I want to let the details, sense of awe, and delight fade a bit so that I can be overjoyed again on my next play through.  

To the entire 'Ready at Dawn' development team,  I salute you and give a 10 minute standing ovation.  Frickin' bravo, bravo....

I would give this game a 4 star rating, it's beautiful but a bit repetitive, I don't know if later this is different, because I can't pass the Depleted Dig Site mission. There is a bug in the game that doesn't allow me to continue, I can't activate the sensor array :( I tried several times and from different save games, but it's not working
This game infuses a heartfelt story with suspense, intensity, and wonder. The gameplay itself is absolutely masterful. This game has created a new bar for VR and it is exceptionally high.
VERY GOOD . LANGUAGE IN FRENCH PLEASE

review_title: Great VR Showcase Title with "AAA" Feel
one_reviews_text: Excellent game - showcases perfectly what VR was meant for. Great touch controls make every hand movement feel very natural. It's a good 8 to 12 hours experience. The only reasons I am not giving it a 5 star rating is due to a  bug where my respawning robot got stuck a few times and also, the ending is rather abrupt. If you needed a reason to justify to yourself why you bought the Oculus, this is it.

The mechanics of this game, with the hand grabbing in zero-g is probably the coolest VR experience I've had. The story is actually really solid and I felt for the characters. It's a beautiful game with awesome visuals. Problem is the puzzles get repetative, and basically fall into 2 categories: 1) find the thing - move the thing. 2) dodge the thing - don't get killed by the thing

I hope this will turn into specific VR genre!!! Such a good idea for VR, perfectly tricks the brain. I still can't believe i was just floating in space, moving absolutely freely without any sickness - AT ALL!!! AMAZING! The first VR game done JUST RIGHT. Go for it, buy it! I wish there were more full length games built around these mechanics. And I can see huge potential for future gunplay, e-sports, puzzles and much more. Core mechanics of movement work perfectly here and I enjoyed every single minute of game. 

CONS: Dubbing only in English with NO subtitles. It is a huge downturn for someone who can't understand English. Not having dialogues in such story driven game would be a shame. I remeber many instructions and/or advices I received just by audio when someone told me. This really requires me to listen all the time, understand properly and respond to what I am told. Imagine it for someone who doesn't speak English at all. 
There are also some minor technical glitches. I even experienced crash.

RESULT: In normal 2D gaming industry this wouldn't get more than 7/10. But VR mechanics WORK here and you get intense gaming session in which you dive into gameplay, forget everything else and just have amazing fun. Worth every penny. 10/10 in VR.
Hands down THE BEST VR EXPERIENCE AVAILABLE. Well done Ready at Dawn and Oculus. Hopefully a 2nd part is in the making!!
Stunning. The immersion is unbeliveable, stunning graphics and physics. This game makes pretty much everything else seem cheap and tacky

review_title: Everyone with a Rift should own this.
one_reviews_text: Most immersive VR experience I've used, both in terms of story and the movement system. Lone Echo sets the bar for what other VR games should be.

review_title: The best VR title so far.
one_reviews_text: Good story and creative controls lead to some of the best moments currently available in VR.  This is an experience that I would recommend to anyone.
just wow!

This is a fantastic game. The zero-gravity locomotion makes it especially unique and incredible to play. There were two things, though, that could have been fixed to make it better:
1. Bugs: Nothing serious, but there were a few, nonetheless.
2. Soundtrack: Music plays in the menu and during the credits, and the rest of the game has none. All the dramatic and exciting moments were very underwhelming, because they had no music to solidify the effect.
I would very much like to write a killer review, but i am lost for words. This game is fantastic. 10/10

By far one if not the best game out for VR! Lone Echo shows how well a VR game can actually be. It takes you right into this Sci-Fi world and doesnt take its foot off the pedal! I pure joy to play. My only complaint are some of the fetch quests, which can get a bit old, but that is not in any way taking away from this 5 star rating!
This game is an example of how well written stories and polished gameplay can take you on an incredible ride.

review_title: one of the best games i have ever played
one_reviews_text: amazing storytelling and graphics. if you own an oculus you need to buy this game!!!

review_title: One of the best VR titles
one_reviews_text: This is best experience that i've had with VR. Innovative controls, GOOD story and very good graphics. The game had some very intense moments.
AMAZING

review_title: Best VR designed game I've played yet
one_reviews_text: Only a few hours in and the look, feel and design really shine.  The movement system totally works with no motion sickness ever.  This game shows how you can make a VR title that would match a conventional AAA game.
Best VR Game so far! worth every cents!
Please add french langage !

review_title: This is the future of VR
one_reviews_text: ... and it has some weak points in terms of Game Design, but overall this is not to be missed! You will feel like you are in space, immersed in a really good and engaging story. Recommended!

review_title: The best VR experience, bar none.
one_reviews_text: This game is epic. It has some bugs, some of the missions are repetitive, and it's not always clear what you're meant to be doing - but the movement works so well, the environments are so detailed and the dialogue is brilliant.

Some are saying the movement makes them sick, but I found it awesome and exhilarating. After getting used to throwing yourself around, it was super fun to blast through some of the levels really fast. Really awesome game!
When I thought the game was going to begin, it suddenly ended :(
5/5, story is interesting, gameplay is well designed and it's long enough to not feel like a tech demo.

review_title: Best game to date for the Rift!
one_reviews_text: This is what VR is about, you won't be disappointed with this game.

review_title: Possibly the best game for Oculus
one_reviews_text: Long, immersive, with tons of gameplay features. Recommend it strongly for anyone with VR device.
5 stars Vr implement and history/gameplay, but  too short and  i didnt rushed.

From the story to the mechanics, this game is built for VR. Floating through space feels amazing, and the story is thrilling and well worth more than one play through to make sure you see everything there is to see. While the second half is a little slow, it is still more than worth seeing the story through. I personally became quite invested in the characters, which is not common for me in games. I anxiously await a sequel, and so should you.
I just finished this game and it is hands down the best VR has to offer right now. Lone echo 2 when?
The best VR game to date for sure!

I"ll keep this short-the beginning was a bit slow (especially if you're distracted by Echo Arena like me) but the game REALLY picks up after the first hour or so. Put simply, it's the most immersive game I've ever played...and I don't just mean in VR. The graphics are simply amazing, and don't actually look bad despite the Rift's limited resolution.  Pick it up if you want an intriguing and engaging, albeit slightly slow-paced single player experience.

Great atmosphere, easy to learn, very immersive, great visuals, great scenario, great voice acting, overall one of the best Oculus experiences ever. I say it is a must have for all Oculus owners. edit: I WISH IT HAD SOME DLC, OR BETTER YET A SEQUEL!

The only reason I gave this 4 stars is for the ending. Won't spoil anything, but it lacks. Everything else about this game was fantastic. From the atmosphere, to the movement, to the feelings of solitude and horror without a single jumpscare. If you get sick of teleshooters, and want to *live* an experience then I can not recommend this enough. Flawless movement and in depth scenery keep you in the moment. Have not tried the multiplayer yet, but I have Echo Arena and that's more than enough for me.

Cons. Glitchy, very glitchy, I had to download someone else's save file and do heavy trouble shooting in order to get past a specific part so that my game didn't crash. Oculus support, while nice, gave the good ol "gotta reinstall windows" canned response.

Repetitive, once the awe of VR goes away a bit you realize you are doing the same thing over and over and that you won't really enter a different phase of gameplay, it's just rinse and repeat.

Story. While the story is good, they either ran out of ideas or tried to play it smart for a sequel but it ends up being just cut short. It's understandable that you want to leave things unsaid for a sequel but they kind of went overboard here, you pretty much learn nothing of why this is happening and when you think you are about to find out, the game ends.

A little bit after halfway through the game you start messing with a substance that you are not supposed to touch or you die. This is used in a very smart way so that you have to be very careful on how to move around and use creative ways to get to another spot. Until you realize they are just going to keep using this until the game ends, it stops becoming a challenge and starts becoming tedious, the game's glitches don't help either, once I died and respawned 5 times in a row on top of the substance and kept dying and dying, I had to load a previous savefile.

PROS.

While the game is repetitive, it is by far the best game in VR so far, gameplay, story (what they do tell you) characters, etc.

Play area, while out in space, is not as impressive or immersive as you would like, it feels like a very small sandbox and you can pretty much see where everything ends. When you are inside ships, that's a whole new story, that's when this game shines, when you are inside a ship you really feel the scope of said spacecraft, it really feels like you are in a huge spaceship.

Heart, you can't make a game this engaging if you didn't pour every bit of your heart into it. Buy it!

Without a doubt my favorite VR game so far.  Very immersive and fantastic atmosphere. 

If you are at all into Sci-Fi, get it.. you will not regret it.

review_title: Loved it until game breaking bug
one_reviews_text: Intro section of the game was great, hit a game breaking bug with the eva rig
The first must-buy AAA VR title.

I don't generally like story/puzzle games ... but in VR, this was lots of fun! Most of the "puzzles" are just "find some stuff hidden in this room", but the environments are great fun to explore and the story is good. Expect about 5-6 hours of playtime.
Great Experience & Story ! I was bluffed all along !
french svp!!!
Not just the best VR game ever made, simply one of the best games ever made, full stop! A masterpiece that you don't want to end and leaves you yearning for a sequel as soon as it's all over.

Without a doubt the best experience in VR I have had so far. Incredibly detailed and realistic with a FULL body in the VR world!

Pushing yourself around via surfaces, or adjusting with tiny bursts from your thrusters is incredibly intuitive

This is definently one of the best VR games with i played.
Realy Nice Good job.
it literaly is just as exiting as the trailer makes it look and more

review_title: Not too hard and very amusing
one_reviews_text: It is not very hard to finish it and I had fun for many hours. Hard on the legs to stand for too long but that really is a sign of the quality of the game, is it not.

review_title: I put buying this off WAY too long
one_reviews_text: I waited way too long on this buy.  To me it looked "eh..interesting" but im kicking myself for waiting so long.  It plays with the most amazing control scheme of ANY VR GAME in existance.  Graphics are top tier.  Story is top tier.  It doesnt play like any other VR game out there (and trust me ive dumped a lot of money in VR games.  5/5.  I had ONE issue where the game crashed at the initial start of the game...I chalk it up to a fluke.  No issues since.  No motion sickness.  Standing is a lot more fun for me, but ive also sat, and sitting hinders you 0%.  BUY THIS GAME.  If you ever dreamed of being an astronaught then you have come to the right place.  No learning curve.  Just good old fashioned freedom of movement with an epic storyline FUN.  Im not sure what its really like for Astronaughts in space, but this is what I imagine its like.  WITH A KILLER STORY.

review_title: Best Game in VR so far
one_reviews_text: Everthink works fine. Story is well written and the setting is just mindblowing. But the absolut best part is the movement of the game. After playing i have to recheck my arm, because it felt like they were built of metal :D a absolute must buy game
It's a unique experience. 11/10 would play again.
Holy crap.  I should have bought this sooner.  What an amazing game.

I just got Oculus Touch controllers, and this game. This single game, is the thing that made me love them. It's only the first thing I've played with them, too. For those of you that aren't yet sold on the concept of it, the entirety of this game is in microgravity. You traverse the environment by grabbing onto it and flinging yourself around. 

... strangely, I'm someone whose susceptible to motion sickness, and yet this game doesn't do it to me. Lucky's Tale? Vomit comet. Ripcoil? Disorienting and migraine-inducing. Even the railcar in Obduction will set me off, but this... Surprisingly, nothing. I don't know where they get that rating of "moderate" from. It's a decently solid game, with a strong story that actually had me a little emotional at one point. The main characters are well-written, the voice work is pretty good, the environment work is amazing, it's... good. This is a good game, and a proper game it is.

Do yourself a favor and buy it.

I was liking this game untill i got about 3 hours in when at the depleted dig sit you have to move a sencer than an anomaly happens and thats where the game BREAKS. The sencers stay up and i canot cut through to change a fuse. so for that reason i score so low. canot get refund because its more than 2 hours in so im stuck with a broken game. after the latest update i seem to get alot of bad frame drops from silky smooth to stutting. will change my review when game gets fixd

review_title: A high water mark for VR
one_reviews_text:
The locomotion is amazing. At least for zero-G games this fells like a VR equivalent of the creation of WASD and mouse look by QUAKE players or the controls for 3D plataformers in Mario 64. It just fells right.

Caracter design, animation and voice acting are very effective in bringing the characters to life. I did care for their well-being. 

Awe inspiring settings, I spent many moments just floating and absorbing the experience. The graphics are beautiful (if your machine can handle it). If you don't enjoy contemplative experiences the sometimes slow pace of the game may be an issue. It was perfect for me. 

The only negative point I can think of is that I didn't enjoy the third act as much as the rest of the game. It's still good but not at the same level as the rest of the game. The actions and places start to feel repetitive. But this complaint pale in comparison to  all that this game does right.

TIP: If you already got your VR legs try playing with your caracter at an odd angle, it will add to sense of zero gravity. A little bit disorienting but thats the idea.
Just amazing. An entirely different kind of game. During the search for the cubes in the space I put on Pink Floyd's Echoes and it was just amazing
One of the best, maybe the best VR game on oculus rift. Immersion is totally the good word to describe that awesome adventure. Must-have

review_title: Let yourself get immersed and it's great
one_reviews_text:
Originally I gave 4 stars, but then when comparing this game to other VR apps, it felt so harsh giving only 4 stars....This game is all about 1) The Immersion and movement of being 'in Space'. 2) The character interaction/story.  
Strip away the fact it's in VR, and the game is a collection of simple, repetitive tasks, that can probably only be enjoyable in a VR environment and would bore you to death in 2d....Even in VR the tasks become irritating at times, but it doesn't matter because so much else of this game is great.  The story of/relationship between the main characters is excellent; with a generous amount of sarcasm throughout.  I felt immersed in the game and although I became frustrated on occasion, the game didn't drag on too much.  It was easy to get involved in the game.  The entire game is very smooth, plays well, and the interaction with objects is fun.  I imagine that playing Lone Echo will make Echo Arena a lot easier in terms of controls.  I found a few issues, like getting stuck in the ground once (game-restart required), and a few very minor things, but I love that you can't "go-through" walls with your head etc like in most VR apps.  A great experience overall.  The ending scene(s) left me wanting more.  Will play again.

review_title: Hands down the best VR game so far
one_reviews_text: This was one of my first games played in VR (bought during Summer of Rift offer) after the usual demos and so far on the immersion, story line, graphics, sound it is hands down the best. I've still not finished it as I'm stuck on a frustrating section later in the game, but I'm sure I'll come back to it soon. I think the immersion is the best implementation in a VR game so far as you see your entire body - I don't understand how nobody else appears to have pulled this off yet! i5 4690K / 16GB / 1080FTW2 - everything cranked to max - Plays great!

Ever want to experience zero G, go on a space walk, with jet packs and all that? This game simulates the zero G expeince really well. You actually get a sense of being weightless. Exploring space is amazing and the scenery is breathtaking. This is probably the closest I'll get to achieving my childhood dream of going into space. Brilliant game, despite the slightly repetetive, almost inane tasks. Scan this, scan that, change this spacefuse, the tasks are a little mindless. The thing is, you don't really care because everything else is so awesome. Well polished game.
verry nice game i love it

review_title: Simply the best sci-fi single player exp
one_reviews_text:
I been playing video games since pong came out as a kid. Fast forward 41 yrs later and now I am on VR and I have to say this game is without a doubt MY favorite Sci-fi VR experience EVER.

The story is simply great and needs to be played to fully appreciate it. You will without a doubt(as long as u have a pulse) become emotionally invested in these characters. (Sociopaths will not find this a good game either, so please exclude any of the Royals or ppl of that status) =p


I dont want to say much except that if u have  a good gaming rig then you will enjoy this all the more ... I just played it again on my a gaming rig I just built that has a Ryzen 1800 & 16gb 3200mhz ram along with a *1080ti that I got for a great deal *(only reason I would ever buy thew top end, as it is never not worth your dollar per performance %--I digress ,sry. I played it the first time on a good but older system that I still have  XfX 290x with 16gb ram & quad core intel @ 4.5 ghz. The new comp made it silky smooth every frame but both played it excellent.
As far as price goes, this title is worth every penny considering most people pay to go to a movie for max 3 hrs of entertainnment and spend more than 40 bucks, this you will be part of the entertainment and depending if you explore the game can last 15+ hrs but for most 10 hrs is likely. 
The only negative I can give it is a few of the quests that you do seem tedious and can become fustrating if it wasnt for the vr aspect making them even not bad cause you are fully involved in the experience. This game has set a new standard for me in single player games on/in VR. It is a must buy if there ever was one. Do yourself a favor and go enjoy one of the best games reguardless of VR. It is that good.
It should be game of the year in VR imho. 

I hoped I helped make someone's day and they had a great time as well.
Cheers to all,
Danny
Great game, but we need Chinese

review_title: This is my dream VR game
one_reviews_text:
Excellent locomotion, great training, great voice acting. Very real, interactive and lived-in environment, great Sci-fi setting and plot, beautiful graphics. 
This game is not for people looking for a fast paced shooter. This is a slower more immersive and thoughtful game. Highly recommended.
No words can describe this adventure. If I would read the story of the game on a piece of paper I'd say yah okay, kinda average but holy cow THIS is some amazing stuff they produced!

I think my best VR game so far. Stunning graphics, immersive story, proper voice acting. Nearing the 50% mark i felt the game became a bit repetitive though. I experienced some glitches that really messed up my experience, wrote on the forums, but no response from the devs. Within a few days a found a workaround. Hope those bugs have been solved now. Only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars. Can recommend to everyone!

There is no better game that I know that works better with VR than this. Graphis and sound are great, controlls are simply perfect!

The gameplay however lacks a bit tbh. Puzzles are quite repetitive and you'll spend too much time in just searching stuff and put it somewhere. Be sure if you see any kind of device after the tutorial mission - it will not have power and you have to look for cells. Over and over again.

Anyway - still a very good game!
Best . VR . Game . Ever
Started out strong, and ended ten times stronger.  Stunning graphics, compelling storyline, fantastic animation and wonderful voice casting.  If you love science fiction, you won't be disappointed.

Best VR experience I've had so far after nearly a year of owning Rift. Hate to have finished the story so soon though; I wanted to keep going.

Immersive, well-written, and a compelling narrative story. Can't praise this one enough. Well worth the cost for the experience.

This is not a game, it's a miracle.
Please, play it. Play it whitout any reason, whitout any expective.
Play it.

review_title: Great example of what VR can be
one_reviews_text: The first full feeling game I have played for VR. The controls and movement feel spot on and the story is excellent. While the puzzles are only simple they never feel like a chore and feel integral to the storyline. My only issue was a slight but persistant stutter despite my hardware being more than adequate. Despite the issue I still consider this one of the best VR games around.

One of the best titles in VR so far, no doubt about it. The graphics are really really good, so are the controls and interface. The developers though are missing some staff, like a musician and a scenario writer. Because there is absolutely no music. I can already hear "its space, its quiet", yeah right that bull. Go play some other space games and you will see how much feeling a good music can give in a space game. Also the story of the game is soo booorrrriiinggggg! Seriously its one of the most boring games i have ever played. No thrilling scenes at all. The only good scene is the one you see at the trailer. There was so much potential in this game, you could have made so many good scenes, but no. You didnt even steal some good thrilling scenes from othe pc space games. There are so many out there! Its a pity and i was so much disapointed when i ended the game.
but very good
Lone Echo is by far the best VR game I've played yet. Don't skip this one, you'll thank yourself later. There better be a Lone Echo 2 coming!!!

review_title: This game is a must have.
one_reviews_text: This game is absolutely amazing. It's by far the best title I purchased for the OR/touch. Very realistic and immersive, taking advantage of touch controllers in a unique manner, challenging enough yet not too much, worth every penny IMHO. I run OR on a vivo PC X and this game ran perfectly with the exception of a couple short scenes.

review_title: This is what VR is all about
one_reviews_text: I know it seems like a lot of money, I bought it because I know I could get a refund, but I wont be asking for one. Its hands down the best VR game out of the 30+ things I've tried. The immersion is incredible, I've spent as much as 5 hours no breaks in one stint playing this game; the story is solid, the diverse missions keep you engaged, the touch and movement mechanics really put you in the game. This is simply a must have game!
I purchased it and was working fine. after 2 weeks of not playing it,came back and it wont open keeps giving error message and to try later...ive been tryng!! please help
Best VR game so far

review_title: This is what VR is for!
one_reviews_text: Storytelling has never been so intense. The game uses the VR-Mechanics very well (Like the hand-scanner, the cutter or control panels). The movement is great and intuitive. You really get connected with Liv and even Appollo, you really feel "Lone" if you have to make your way alone. You have to buy this.

i cant wait for lone echo 2 i dont know if you will make a second one but i hope you do this was one of the best vr games i have played plz make anouther i loved the game great cherecter modoling and surrounding just a perfict game in the end hope to see a second and thamks for making it 


sorry for the spelling errors

review_title: BEST VR GAME IN THE STORE
one_reviews_text: Just buy this game and you will not regret it!

On starting up Lone Echo, I wasnt really sure what to expect. I'll be brutally honest and say, I'm completely blown away- shocked in fact. I've never witnessed/experienced anything quite like this. Where on earth do I start?? The graphics are astounding, the movement is fluid, original and responsive, the gameplay is deep and immersive, the interaction is frighteningly 'real'. You actually feel as if you are talking to a real person when dealing with 'Olivia', she reacts just the way a real person would. If you bump into her she complains with a witty or sudden remark, if you stand too close she'll say something like, 'personal space thank you Jack'!. Further to the mention of witty, theres plenty of subtle humour along the way, I smiled a few times so far, Olivia seems very fond of her robotic companion, Jack (you). You are taught how to interact and control 'Jack' along the way with well placed tutorials. Good use is made of each button and trigger on the hand controllers, on that subject, this is the first game I've seen where the shoulders and upper arms are in view. Adding to this, you can also see your robotic body if you look down, such attention to detail will add to what is already a breathtaking experience. I havent even skimmed the surface with this review, so you best hurry along and purchase this masterpiece, I guarantee you wont be disappointed. Well done to the Devs and Oculus, youve surpassed all my expectations, thank you.

review_title: Absolutley 100% worth every cent you hav
one_reviews_text:
I am praying for a sequel. This game as very good voice acting and memorable characters.A really cool movement mechanic and 4-5 hours of gameplay. The story is very good and at some times you will start to feel a sense of mystery as to what is happening and what anything is. Please grab this game, it's so worth the money and you will wish it was endless.





Also if the Devs see this, PLEASE MAKE A SECOND ONE! EVEN IF YOU DOUBLE THE PRICE I WILL STILL PLAY IT.

Once you get past the first couple of drab hours where you're basically doing virtual labor on a space station, it get interesting. Even the mechanics seem to get more interesting, as they are tied up on more interesting jobs and functions.

It's not the most diverse game, and the ending is a bit abrupt. But the gameplay certainly improved as the game went along and the story also improved quite a bit.

review_title: Best VR game i've played so far.
one_reviews_text:
The story is interesting, the progression is at a good pace and everything feels really immersive. I haven't had any problems with flaring, that most other VR games suffers from with their bright light settings. 

I really hope to see a sequel for this one.
Thanks for those incredible moments and can't wait for what's coming !
This game is seriously incredible. Fantastic story, puzzles, amazing graphics, LOVE it!

This was my very first game i tried on Ocolus Rift with the new controllers, and wow what an experience.. The first time I saw my hands in front of me they perfectly replaced my real hands and when i moved them I looked like I had mechanical arms..
I was super impressed by how realistic and beautifull it look ( for a vr title ) and movement is smooth and easy, and pretty cool to use your hands in 0 G to move your self arround.. As the game goes by you unlock new skills such as plasma cutting stuff open, and get bigger jets pack, light in your helmet and so on...   The main female character I found to be rather attractive, and well if this had been an xxx title i would really have a great time touching her here and there and enjoying the view.....BUT i was rejected, and even kicked by her, but at least I could do what I wanted just had to wait for her to look out the window and then i was ready ha ha  ;-)     well what i want to say is, she is very realistic and you feel a connection...   I also really love how the controlres work and how you talk and how your pull out different tools from your arm by sliding a wrist band and such things.. it is cool and look good and is initaturative. ..   So far i played 1-2 houres and om outside of the ship. I find it a bit hard to navigate and find the places i need to go but I get there eventualy.. Also sometimes it can take some time to figure out what it is the game want you to do.. Sometimes you almost give up and then you scan the right panel and you finaly get an option to talk with the woman and advance.. well i guess it all give meaning, just need to figure out how the game work..

I have to stop every 30 minutes or so since I start to sweat and feel a bit strange from all the motion that goes on... But one reason is that i did not figure out i could actual rotate my caracter with the right control stick rather than turn arround my self all the time this help allot.. All in all Buy the game it is amazing.

review_title: Better than the others, but not great
one_reviews_text: First off, I played through the entire game, so I've gotten the full experience. I can say that within the first hour of the game, you've experienced most of the mechanics that will be in the entire game. There were several times near the end when I thought "Man, if they just did X, this could be the next metroid", but they didn't. Ultimately, this is a (beautiful, yet generic) VR puzzle game consisting of cutting things, placing things in other things, avoiding small round things, and not going to radiated areas for too long, with some VERY minor shooting involved. The story is interesting, but ends abruptly without further details. I had a decent amount of fun, but there's no reason to play it again.

review_title: This is no game, it's an experience.
one_reviews_text:
By far the best VR-experience released to date. If you are looking for an amazing journey rather than a game-like demo, you should give this a try. Movement in zero gravity eliminates nausea brilliantly. The story takes me through a series of emotions and reactions I did not expect from myself. Voice acting is great and the level of detail in the visuals are stunning. Mapping of the body and its movement is stimulating to experience and gives a much more real sensation than most other games I've tried. Especially when it comes to all the different kinds of interactions you can do with your virtual body. If every game from this point takes a lesson from Lone Echo, Virtual Reality itself has gained a lot. Great work, Ready at Dawn Studios!

I can find nothing to complain about and the only reviews I've seen giving bad grades are people not giving it a try because it doesn't come in Spanish, which in turn is unfair to the game. It is not like I walk around expecting games to be released in my mother tongue, that would've been retarded, both by me and whoever in the industry that decided on such a bad decision. So instead of shooting down a masterpiece like this, learn English. It is 2017 and the age of IT does come with one particular language up front.

I dont buy games für 40 or 50 bucks normally. I made an exception for this game, since the review i read were that good. I am a gamer since 20 years. I played A LOT. And honestly: if u rate this game just for what it is, how it is done, how its mechanics work, how athmospheric it is by its story and the narrative ideas.. this game is not that good at all. VR is definitely incredible, but if you dont mix things up - VR's immersion and this game as what it is - this is never more than a mediocre, small push buttons game. Two things i wanna add: the feeling it gives u to be outta space is strong, i personally disliked it - it was kind of nerve wrecking so that i did not like the experience alltogether. The other thing is, that when i played it, i had several bad glitches, where my hands and arms were not functional and outta place.

Just started playing it and believe me (said in Donald trump style) I'm a stickler on details.  The game looks amazing.. its like living in a dream while playing it.  And you can literally travel in space.. like you dreamed.  The acting is head on, better than many movies you'll see on HBO.  Only down fall.. The woman's Eyes... you get up close.. you notice she's just an animation.  If they could give more detail out of her.. that would have been great.   Aside from that.. its like living in a movie and your the star.  So what are you waiting for??
But the ending was a bit abrupt. Well... They have hinted that the story will continue.
Best game I have found for the Rift.  I hope they more or at least a sequel.  I hated it when I got to the end.
Really cool and immersive game. I want more games like this!

review_title: Rift owner with 20+ games in my library
one_reviews_text: Like you have read with so many other reviews, this is the best Oculus game I have experienced as of 9/07/2017. Twenty+ games in my library so far. Some good, some bad, few are amazing. This IS one of them! You will only be dissapointed wanting more, not by quality or immersion..........Are you still reading my review? Seriously buy it, play it, fall in love!
Best Rift VR game at the moment. If you do not have it, buy it! It worth his full price sale, no need to wait for any sale price.

This game deserves 5 stars, but it's 3 from me because all the trouble i got, bought for play it the weekend and go it right on Monday...

lone echo blew me away. it's the best VR experience i know so far.
Amazing game. Definintly one of my favorites now. Can be a little glitchy but eh I enjoyed myself far to much to really care.

This game feels like a good sci-fi movie you're taking part in. Everything looks good, controls are good, story is good, I really enjoyed it and I would want more of that. I felt very entertained so this is a full 5 star for me. 2 sensors works well, use the right stick to rotate yourself

running this on a 1070 with full details without issues

A very very nice made game with breathtaking scenes and surroundings. The adaptation with touch is absolutly awesome. Feels like reality. Needed a few moments after gaming to find out it's not zero gravity in my room. There should be much more games like this.

I am only 45 mins into this game and i am totaly addicted, feels like your totaly there floated in space. if i could give it 10 stars i would well worth my hard earned cash cheers to the devs for an excellent game

review_title: The best experience on Rift as of Sept 2
one_reviews_text: Absolutely stunning game from start to finish.   Sense of desolation in space, great acting, well thought out story, great visuals, great locomotion, great use of Touch controls, intuitive play - can't say enough.  Desperately hoping for not just a sequel but a whole series!

This is a really great game, if you enjoy story and are looking to loose yourself in a world for awhile this is a must get. The game mechanics are solid and enjoyable and while they do not get very complicated the story and atmosphere in this game keeps you interested. Its like playing your role in a scifi movie; really hope to see a sequal or somthing similar.

A must have title, I don;t even want to talk too much about it in case I spoil it for others, just trust me - get it.
If you hate space games, it won't matter, the setting is just a small part of it. Honestly, pull the trigger, this will go down as one of VRs first classic games.
Absolutely awsome and phantastic game. THIS is VR. Never had such a phantastic VR experience before. Lone Echo is truly showing what VR can be.  Clear buy recommendation!

review_title: First polished VR game to date.
one_reviews_text: If i would give it a rating it would be 85%. But 5 stars due to it being the best in this platform. The movement feels natural and immersive unlike all the other titles using teleporting or locomotion controls. The story is decent and graphics are amazing, there is a polish to this game that is yet to be seen in VR games, small things such as being able to see your own body and arms! NPC reacting to you grabbing onto them, the voice work is great too as well as the graphics and lipsync. Basically everything you expect from a AAA game. The length is decent too for a singleplayer adventure campaign. If I had to recommend one game to buy, it would be this.
Before playing this, train your dog to bite your leg every two hours. Otherwise you forget to leave and you (and the dog) will starve.

Lone Echo is the kind of experience that makes your mind run wild with thoughts of how amazing going on space adventures in VR can be. I really hope everyone in the gaming industry plays it, it's the kind of content I've been waiting for. I remember looking at the Robinson The Journey art and trailer and imagining something with this level of interaction, polish, and convincing environments.

Some day we will be able to travel with a group of friends going to large highly detailed planets and worlds experiencing all kinds of conflict and wonder. Lone Echo has set up the first of many stepping stones to get there so I'm really impressed.

Lone Echo felt real in a way a Hollywood sci-fi movies usually don't. It has respect for it's plot and characters. The dialogue was given attention and the early interactions are pretty well done. TBH they probably needed one more act between the first and second half of the game or maybe put in some weird awkward bits of interacting with other units so you realize how much you level of AI is welcomed by her. The other small issue that would have been fine is a bit more of a soundtrack for when key events take place, but the sounds are well done. They nailed the pacing in the first half, but there really didn't feel like there was a moment to breathe in the second half.

This is space mining adventure pulled off exceptionally well. Lone Echo 2 needs to happen!
The only bad part is when it's all over, a must buy for the VR enthusiast

review_title: Best VR game out there currently!
one_reviews_text: Simply an amazing game.  5 stars isn't enough!   Very polished and groundbreaking on all fronts.  This game has easily justified my entire investment in VR hardware to date.  Just buy it, you WILL NOT be disappointed!  I can't wait for the sequel...  just hope the team that made this game is already busy working on it!  The future of VR gaming is right here folks!
its like your in space... !!!

This is, by far, the best VR game that I've ever played.  It starts a little slow (compared to others), but it really gets interesting after the first hour of play time.  If there ever was a Oculus Rift "system seller", this is it!
Would like to actually play this seemingly amazing game, but I cannot because there is no actual troubleshooting help besides "turning it off and back on again"
Amazing game! What an experience! Please make a sequel! I want to improvise more! :D

On release this game ran like a dream. It was smooth, worked really well and there were no issues. Since the time of writing my original review stating how fantastic the game is it now(18/09/2017) seems the game is unplayable no matter the settings. I'm in reprojection(I think?) and the game runs extremely poorly once I load my save file. Completely unplayable.

Nothing on my system has changed, I have the same drivers, everything. Every other VR game runs fine but this, since the latest update(s), is completely unplayable.

Playing through this I found out you could use the right thumbstick to rotate so I didn't have to spin so much in place when I felt like chilling out in my chair, but the events that happen in the game leave you forgetting you're even sitting down and I find myself facing the complete opposite direction from my screen.

In other words, the story and the events in the game will keep you playing for as long as you're physically comfortable doing. If I hadn't had to go to work the next day, I'd probably have played through this in two days, in several sittings. The story did leave me wanting more, will there be any continuation or other perspectives in this universe? I sure hope so.

First off, this is one of the best VR games I've played since I got my Oculus.  Its amazing.  The mechanics behind the movement are awesome, it really allows for a good immersion experience.  The plot line is excellent, it flexs ones problem solving skills pretty much throughout the entire game, and if something isn't clicking theres a conversation option somewhere nearby that will point you in the right direction.

Sensor and laser functionality are on point, furthering the immersion experiance, making you forget that you're just holding touch controllers.

And as far as that one thing goes, its really small but would make a pretty big difference to me in one part of the game.  The movement is awesome, although in the section (possible spoiler) where I'm first navigating through the unknown vessel, I'm using random floating metal debris, essentially as a tennis racket, to bat the orbs out of my way.  At first, it was going well, but the longer I attempted to hold on to a random piece of space metal, the more it started glitching out and making my whole arm go into robot seizures, ultimately it extends faaaar outside of normal reach and touchs the biomass, equaling death.  That's really the only issue I've come across though.

Playing on the windows mixed reality headset and controllers... game does not work very well with windows headset. Controlers lose tracking witch leads to you glitching around the map not doing things intended. Have tryed trouble shooting this a few ways so far has not worked. Game seems like a good game if I could get hands and arms to quit bugging out. Will edit if I get working.
this is currently the best and unrivalled VR game - don't hesitate - buy it! :-)

Incredibly immersive experience and a beutifull and engaging narrative.

Locomotion system works great. Once I got used to it, I really bought into the feeling of being weightless and floating in space.

The game brilliantly shows the strengths of VR in telling an immersive and compelling story, especially with all the tiny details that makes you belive both the world and the characters.

I just finished the game, and wow, it's incredible.  This is by far the most immersive game I've played yet.  If I were to give any advice to someone playing it would be to take your time and explore, especially in the first half of the game.  There's tons of small details to be discovered that really flesh out the universe.  I hope they make a sequel.

review_title: Lone Echo is the VR app of the century!
one_reviews_text:
Lone Echo is, in a word, "breathtaking."  I could say more, but my thesaurus would run out of adjectives.  This is not a game.  It's not an experience.  You are simply stepping into another reality.  The bar is now set unfairly high for all other VR developers.

Where to begin ... the graphics are photorealistic; the dialogue has the quality of a Hollywood script; there is so much attention to detail in every respect.  This is a case study in, "little things matter."  When you are interacting with Olivia (your human counterpart on the space station), she has perfect awareness of your presence.  Her eyes shift to you whenever you are speaking (whether you are above, below, left, right, etc.).  You always feel like you both have vital roles in what's going on.  The jobs that you perform are so convincing that it suspends all disbelief.

I could go on and on, but I want to immerse myself back into Lone Echo.  This review is taking valuable time away from a most amazing experience.  I have dozens of VR games, apps, and experiences ... nothing touches Lone Echo.

If everyone in the world would play Lone Echo for just five minutes, everyone would own an Oculus.

This achievement deserves more than five stars!

Note: When I launch the game, I always receive a message stating that my rig is insufficient (lack of the right minimum "instruction set").  I just click "okay" ... and then Lone Echo runs silky smooth.  Not sure what that's about.  Old rigs work just fine if they have a new graphics card, tons of memory, and an SSD drive!  In any case, my sincere thanks to the development team for all of their hard work!!!

review_title: Best game I have played on the Rift
one_reviews_text:
Feels like you are there. The story is nicely done as well.

The best VR game I have played and should be an instant purchase for anyone with a Rift.

This game has very high quality Assets, including models, animations and voice overs. While I was afraid that the game would only offer repetitive "space mechanic"-style missions at the beginning, the story quickly drifted away from the "protocol" and hooked me. The dialogue system works very well and I felt sympathy for the virtual characters. The dialogs are well written as well. I played it standing with room-scale, but during the game I often forgot I was not weightless, I was totally in on that space station!
The game length is good, there aren't many different gameplay mechanics but the game ends before it gets repetitive and the story makes up for that. I played it in 3 sessions with about 3 hrs each, which equals in 9hrs of good and high quality gameplay. The only design flaw i noticed was, that you don't know when you reached a savepoint, which let to loosing a few minutes of progress when I ended a session.
I only give 4 Stars, though, because I experienced some major bugs:
- It crashed once during the first 30 minutes
- After dying, I was respawning in a deadly situation (outside a pod). I then re-centered and then wasn't able to leave the pod. (Handle animation wouldn't come)
- Liv once disappeared during a ferry scene, later in the game and reappeared when we reached our target
- In the pre-last chapter I had major FPS drops (below 45 FPS). Reducing the graphic settings didn't help. It was fine before and after that chapter (didn't try to restart because of unknwon savepoints)
- Physic glitches every now and then

An incredible experience. 
Looks great, good story, fantastic VR controls and mechanics. 

Would recommended even if it wasn't VR but the VR it is a must buy for Oculus. 

The ending is a bit abrupt, really hope we get the sequel it would seem to imply.

review_title: Is this a game or an interactive movie?
one_reviews_text: First we had movies, then we have 3D movies (or IMAX depending on which you think came first), then we had 3D and IMax together, high frame rate, and finally we have this! Where you are the main character and you control the flow of the movie. The future is now! Don't think I'll ever go to a theater again. One day, you'll tell your grand kids about what a theater was and they won't understand.

THIS is what we all hoped VR games would be like. Top quality visuals, story, characters,  controls, sound, music... everything. It's all there, and it's beautiful. I want everyone I know and care about to play this game, to see what I saw, and feel what I felt. The awe you feel playing this game can not be overstated. The environments are a wonderful mix of massive open spaces and cramped vents, corridors, and rooms. Everything is believable yet wonderous. This is a must have game for anyone with a Rift + Touch controllers.

The game took about 12-15 hours for me to complete. I have two cameras and it was enough to play the game without much issues. Very occasionally, I'd be pointing in the worst possible direction IRL and my hands would spaz a bit. The Right thumb stick (rotate in-game) makes it super easy to compensate when combined with RL rotation. It's easier to pick up than it sounds. TL;DR: You do not need a third camera to play and love this game. For me, ~80-90% of my arc was good with 2 cams.

Further, my play space is only 3 ft x 3 ft, and it was more than enough.

In retrospect, I think part of why the controls of this game work so well is that the entire game plays in zero G, and legs are not used at all. You can grab pretty much anything with your hands and navigate yourself with ease. You also have hand thrusters, which you'll us constantly to orient yourself when you're not able to grab something. It's a perfect scenario for VR interfaces today, and works brilliantly.

Haven't finished it yet but I'm fairly deep into the story and it's been an incredible VR experience so far. Controls feel pretty much perfect and really help with the feeling of immersion into the game world. The plot is also engaging with the dialog and characters feeling fleshed out and complete. Graphics are quite good as well...no VR graphics are on par with the resolution of a 2D screen with maxed graphics but this is easy on the eyes and has several wow moments which the graphics bring you into the world very well.

The feeling and control of moving through a weightless environment is stunning and the controls really tie into this form of movment perfectly.

Then there is the added multiplayer Echo Arena gameplay which I've only dabbled in a bit but it was one of the most intense VR experiences with a very good concept for simple but engaging multiplayer gameplay. Looking to the future if this is added to with more arena options in the future then it will only get even better!

I would recommend this game to everyone and it makes a great showcase to bring newcomers into the entire VR experience.

In short Yes...........
Graphics 10/10
Voice over acting 10/10
Story 10/10
Dollar value 10/10

let make this clear, other games have made me mad spending money on them, short game lack of content. THIS is not one of them and i can only hope they make more. you will laugh and care for Oliva, being Jack was a heck of a lot of fun. Game play fantastic, Story brilliant. Small issue with the popup menus but nothing to complain about. 

If you want your faith restored in high priced VR games here it is. Alone Echo!

One of the best VR games available today. Amazing puzzles, exploration & story. 

UPDATE: Well i have spent a good two hours playing this game now and WOW, its incredible! The attention to detail, the tools you get on your hand and dont even get me started on the first time you leave the space station. Mind. Blown!

This game is one of the best titles available for vr at the moment... A game that u wont beat in less than an hour anywayz. Graphics r amazing if ur computer can handle turning settings all the way up. The only complaint i have with the game is the control physics should b more like the "Mission ISS" game or experience. Specifically where in "ISS" u can reorient your postion by holding two fixed points in the craft to use your hands to move your camera postion and oriention in relationship to your headset. That would make the game feel much more real. Other than that its one of the best games i've purchaced so far. Please fix the controls as i specified devs, Im sure others would agree. Try out the Mission ISS , I think its free, to c what im talking about.

Probably the best VR Game I know.
Awsome graphic, great physics, genious gameplay, cool story, one of the best VR-experience you can get so far....

If you are thinking between the title ADR1FT and this, definitly go with this. The interactions with the environment, the mobility, story and emmersion, are some of the reasons why this is my favorite game on VR. Even though I have not finished it, I give it a 5/5 so far. It is truly one hell of a ride.

Been playing this game for awhile just starting to get fun.Then for the last week or so everytime i try to play it crashes and keeps running in the back ground. So i have to restart my system. The date is  sept 25 2017 @ 12;45 p.m.  I think its time for a UPDATE!!!!!!!!

review_title: Best VR Experience I've Had Yet
one_reviews_text:
There's so much to say about this title, from the immersive and innovative gameplay mechanics, fluid movement physics, the emotional connection to your fellow astronaught, the well-designed pacing, the excellent art style, and the fact that we FINALLY have a long, AAA story experience in VR (well, it was lengthy for me 'cause I like exploring, reading, and playing with everything). The feeling I got from playing around with Half-Life 2's physics for the first time over a decade and a half ago is the same wonderment I experienced once I grasped this game's mechanics and zero-gravity locomotion. That's high-praise, and I mean it.

If you liked quality, polished VR games like RoboRecall and SuperHot but want to take a break from shooting things to instead be immersed in deep space, this is THE must-own VR experience of 2017 thusfar.

review_title: I started round 2 it was so good
one_reviews_text: Based on the reviews I was excited to play and had high expectations.   Both were extremely satisfied; the games was exciting to play and exceeded my expectations.  The graphics, story, and gameplay were excellent.   The learning curve of moving through the game was little and I never ever got any motion sickness.   This game for me is the standard by which I am comparing all future games.   The interaction with in-game menus, buttons, controls, and items were flawless.  (does take some practice).  Storyline was good.   I did get stuck a couple times with finding solutions or knowing where to go, but you have to listen and make sure you check your objectives and also report when you are near an objective.   Not 100% intutive but you will figure it out.    I have started round 2 and it is just as much fun or more since I know I know where  I am going/doing.    You also pick up on details you missed the first round.

review_title: One of the best VR games today
one_reviews_text:
The game is great! It uses VR in a wise way as it does not just copy a common game into VR. Moving and acting feels very natural because of very well designed controls. Also the interaction with another character in the game (Olivia) is done very well and adds a good portion of humor. The surroundings are just great and the size relations transport well. It is a real space adventure. These aspects increase the immersion dramatically.

The only downside is that the gameplay does not vary a lot and basically you end up doing the same things over and over. But this also holds for nearly every shooter (which this game is none of). The interesting story keeps you going.

Regarding motion sickness I was surprised. There is nearly none. Though the movement is continuosly (snap turn though... can be deactivated, I think). I could play for hours without problems.

This game shows the potential of VR games. I hope there will be Lone Echo 2.

review_title: Best VR game in existance right now
one_reviews_text: I just finished the game.  There is nothing out there right now to match it.  It is incredible. They've got locomotion down so it doesn't make me sick, and the story is the best I've seen in VR so far.  Highly recommended!
So far, the best game I've played in VR!
This is the polished multi-hour VR single player experience I was waiting for. Incredibly well done and a delight to play. I can't wait to dive into the multiplayer!

review_title: A for Atmosphere, B- for Gameplay
one_reviews_text:
While I'm pretty sure the space program won't take me at my age, I've lived a spaceman's life through this game.  The sense of scale is fantastic, the movement mechanics are solid, and the feeling of being is space was wonderful. So why 4-stars? Because nearing the end of the game, I began to realize I was doing the same basic tasks, which started to get boring, but the sense of being in space, and a good story overcame that.
This game, along with Resident Evil 7 VR, are my personal benchmarks of where VR can take you, and how for periods of time, make me forget that I was playing a game. Bravo!
This game is well made in every aspect, graphics, voice acting, story etc. The controls are innovative for vr, can induce some discomfort in the beginning but wears off.

review_title: Best VR game so far without any doubt!
one_reviews_text: This one is worth the money for sure.

review_title: The VR Game You Never Knew You Wanted
one_reviews_text:
Lone Echo is a wonderful game full of craftmanship, love and care.  It really exemplifies the strengths of the VR experience, and invites and inspires the player to lose themselves in a virtual reality.  It's an experience that must be felt to really understand and appreciate.

From the moment you first put on a VR headset there's a sense of awe and excitement for the future of this technology.  It's hard to not get lost in thoughts surrounding the possibilities for what VR can offer.  Whether it's educational, creative, or just plain fun, this emerging medium has just begun to scratch the surface of potential.

Lone Echo is an experience that will allow your senses to fully realize what VR at its best can really be for the user.  The story, for all its faults, it captivating and well-told.  The characters are interesting and have a depth and weight to them that most games lack.  The art and design are extraordinarily well-crafted.  The UI and gameplay feel incredibly natural and intuitive throughout most of the playthrough.  

To put it bluntly, this is the first game with a full-price price tag that I can wholeheartedly recommend to every game lover.  It's not the high-octane adrenaline-pumping experience that many gamers crave, but it's the best game of its generation that's currently available.  It would be a shame to miss out on playing it, and, in my opinion, it's worth showing Ready at Dawn the financial support just to show companies that there is a market for high-quality AAA budgeted VR experiences. 

It's just so good.

I was worried that my computer wouldn't handle the game ( i5 7400 @ 3.00GHz, GeForce GTX 1060 3GB, 8GB RAM), but it ran flawlessly.  Before buying the program I ran the free program Echo Arena which has the same requirements to make sure the computer could handle it.  Glad I did, it's a great game.  The only complaint is that it only lasts about 10 hours.  It would be more worth while if you could buy add on missions.

This is a must have title.  This is simply the best VR space game around.  The controls are great, the story and voice acting incredible and the pacing is excellent.  You do feel like you are there.  Get it and enjoy hours of pure escapism from the real world.

This is what VR was made for. You are like Tarzan, but in space - swinging from one object to the next. ;)
The story was a little short for my opinion, but that doesn't affect the rating at all.
For anyone who not believe in Vr this one will blast your mind. Best Game i ever played in VR. Great Job please more of this good stuff!

review_title: This should've been at Oculus launch
one_reviews_text:
If this game would have been ready at the launch of the Oculus Rift, sales of the headset would've been a lot better.
This game is the turning point of VR.

You play a robot, prepare to be amazed.

review_title: Best non wave shooter on platform!
one_reviews_text:
I'd been looking forward to it for a while, and I'm not disappointed (though a little motion sick).

Only quibbles:  I wish you could turn yourself with your hands.  I realise that (a) motion sickness and projectile vomiting are a real possibility, and (b) they'd have to deal with the opposing forces stabilising your position and actuating switches etc, but it would be soooo much more immersive.  I would keep a bucket handy for that experience.
