Secondly, something to possibly be patched out, when you aim *near* a spore with organic matter behind it and correct your aim to hit the spore, it won't register the hit on the spore.

This is real VR - I love it. Its very impressive!
...okay rework of my entry:
I've finished it and it was amazing...can't believe what I have seen. Impressive. I am a computer gamer now since about 18 years or more and this was FANTASTIC, best experience ever. I am curious to see what Oculus is able to do in the future - this was amazing. Thanks.
Great game, runs very, very well even on lower-end hardware. I played it on my old pc, FX-6300, R9 390, 16gb ram. Can't wait to try it again on my new pc, R5 1600, R9 390, 8gb ram.

review_title: So far the best VR game
one_reviews_text: Together with Robo Recall
Best VR experience what I had. Unfortunately 2 sensores are not enought :-(

review_title: solution for crashes.. game is excelent
one_reviews_text: dont fiddle around with your virtual memory (page file size)... let Windows handle it (on C-drive). that fixed my crashes. and 16GB Ram is a must. there were only 2 situations that caused crashes... 1. going outside (its loading the exterior and needs Ram big time fast) and the explosion (same thing with the Ram). Have to admit that the ending was a bit of a rush, hoping for a second part. and I was seriously missing a crosshair or even just a dot to know my center viewpoint (looking at objects and for the spacepack). Oh and you kind of need a 3rd sensor to get full 360 experience without switching your view all the times (that could have been handled smoother, rather then in 90 degree steps, kills the realism)....

Awesome = 5 stars
- 1 tar = no subtiltles! I am deaf. I understand 20% of the narrative.
- 1 star = heavy bug at "repair some robots" mission. I had to redo 1 houre gameplay because there are no manual savegame options!

Now THIS is a true AAA title! Keep making games like these and adoption will soar. We had enough of tech demos and shooting galleries. Loved it - can't wait more games like it. Buy it now - you won't regret it!
Looks fantastic. Fantastic in game movement. Enjoyed the story line. I played it all the way through and then went looking to see if there was a part 2. My favourite Rift game so far.

review_title: THE reason to get in to VR
one_reviews_text:
I can't sum up in words just how amazing this game is (though I shall try). The attention to detail is incredible, the whole feeling of the game from the movement, to the interactions with your hands are just perfect. 
Lone Echo really is the killer VR game we've all been waiting for. Roll on the sequel.

I just bought my Oculus rig a few months ago and after trying out several of the freebie games that came with it I loaded up Echo Arena .. not knowing much about it and not really into Multiplay, but I fancied trying it anyways.

Blown away by it would be my worst reaction, impressed as all-hell would be the best. I bought Lone Echo on the strength of the Arena game and was certainly not dissappointed by a game which gave me an unprecedented level of immersion and reality. Exploring the station, and the thing what turns up to ruin everyones day (no spoliers here :P) was amazing .. I felt like an actual explorer .. not just playing a game, and mashing the 'use' button on things. What impressed me the most was that I became totally emotionally invested in the character, and with Liv, and I was feeling every emotion possible when Liv was in danger.

Typically you want to survive in a game just to get to the end and complete the quest with the highest score .. but this game felt so much more personal than that. A BRILLIANT experience and worth every dollar I dropped for this bad boy and I'm so into a sequel.

Bravo!

This is the first VR game I played all the way through in two days, with Superhot VR and Robo Recall being close seconds. Not only does it feel like a complete experience rather than a tech demo, it's also one of the best examples of what I imagined VR might be so many years ago. The locomotion scheme is brilliant, and since it fits the genre/setting, it's the most natural non-cockpit style of movement I've tried without needing to move around in roomscale. Highly recommended!

From the very first time they let me pull my way through the tutorial, I was saying "Holy Shi*." This game looks absolutely unbelievable on a 1080 ti. If you're playing on a min spec card like I was before, upgrade now. Lone Echo gave me my first immersive "This looks like real life." moment. Downside is it made me sick pretty quickly. Probably because I was ripping my way around the ship and flying in every which direction way too quick.

Apart from a few tech demos and free games this was my first foray into actually buying a game! This game is quite beutiful and although not incredibly taxing on the mind. The storyline and strong visuals lift this to beyond most of the other SHOOTER fodder on offer. I actually had to take a deep intake of breath before I got the bottle up to take my first step off the space station and into space! I f developers can come up with interesting, stories, characters and visuals like LONE ECHO then this VR gaming concept can only get better and is a glimpse into the future! If you own an Oculus. You must own this title for it, and well done to the developer for an entry price of £30.00 A fair price for a great game.
get error code when i try and run the game ? any ideas why?

Mezmorising in experience and story. The final scene is just amazing and so many moments filled me with awe. I feel like there's a good leveling up in skills needed and parts are hard at the end. Only wish I had a third sensor as that broke the immersion sometimes.
I´ll just say this game was my best VR experience ever. I´m so sorry I finished the story already, I want more!!!

review_title: This is a VR Game Changer!
one_reviews_text:
Gravity meets Event Horizon meets SOMA. This is an incredibly immersive adventure that you'll keep as a valid, and real memory of your experience.

UPDATE: I've just completed the single-player mission. I stand by my initial review and wanted to add that this game evoke emotions in much the same way that SOMA, BioShock and very few other seminal games do!

This is not just a VR game changer, it is a video game changer!

review_title: Amazing with 3 sensors 2 not so much
one_reviews_text:
I'm only writing this review to warn people.
This game is amazing if you have 360 tracking. If you only have 2 sensors this game is playable but not fun.

For all its hype the single player campain is a fairly boring interactive story afair with trivial and repetative interactive puzzles "busy work".  I hear the multiplayer is good but ive not yet tried it.  Dont fall for the hype.

Wow, what a blast. When I first indulged in this impressive title, I thought it would be a simple space-mechanic-sim without much so far as story is concerned... Man was I wrong. This is hard sci-fi. When VR of this generation is done right, this is how it's to be done.

Just finished Lone Echo, and it's been the most magnificent experience I've ever had in a videogame. Jaw-droppingly beautiful, emotionally moving (not ashamed to admit I shed some tears), and the perfect balance of exploration, puzzle solving, and action.

There are some bugs, and the save-game mechanic seems arbitrary and maybe a bit broken, but those are the only things keeping this from being the perfect game. It's quite probably the best game I've ever played. Not just worth the price for the game- it's worth the price I paid for the Oculus itself. Would love to see a sequel. I want to spend more time as Jack!
Dance On The Belt of Saturn
By far the best Oculus game that I have played yet. Front to back the game has a good story and never gets boring.

This game really need a third sensor to be fully playable ... and a beeffy configuration ...
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
----------------------------
Ok ... I just finished it ... and Wow !!! ... What about Lone Echo 2 Now ???
And I won't spoil but *************************** is ***** and you finished in ************ ... no i won't spoil ... Great Story ... but we need more ... Do you copy Apollo ?

review_title: This is one of the best out there!
one_reviews_text:
If you're a lover of a good bit of Sci-Fi, you'll absolutely love this game/story (which I am and do). It totally takes you into it's world, it's story and sells it to you 'utterly'. 

It really is like playing the part in a great Arthur C. Clarke Sci-fi book. This is a must for the collection of any Sci-Fi lover, no questions. 

I can only hope they make a Lone Echo II, III and so on to continue in this amazing story we take part in (They'd have my money no question). 

Look, just get the game, it's beautiful and is a 5 out of 5 star game.
I can't even describe how good of a VR experience this game was! The story, the gameplay, the VR implementation, everything here deserves a five star rating! Looking forward to their next game!
This was my first really great VR game, and I was awed that it was so long, the awesome graphics it had and the great mechanics. This is a must have if you have the Rift.

Dont play this as your first VR game, everything else will be such a dissapointment afterwards. The best Multiplayer VR experience avaible today just added the best Singleplayer VR experience. Much thanks to the developpers for giving us such a polished product. Very immersive, very fun, so sad its already over. Shouldnt have bingeplayed this but the attraction was too strong to put it down.

review_title: An Experience Only VR Can Deliever!
one_reviews_text: From all of the glowing reviews I knew this was going to be a good game, but I had no idea how special Lone Echo could be.  This is the sort of game that only VR can do, a deeply immersive story in a gorgeous environment that makes use of the scale and majesty the technology allows.  The production values are crazy good, and I found myself caring deeply for Olivia.  I won't spoil anything, but at one point I became frantic trying to save her and had to calm myself down.  Afterward I realized I had a real and deep emotional experience that I've not felt in a video game ever.  My only complaint is that I want more.  Please buy this and ask for Lone Echo 2

The innovative locomotion mechanic in this game is comfortable and intuitive, and the hand->environment interaction and IK system are marvels.  This game is definitely one of a select few VR experiences of the past few years that feels like an inflection point for developers.  Every game that comes after this will learn lessons from it.

review_title: This is what VR is for
one_reviews_text: This type of exploration story game is what VR is for.
Everyone loves this game. It seems to be a glorified space mechanic simulator. If you're into stuff like car mechanic simulators and trucking simulators maybe this game is for you.
Nice game, good story and interactions. Very buggy which is disappointing. Crashed about 8 times in the past 2 hours. Would give 4 or 5 stars if it hadnt crashed so much.

This is absolute genuis - it works on every level and feels really engaging and real and intuitive.  The first time the windows opened and I saw outside, my jaw hit the floor.  Then it happened again when I went through the airlock.  Amazing and awesome.
Immersive, fascinating - where VR should be going. Bravo

I can only agree to the many: This is a MUST HAVE game title! If you have spend money on the VR gear already, you need to spend the money for Lone Echo to make the perfect use of it! It utilises the VR environment in really great original ways, has a very good storyline and a totally great and dense atmosphere!
If you are worried about getting sick of the motions, just download the free echo arena and try the tutorials first. This will give you a good idea about what is going on in Lone Echo. Just don't give up if the first try seems uncomfortable. You'll get used to the motions very soon.

This is definitely one of the best games in the Oculus store. Hands down.
The only downside is that the puzzles were a bit too easy for an adventure junkie like myself so the game didn't last too long.. 
It can still fill up a whole weekend though as long as you don't skip stuff and rush through it.

review_title: The best VR game I experienced
one_reviews_text:
And the only game I wanted to review as soon as I finished it. If you're reading this, just be aware that the only bad thing to say about this game is the lack of subtitles. It's in english, but still very easy to understand.

The thrill to be in a space station, fixing stuff and discovering places in the middle of space, in gravity zero. Great story, and memorable moments.
I hate horror/scary things, I thought it was that kind of game.  Hopefully it's not one of those. Wonderful and interesting from the beginning to the end.


(Oh, and you don't need to be on a full scale empty room to enjoy it. I actually did all the game sitting away from my desk)

This game is kind of like a cross between a RPG, walking (floating) simulator, and puzzle game all in one.  It has an amazing story, great dialogue, interesting puzzles, and a beautiful setting.  The game is pretty linear, but that's not a bad thing.  Portal 2 was very linear, but it was an amazing experience.  I feel that this game is a must play for any oculus owner.  AAA quality and polish.  I was concerned about the price at first.  I have trouble paying that much money for a game that may be another "concept" or "experience" type game with very little substance underneith. But after taking the risk of buying and now that I've played 80% of the game, I feel that $39.99 is a very appropriate price.  Well worth it.
Amazing VR experience that exploited the fullest potential of the touch controllers. Love the visual and physics too.

review_title: I thought all the 5 star reviews were BS
one_reviews_text:
Then I played the game and WOW.
It earned every single one of those reviews.
Amazing game. Highly recommend to anyone with a rift.

Great game and experience.

I truly lost myself in Lone Echo both in the story and enviroment. Once you get used to the controlles (should not take long) you will have total controll of your manipulation of the yourself and the enviroment. Charming and exciting story and because this is more of an experience the short game length wont realy matter, you will want to revisit multiple times.
A true and complete VR experience. A must have!

Just finished the game and it was amazing! The game actually has a story that makes you care about the characters. It's interactive, exciting, and fun. The visuals are amazing too. This was the first time I've played a VR game where it felt like a real experiance rather than just an arcady action game. Everyone who own's VR should own this game.

So this is one of the best VR titles so far. From the immersion and the way its done to the visuals to the game play. Its all extremely well done. The only hit against the game is the price. I think this should be priced around $30 instead. Otherwise this is an exceptional game and gave me many hours of fun.

This game is simply amazing. It's revolutionary. Lone Echo is going to do for the oculus what Super Mario 64 did for the nintendo 64. I felt totally immersed in the game from the very beginning. I almost cried when it ended. If you haven't picked this game up yet, you owe it to yourself to check it out, you will not regret it. In my honest opinion Lone Echo puts every other oculus title to shame on so many levels. I really hope this game gets a sequel. The only bad thing that I can say about this game is that the ending leaves you with more questions than answers, it felt unfinished. Other than that you have to play Lone Echo, it's an incredible experience that you won't soon forget. This has gone down as one of my favorite games of all time.

THERE IS NO SUBTITLES !!!
Come on, can't you even put them in english for people like me that can understand written english more easier than spoken one ?Is that so difficult Oculus ?
Bad move in this case , that is why there is only 4 stars...and one star less because of the airlock crash that prevents to move further in the adventure :(
I tried two times and two times the game crashed at the same point, and the patch had done nothing, sorry, i finally get rid of it and so put another star :)

review_title: Good game, but the final chapter ...
one_reviews_text: One of my best VR games, till your traveling trough narrow spaces where floating stuff and walls will kills you (after dealing with the ai). This breaks the whole pacing and buildup for the start: its trial and error instead of balanced gameplay.

review_title: Best VR game so far. Gimme sequel. :)
one_reviews_text:
Immersive, emotive and summarially impressive. 

Not enough content for my liking I completed the game in around 8h of play, but understandable with the amount of effort that has been put into smooth gameplay, detailed and interactive environments, good humour and excellent voice acting. 

Could have been a bit more challenging IMNSHO but nevertheless I am eagerly awaiting a sequel. 

@devs: Please don't make me wait too long... :)
to developer make a second one pls
Story good, touch and VR implementation awesome.  Went through it like wildfire
i decided to be patient and wait 30 minutes for them to sort out the preorder problem and wow amazing they figured it out and i still paid $34.99 for the game and everyone survived

review_title: What I imagined VR would be like
one_reviews_text: Perfect example of how great VR games have to be  designed for VR from the ground up.  If this game wasn't VR, it would be boring.  But because its VR interactions are so well done, every little activity is a joy to complete.  The story is pretty decent and the 6 or so hour length was enough to leave me satisfied with the experience.

Good game. With subtitles, great. With spanish voices amazing!. 
Almost the menus and objetives panel.

review_title: One of the best VR games
one_reviews_text: This was a very well polished expirience, definetly utilized the VR very well.

review_title: Hands down the most complete experience.
one_reviews_text: This game is what VR needed!! Graphics, Voice Acting, Atmosphere, Controls, this game is where you should be putting your money. Beware: I would advise you have at least the recommended specs to fully enjoy the game. I had issues getting it to run before my recent CPU and Memory upgrade.
One of the most polished and visually stunning VR experiences I've ever had. They absolutely need to make a sequel! Great job!

review_title: The best VR experience so far
one_reviews_text: This game represents exactly what I thought I would experience when I purchased Oculus Rift. The graphics, storyline, and depth of interaction make this the best game I have played in VR so far. Game developers should use this as a baseline for future projects. Ready at Dawn and Oculus teams, congratulations on a terrific product!

Devs, you have outdone yourselves. This piece of art gives us a glimpse of the enormeous potential that VR has. The mode of locomotion feels very intuitive and works perfectly. As for the rest: Story, graphics, audio and questdesign are just top notch and should serve as an example for future games to come. Thank you for this!
Lone echo is a considerately designed game that provides the best VR experience.

I am very new to VR. This is the first game I have purchased. I feel now that I am going to be forever spoiled as each game afterwards has been sub-par by comparison. If you want the best VR experience buy this game. Then review it so we can get more AAA titles like these. There are so many details and everything is very polished. 

This is the first VR masterpiece and this game has firmly cemented VR as the platform of the future.

So im not completely done with the Story yet but so far its been absolutely amazing. Great visuals, nice Story and features that work very good, like the flashlight for example. Ive gotten dizzy a few times when losing control of my direction etc. but it could be much worse.
In conclusion, i can only recommend this game to everyone and i will definately show it to people that want to try VR.

This game spoiled me, visually great, locomotion great, story great, immersion great, gameplay length great.  I really milked this game because I enjoyed it so much and didn't want the adventure and discovery to end.  Found myself anxious , worried, curious.  This game is top notch and so far has no rival, this is the new bar, time for other developers to step up their game.

This is easily the best VR game I have played so far.  Very immersive, enjoyable story, and it doesn't leave you feeling like you played an expensive demo.   The bar has been raised... here is hoping other game devs see the value in creating a full game like this.
Sutch a nice game!
Playing this game was very fun all the way through.  The story feels like it ends on a bit of a cliffhanger, please continue it.

I always get the error message:...,you must have purchased this application via the oculus store.....

can somebody tell me how to fix that?

Graphics : 5/5
Story : 4/5
Immersion : 5/5
Sound : 5/5
BEST VR GAME FOR BEGINNERS OR EXPERT !!!!
Just as others have said: Gorgeous graphics, great story, some serious immersion, and all around 5 star quality game. A "must own" for the Rift if there ever was one.

review_title: This is what you've been waiting for
one_reviews_text:
This is what I imagined VR to be. Brilliant graphics, vast environments with atmospheric and exciting game play. 
The controls might take a little while to get to grips with, but once you have it down you'll be thrusting and launching yourself about like space-pro.  The Zero-G environment and physics are so well done that you'll honestly believe that this is what space feels like. More than once I felt my stomach go when I saw the vastness of space beneath my feet and and really paniced when I launched the Fury transporter and wasn't holding on! It's brilliant - buy it :)
Best VR game. Playing seated with two sensors, a delight of game. Great graphics, intriguing history and nice gameplay.
since last update program will not start and this greatly decreases the rating would give the game

review_title: Virtual storytelling with a real feel
one_reviews_text: I have played a lot of VR games that held a promise of storytelling and "real" Immersion, but this one is the only longform VR experience that has delivered this for me. This is how VR storytelling should be done and I hope it inspires others to strive to reach this high mark.

This is the reason I purchased a VR headset...the visuals are amazing, the story and interactivity are great.  Unlike other free roaming games, you have the option to touch/move everything, which seems like a small thing, but can take away from the experience.  The 5 star rating on this is well deserved, you won't be disappointed.  Hopefully other developers take note and build more like this!

review_title: One of the first true "VR" games
one_reviews_text: Finally starting to get some good stuff. The gameplay in Lone Echo, the pacing, the ambiance, everything works great in VR. My only true complaint is that the Options did not save. So every single time I started the game I had to open the Options panel and re-enable all movement and turning options, as well as click 35 times on the "turning speed" option to get it from 5.0 default, to the 8.5 I felt comfortable with.

I've been an Oculus owner for 5 months at this point, and played a lot of different games and this by far is the most immersive that I have come across.  The feel and the movement through the game may be linear but it lets you make your own movements and choices to get there.  Hours on end wearing my gear trying to get through.  You feel as if you are there not just in some shooting gallery but in an enviroment that you actually need to work with, touch and push off of as well as push away from you.

Im not usually one for prolonged sesions in vr but this one kinda kept me in there, awsome gfx and the virtual body very well done exspecially the arms, ran pretty smoothly for me a couple of stutters when going outside but cleared up once out love the way you can pretty much grab any thing to steady yourself, awsome game.

review_title: Omg how can u not get sick in this game
one_reviews_text:
ok so I get vr sickness and bad. Sorry but the game looks great the sound and voice acting is good and the story is good but how can I know. I can't even pass an hour with out saying O god no no no please stop please stop and it just kills the game for me. I gave this game a 4 because it looks great and looks like devs care about it but story i can't tell you that and i don't wan't hurt a game for my weakness. I play this game for an hour and have sit for two hours with me feel like sh*t. People say it goes away with time I had a vr for year it does not. It a major issue and this totaly not way to go. I will never show this game to a friend who want to hurt their friends like this try out the system for the first time because it wrong so wrong. I don't want them to get sick and just hurts vr. I just want the devs to read and know next time please don't do this if they make another game or title and look at this see this not the answer to vr. To the devs please no more pain to the gamers. Why would you want hurt me I don't hate you guys I don't want hurt you. I just don't understand its system breaker and will destory vr. I want vr to grow and get good but how can it when it hurts the gamers just to play it. I just want to relax and have fun and that what games are made for and this just hurts. This is warning to other players like me you will get sick and if brave enough take it head on I wish you luck but I telling you. It not right paying money that makes you feel like this it hurts and vr. When devs must of known it will have effects on us how can they not know. its sad probbly a great game but I bet I never be able finish it and might have to watch a lets play. When I have the game in my computer and I paid money for it just not right man. 
p.s Yes I wrote this feeling vr sickness and I still do and yes maybe little hate but dam its the truth and that the best thing for you devs to see it a system breaker please keep in mind for next game thank you
I hope there will be more games like this. Perfect game! tnx to devs!

Closest to AAA we have seen yet. Amazing movement system. Interesting narrative. Awesome interactions. The menu's and systems are very well done. The environments are fantastic. Some complain that the gameplay itself is shallow and very basic. You could argue that but the atmosphere and narrative create such a great sense of immersion that the game is fun, interesting, and worth every penny.

THIS GAME IS  PREMIUM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This is the first VR Game that's impressed me enough to write a review. Echo One is the greatest game that I've ever played. The less you know going into it the better, honestly. I was put off by the price tag at first despite the outstanding reviews, but this game is worth every penny. There's also a Rick and Morty reference in the game, if you can find it :)

Great game,
My computer meets minimum requirements for VR, Game ran just fine, no issues.

review_title: Great - Can I please have more?
one_reviews_text: I loved this game and its totally worth the price but I want more in this world/setting.  Can we have an infinite mode where you manage the mining station and random problems that occur?  I just want to spend time optimizing a mining facility in space and this is 60% of the way there.
Wowww... The future is here. I'm 63 years old - and I finaly got to get into space... This game is SO real :-)

Probably the Best VR game to date! Loved the story and everything about this game! Was about 4-5 hours of gameplay but it was worth every DIME! Can you guys make a game where its multiplayer so you can travel in space with your friends and do missions? :)

I was expecting a nice game.
Boy was I wrong !
This game is as amazing as it's breathtaking with crazy visual that takes VR to the next step.

It's probably the best game you can get so far, along with Robo Recall.
Lone Echo is the Half Life of VR. Think back at how Half Life 1 was a huge pinnacle for PC gaming. Lone Echo is exactly that for VR gaming.

This game is super detailed, it makes a good effort at tackling the problems of vr, the interface and menus are super well developed. the movement and prupolsion methods are well balanced and there are few game breaking glitches. I was excited to try one of the latest vr games to see where this industry is going. the close to far graphic changes are VERY visible even in higher graphics modes so i give this a 8/10 graphically, some very exceptional up close detail and good overall effects. The story is fantastic, if you are a fan of star trek or other sci fi genre stories you will love this game. 9/10 for story. There is only one factor that is overall the reason i wont recommend this game to my buddies unless they are looking for a good detailed view in VR. Compared to PS3 games from more than 5 years ago that have great graphics and plots, this game fails to deliver more then a few evenings of challenge, the story is only about half a day long and I completed most of the find everything sequences I ran into. Big disappointment there. overall 4/5 Try again VR developer, your weak presentations are worth less than Dead Effect 2, a ported cell phone game
This ist the best VR Game i have played so far. Amazing graphics, cool Story an best VR immersion, because you don't have to teleport around. Please more of that!

review_title: Looks great but can't play due to bugs
one_reviews_text: Was so excited for this after enjoying Echo Arena. Unfortunately I'm unable to progress in the game due to it crashing every time I use the airlock.

This is what VR can do. The immersion is incredible. Everything feels so real. An absolute must have. I keep returning to this game just to continue the awesome story, to enjoy the visuals an realism and to float around in zero gravity.

This game sets a completely new level for VR in general. It leaves you speechless over and over. Absolute masterpiece!

If you encounter the "airlock bug" (game crashing when you try to leave the station): You have to enable a higher paging file for your drive regarding RAM. Search for that on a search engine - there are several solutions.

First thought was: Wow that was really - really good! I hope there is a sequel.
I had a DK2 for a couple years and had the CV1 since it was released. Over that time, from the tech demos on Oculus Share to the great free launch content, this game was what I had always been waiting for in VR.
VR multiplayer is fantastic and I've had some great fun there with others, mainly Dead and Buried + Holograms Against Humanity on Altspace, Echo Arena and more. But more often than not I do prefer to play a good fleshed out story driven game, alone and not have to talk to others. There hasn't been too much of this as yet until Lone Echo, and I couldn't recommend it highly enough.
I thought the twists and the story was great. I have most of the software that is out there for VR and it hasn't been since Edge of Nowhere, that I was so keen to get up in the morning and go straight back into VR to continue. I took my time with Lone Echo and I think I did maybe 5 or 6 - 2 hour sittings each day. Loved the impressive hands, interactions and the environments where amazing. I would find myself standing on the ship looking out the window at Saturn, and thinking 'Wow, so this is what it's like to be on a ship like this'. It felt so real and believable.
All this brought it to a whole new level of immersion. I'd also like to note the price point of £29.99 I felt was spot on, and very good value.
Only thing negative I found, was sometimes I would get a new task and I would find it quite difficult to fully understand where I should be going next. I did find myself spending longer than I would have liked activating - deactivating way points in the hope I could figure where to go. Most of the time this wasn't an issue though.
I was really glad I stuck with it though, brilliant game and it was surreal in a way feeling like you're getting to know a character (Liv Rhodes) in VR, even though they don't actually exist.
Well done to everyone involved!
A continuation is needed !  but with  the choice of language as French

This & Echo Arena? Where to begin? I was always a PC kid. William Gibson & Rudy Rucker inspired me to get into PCs in the 80s. I remember that trip to Epcot Center my parents took me to in the early 90s, there was an early VR experience then, & I spent mid 90s summers saving up for PC hardware to mimic the VR or 3D experience. The films that depicted it weren't great, but I ate them up. Johnny Mnemonic, Lawnmower Man, that weird Denzel & Crowe film... I never thought the experiences depicted in those works would be captured in my lifetime. While there are some great VR experiences here that aren't horde mode shooters (check out Mage's Tale fantasy RPG fans) this is it... this does it. Killer App, dream come true. 
That said, as per this universe, I want to see & explore more of it. Lone Echo establishes the Echo Arena sport, and my gut tells mere there is more to tell. Much more. 
What are you doing reading this? Buy and play both! Now.
I don't think this game needs any other reviews, it is just stunning, polished and totally immersive. Multiplayer part super fun too (and free)
The physics, story and pacing are all right. I loved this game.
Excellent VR experiance - cannot recommend enough. Single Player brilliance.

review_title: This is what VR was made for!
one_reviews_text: Outstanding story, fantastic and organic gameplay with excellent graphics. This game transports you into space as effortlessly as zero gravity itself. I could not reccommend it enough! An absolute must have for the Oculous! Please make more, I want part 2, the lenght of game play was acceptable as well!
The creators of this game actually need a palm in the back! We need more like this! Please give us more!

Game hung up in the opening scenes with the anomoly outside the window. Kept being asked to look outside to check it out and the game woud not progress further than this. This is a very discouraging game flaw that has given me zero confidence to try to "trip" the game play into progressing forward because I do not want to be guessing at what the gamers designed inside of an immersive experience. Totally took me out of the experience in the first 10 minutes.

Previously, my favorite games were (in order): The Climb, Elite: Dangerous, and Dirt Rally.

But Lone Echo unseats all of them. I am astounded at how well the locomotion works. While ADRIFT (which is similar) made me violently nauseous despite having a VR stomach made of heavy gauge stainless steel, Lone Echo is absolutely and perfectly comfortable.

So unless Alien: Isolation finally gets that oft-demanded VR re-release, this is the game you want to buy to feel like you're living in a Sci-Fi movie.

This is exactly what I wanted from VR! Perfect immersion, narrative, graphics... Only played a few hours but this game alone is worth the price of VR admission... Combined with Echo Arena that is the Rocket League of VR (think Ender's game) Ready at Dawn really changed VR for the better
free 360° movement that wont make you sick. thrilling story and one of the best graphics to date! thank you for that wonderful experience! READY AT DAWN PLS MAKE MORE VR GAMES

Just finished it and completely stunned!
I think, this is one of the best games i ever played. Story, atmosphere, gameplay, sounds, visuals are an incedibly well rounded package.
I really hope, there will be a Lone Echo 2
2 weeks of playing everytime a litle very nice! Like Half-Life for PC back in time. Pleasing, i will reamaber this game for lifetime because it was my first VR.
Perfect game to showcase what can really be done with VR.  I'm not finished with it yet but have already put in a lot of hours...

I found Wilson's Heart a big leap in the quality of VR games, but this game improves the quality even further. The visuals are stunning and I found the movement system very natural after you get used to it. Great story and really a must buy!

review_title: Space the fi... no, this isn't Star Trek
one_reviews_text: The single player campaign is a fantastic adventure on Saturn's orbit. Stunning graphics, awesome animations, great voice acting and sound design all work together in absolutely amazing way. The movement system is essentially the perfect 0 G movement system which is familiar to many from Echo Arena Beta. Having played through the whole campaign in one go, it took me longer than I expected because I spent a lot of time exploring areas and reading unnecessary scan information. If you like scifi and adventures without shooting guns, there is a good chance that this will blow your mind. An instant classic and I just have one question now. When is the sequel coming?

This is only an inital impression but from what I've seen so far it's very well made with well written character's and an intriguing story line. I don't often buy games this early but as Echo Arena was so good & was going to be free I felt the devs should be supported and had already earned this sale. I know a few people had problems downloading initialy but by 7pm (UK Time(GMT)) the download worked fine but it would have been nice to have a preload. Equally, Oculus might want to consider giving a release time & date rather than just a release date. I'm not complaining exactly but 19 hours had passed by of the 20th by the time I could download it and was starting to wonder if I would have to wait until midnight to play the game but this is a mere grumble. Anyways...... Kudos to "Ready at Dawn" & "Oculus Studio", you've made a grumpy old man very happy.

review_title: Great game, great graphics, good story
one_reviews_text: 'Nuf said

top-notch game. I played roughly 7-8 hours started standing but switched to sitting which really helped selling the weightlessness in space to me. The Game works great with the 2-Sensor 360° Experimental Setup if u have only 2 sensors i would recommend using that. The 1 star is missing because the last third of  Lone Echo feels a little bit repetitive too many batteries are needed ;)
Wow

So far this game is amazing (about 3 hours in now) and really sets the bar for VR gaming.
Movement works well and turning with thumbstick really helps if you don't have 360degree tracking.
I. Love. This. Game. This was (and still is) my favourite VR game ever! The graphics, missions, characters and the voice-acting were PERFECT! I hope to see maybe part 2 or DLC...

Without subtitles, deaf people cannot enjoy full the game, because here are many audible feedback and dialogues, like Core containment because many codes are given by dialog with Liv. The graphics and the VR immersion are impressive. But without subtitles I can't give full stars.
I hope in a future update...

review_title: Probably one of the best VR games
one_reviews_text: I bought it thinking it would be a simple puzzle game, but then I loaded it and I managed to get over 5 hours of great story driven gameplay, Totally playable with two sensors doing 360 tracking. Is a must buy for people who love sci-fi sort of games. Plus it has some amazing graphics and story.

The game itself is not like any orther, designed to show the potential of what a vr title can be. It is an entirely new experience to play.  Not as much fast action such as in a typical shooter but the game is immersive enough to keep the feeling of urgency alive throughout the story.  
Great Job.  I can't wait for future titles.

Lone Echo is probably one of the few games out for VR now that feels like a full AAA game. There's many positive things I could say about the game from the great graphics,  audio, voice acting, script, mechanics that are only possible in VR. 

To run at the highest settings you will need a very high end PC, however lowering the settings and resolution in the game still provides an excellent experience and much smoother frame rate. 

The game took me around 7-8 hours to finish in total. And now I will go on and enjoy Echo Arena! 

The developers deserve a lot of praise for their efforts in pushing VR forward. It's great that we're now starting to see great titles like Lone Echo. 5/5
another brilliant  flagship  VR game from oculus. just like  robo recall, there is alot of resources put in this game to show you how it can be done right with what VR2017 has to offer.

THIS.
IS.
VR.
This is what I've waited for sooo long. And finally I got this magical piece of software. Thank you Ready At Dawn! It was the first game I ever pre-ordered and it's STUNNING. I've seen nice and captivating games/experiences over the last year I've spent with VR but THIS...

review_title: The Mascot for Oculus and VR in general.
one_reviews_text: This is the masterpiece magnum opus of the beggining days of VR. Like Metal Gear did for gaming or Halo did for shooters, this game is setting the bar for top notch VR quality all the way around. It does take a powerhouse to run though, i have i7 4400, gtx 1060 6gb and 8gb of ram, and i have to play it on low, but it still looks pretty good!

Honestly this blew my mind. Robo recall for me having been the most imersive game yet, doesnt hold a candle to this game. Its tricky, its engrosing, its spooky and scary and awe inspiring. Try it. I didnt get any sickness at all thanks to my brain being fooled by my arms pulling me along or my jetting like some space born superhero. The story also has to get a five star from me. I Dont know if you can fail some of the more tense moments but they had me dashing around like a fool to do my best. Deffinetly worth a play.
Excellent story, method of propolsion/movement solved, creates a vastness eventhough you are actually in a small area. Incredible game!
Level One Start

review_title: Plays like a AAA blockbuster movie
one_reviews_text:
The level of thought that has gone into just developing the script reminds me of a blockbuster movie, it makes you feel like you are in the game much better than any other game I have played.
It just flows so well, each part of the game is so well connected, the graphics and depth are perfect, I have everything highest with SS 2.0 on a 1080ti at 90+fps.
This game is awesome thank you for such a unique experience
This game is top notch. I cant imagine anything more immersive. Anyone who owns a VR rig must buy this game!

Stop searching for the perfect VR game, this is it.
Beatiful graphics, perfect locomotion and physical presence. Everything is so brilliantly implemented and the whole experience feels so natural...
Best VR game I've bought so far, along with Raw Data.
This is the best VR game ever made and one of the best games I've ever played, period.

review_title: Cant Install Game for some reason..
one_reviews_text: I bought this game on release day and have tried installing it a number of times. It cycles through the download and then the install and then as soon as it hits 100% it just says not installed.. I have tried everything i can think of but cannot get the game to install. Very frustrated.

I have to give this game 1 star only, since never been able to connect to multiplayer owning the game since launch day, i have arena, i just get a white screen with the loading message, i have waited up 20 minutes on that screen and it never loads into multiplayer, the single player is nice to look at but i became bored with it after a couple of hours, i tried to get a refund becuase of the technical problem with never getting into multiplayer but they just said refund declined, lesson learned, wont be buying any more games from the oculus store. The game although pretty to look at is actually gameplay boring, just going around as a mechanic fixing panels and stuff at the beck and call of of your master, for me the novelty wore off really fast, totally overhyped game.

Well, this is the perfect example that a new revolutionary Gaming enviroment like the VR technolgly really requires game designers that think outside of the usual boundaries and the same old principles of 3D/Ego-Action. This game makes VR and your inner self fly. I'm a gamer since 20+ years, and this title feels in combination with the Rift like a fresh  reboot after all those years.

I can't say that I've ever been to space but whatever it may feel like, this probably comes close. Besides that you get a beautiful & nice story telling.

Kudos guys! Finally a worthy VR title that blows away everyone.
hell yeah!

review_title: One of the best VR games
one_reviews_text:
...and easily one of the best games of 2017.

Lone Echo combines smart gameplay that can only be done in VR with amazing visuals and an interesting story. Lone Echo is a game I'll remember for decades to come.

review_title: Genial pero no perfecto. Una pena.
one_reviews_text:
Controls need more love. 

Not inverted pitch and gradual speed rotation. Pls devs fix it.

This, for me, breaks the inmersion.

Subtitles? They are a must have. 

More languages? AAA VR only english language? Are you kidding me?

The rest is beautiful :3 near to perfection.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
En español y completo https://anoth3rw0rld.com/2017/07/30/lone-echo/

The best game.
I am sorry to have to enjoy these games in English only.
Please try to localize when you release to Korea.
Please also support Korean voice and text in US version.
Please try to enjoy Korean and Korean voice.

review_title: Amazing game, but game breaking bugs
one_reviews_text: An absolutely awesome game with polish off the scale.  The way you interact with the environment and others is the best I've ever seen in VR.  BUT - their are CTD bugs that mean I cannot progress past a certain point (the bit where you go for an EVA through the airlock).  The recent patch which states to fix this bug doesn't do the job.  So, on one hand incredible game, on the other hand I can't play much of it, so it is more of a very very expensive demo at the moment - hence the score.

review_title: best VR game but no sub?
one_reviews_text:
The game is really cool, but there are no eng sub and Olivia speak only in english...it's hard to understand all dialogues for me.
Please add eng sub and this is a 5/5 stars.
Try the tutorial of echo arena...you'll have as much fun. Would be nice to be refunded.

Haven't gotten through the game yet (I'm guessing I'm halfway through, but idk), but it's an excellent game so far. It's almost all exploration and story, but it's crafted extremely well. Avoiding environmental hazards is a blast, the environment is toned well to be unnerving (or comfortable) as the game needs, but not so much that those who hate horror games would feel the need to stop. The puzzles in the game are excellently designed, usually being completely puzzling until you figure it out, then being obvious (I can't talk much about why they're so clever without spoilers).

My only complaint is that the game defaulted to high quality, and while it ran fine at that quality for the majority of the time, I had to knock it down to low to prevent the game from crashing in certain places. The devs though assure me that these issues are their top priority.

All in all, an amazing game, quite possibly unique across what I'm seen in VR so far. It's story based with free locomotion, has active sequences that make you feel like an action hero without any combat, has unparalleled freedom of movement and exploration, and well designed puzzles. All in all, currently my favorite singleplayer VR game.

I had to wait a long time after it came out, and I was worried that was an omen for things to come. But surprisingly the game was actually pretty amazing. However I would suggest getting a beefy PC because, I thought my pc could run everything but the frames in this would drop hardcore and that really sucks in vr. Other than that, the story was awesome, and the movement was amazing, the gameplay was pretty good and yeah, all around a really good VR game. I do have a few cons though, this game feels really short, and not because it is, the game is probably about 7 hours, but the way it ends makes the game feel like a sneeze that never happened. And the other thing is that I crashed multiple times for no real reason. But still, this is a must have for VR players!

Fantastic start to finish.   

If you have the stomach for it, turn off all the comfort options to allow full zero-g control, highly immersive, became disorientated first time I backflipped and nearly fell over, but it passed and was well worth it!

This game is the best VR experience you can have right now and in a few years after more games have been released and developers finally learn how to get the most out of VR, this game will still be one of the best VR experiences you can have.

Best "0G" game ever - definitely worth full price! I wish every space game had this movement system with procedural touch...
I spend around 15 h to finish this game (it was so good to move in 0G...) , it looks beautiful, character interaction is superb!
And the story is engaging with very nice end... 
They should definitly expande this Echo Universe! 
Im looking forward to buy continuation!

TLDR: MUST HAVE!!!
It has story, it has emotion, it has physical presence unlike any other games so far. Rather than having memories of playing the game, I have memories of BEING on that space station. Super impressed.

It's by far the best VR game I've played yet. One thing though, since the update I can't press the Objective Button anymore, so I can't make it tell me where to go. It recognizes that I touch it (it blinks) but it doesn't turn active.
Hope this will get fixed, since I'm at the end of the game and it destroys my immersion.

review_title: Amazing Story, a sequel is needed
one_reviews_text: The story and amount of immersion that game presents is astounding. This is by far my favorite VR experience. I really hope they continue the story.

This game could be good enough even without VR. But with VR it's just amazing, very immersive.
Game was crush couple times, but real problem is only one: it is too short, i want more!
Amazing fully immersive zero gravity space drama. I am about 5 hours in and cannot wait to experience the end. Thank you Oculus for funding this game and getting it out to the VR enthusiasts.
I haven't had VR for long, but this was a complete, polished, beautiful game that showed me what VR can really do and be. I love everything about it.

review_title: We need more stuff like this
one_reviews_text:
10/10 on quality and gameplay. 
We need more games like this on VR.
I missed more action but the game is awesome.

I can not rave enough about this game. The locomotion is simple, intuitive and adds to the immersion. The storyline is gripping and the sense of presence is out of this world. You are not playing a game as much as living a story... in space... as a robot. A must have for VR!

review_title: One of the best Oculus games thus far
one_reviews_text: I was impressed with this game. It has fine voice talent, good VR graphics and holds interest over many sessions, which is more than I can say for a lot of Oculus games. The challenges are not, for the most part, that difficult, and the game occasionally stranded being a little unsure what to do, but I found this a recommendable Oculus experience.
I have no doubt this is the new benchmark for VR games. Controls great, looks fantastic, and most importantly very, very immersive. VR devs take note!

Well worth owning, in my opinion.  My only criticism would be that I found myself wanting a little more agency as the player.  More freedom in methods of resolving problems, possibly branching of the narrative.  Those things are all expensive to add though, in terms of code/scripting/art assets/etc, so I understand it.  Regardless, well worth the ride, and I hope to enjoy another story from this team in the future.

wow just wow, the ending was the only low point. 

i dont like cliffhangers especially if the story is this good.
Awesome 5 star - 1 star (no subtitles ita)

No dub, no subtitles... :(

Quite disappointed just from the begining

A stunningly beautiful world with a highly engaging story.  The best locomotion system to date.  So many little details spread throughout the game.  Not just my favorite VR game so far this year.  My favorite game Period!  I found the length to be perfect.  Take your time and look around and you can expect a game time over 7 hours.  Don't hesitate, pick it up if you haven't already!  I didn't even mention the multiplayer!
The most engrossing VR experience I've ever had!
The sense of scale and immersion is epic.  This title shows that VR can completely blow you away when it's done right, even with the limitations of the current hardware.

review_title: We are getting spoiled these days.
one_reviews_text: I am so happy I'm not born in the year 1700.

My English is not the best but i understood much of the game. It would be better if there where subtitles or the choice to switch language. But the Game itself is great and worth the money. Loved the athmospere, felt in love with Liv, what a great virtual Character, she was so real!

This is simply the best VR expierence out there. They have set a new standard for VR games. The graphics look stunning and the gameplay is amazing. Seriously if your going to buy anything on the store, this should be your first purchase.

Explore and progress this amazing VR experience at your own pace (please can we have more quality titles like this, a much needed alternative to the 'time bound' shoot-em up style games!!!). 

Would be great to get additional locations.

I wasn't expecting too much because a lot of VR titles are very short or  quality too bad. This is completly different. Movement and touch controllers are perfect, sory is quite good and graphics more then up to time. This is how to do AAA Titles for VR ! We don't need another shooter, this is exploring, handling and just enjoying nice views.
For the next Episode a little more difficult puzzles would be great, beside that it is a perfect game !

Probably one of the most well designed games currently available. The playable character is completely represented (so, no more disembodied hands, you now have full arms and even the body that goes with them). The zero-g movement system is very well thought out. The sci-fi element is fairly generic, but the settings are beautiful, the vistas are spectacular and although the game isn't very long, you can take your time to explore. Apart from a few sequences, you aren't really in a rush. So enjoy the ride, it's certainly worth it.
great story ,great game...

If you are a fan of space, exploration, sci-fi, or any combination of the three, you owe it to yourself to play this game. It's intense, gripping, beautiful, emotionally captivating... and this is all in a game where you play as a lowly non-combat prospector A.I. droid. Far and away my favorite VR solo game.
Dont read this. Go. Play. Now!

review_title: Just finished the game. Great sci-fi
one_reviews_text: It's pretty simple. If you own a Rift, this game is a must have. Not only do you get a great single player sci-fi adventure with interesting narrative, characters and environments to explore, but you also get Echo Arena wich is the best multiplayer experience in years. Support this team. They have crafted a real treat for the VR world. Played from start to finish without any major bugs/crashes. Maybe a couple glitchy seconds when game was loading new big areas. Also played it all with front facing 2 sensor setup, and while sitting i must add, so if you're lazy turn around with the analog stick and play seated ;)

Unbelievable experince ! 
You not only end up on amazing looking space station and outside enviroment but you also face incredible events that happening around you. 
Mistery and great dialogs keeps you terrified and also interested in every single aspect of this incredible story. 
Developers of this game have perfect understanding what is VR camable of and using his benefits to absolute limits.
VR comfort - need time but after a few hours back and forh i had no problem with any discomfort. 
I didn't finish this game yet but I already hope for more titles like this !

Simply the best single-player game in VR to date, and honestly one of the best gaming experiences I've ever had on any platform. Everything is top-notch, from graphics/environments, character/voice-acting, VR interaction, you name it.
Hell of an experience, Looks amazing, feels great throwing yourself around in zero gravity. Makes me wish there were more games like this on VR

This is Kubrick, Scott, Cronenberg, Nolan, Cameron, Spielberg, in VR.
If you like one of these, put immediately the headset on and immerse yourself in a deep transhuman space experience. 
Just finished. I enjoyed so much!
A big applause.

I preordered the game but I couldn't download it. I had to cancel the preorder and
buy it at full price. lol :(   I guess it was only 5 dollars

review_title: I hope I am not spoiled forever
one_reviews_text: Based on recommendations this was the first game I played on my new Oculus Rift. It is simply amazing. I can not imagine a better VR experience. This is so intuitive.

So, I can confirm that this is probably the first PROPER game for VR - They've nailed everything - Locomotion, story, physics - The way to make a good VR game is to make a good game in the first place. VR should enhance the experience, not make up for a bad game. Lone Echo is 100% best VR experience I've had so far, even better than robo recall, and that was brilliant. Worth the price, go for it! One tip - Play it in 1-2 hour chunks over the course of a week, you'll enjoy it much more that way! :)
If you pre-ordered you can't DL it for some reason. I had to cancel pre-order and buy it agian. Now it downloads.

And gives the feel of immersion, so much so, when the element of terror comes in (yea, they didn't write it in the description), I was pale as a ghost. Great game, but I wish it was just at doing missions istead of (no spoilers hex!) doing... other stuff <- makes sense :)
This game rating - 7 1/2
This is my opinion so to see if you like it, pay 30$ 

Easy

i love the atmosphere in this game, and how well its put together.  but there is no action.  its mostly a puzzle/adventure game.  this game would be perfect if it added some more horror and enemies to fight.  think dead space

Cant find the words for this: it is sooooooo amazing!! beautiful!!! polished!!!! smooth!!! interressting!!!! coool!!! it has no bugs!!!! I LOVE IT!!!! Give us more of such good games!!!! where are all the other devs??? thank you Ready At Dawn!!! thank you!!!

This far one of the best VR experiences yet. Definitely 5 stars for the content but bugs that crashes the game or leaves you stuck ruins the experience and immersion totally. On normal games I wouldn't mind it too much but especially getting teleported into some buggy tight space is highly uncomfortable.
This is a really cool VR experience. The last part of the game is a little boring though, and the ending somewhat lacking.

Was worried I wouln't like this seeing as same people said the game play was repetative. I absolutley did not find that the case. Different tasks always felt fresh and they switched it up often. These reasons however are not why I'm writing this review. I'm writing this because I powered through probably an 8 hour play through in two days and have been halfway conviced that this way my true reality. Totally immersive and awesome story with engaging gameplay. A nice breath of fresh air after playing tons of fast pace game which I have to put down after 20 min to wipe the sweat off my face. Love where they went with this game and loved playing it. 5 Stars.

Running this on a 1080ti "all" settings maxed and getting 90 fps pretty much everywhere I have been so far. What a gorgeous thing is Lone Echo. Really enjoying the gameplay and movement system. This is the new first one I show others when letting them try VR for the first time. I don't understand people who don't read and meet the minimum spec complaining about running this.

Wonderful game, worth every penny. The movement is intuitive and enjoyable, the characters have real depth and pull you into the story, the graphics are phenomenal and had me pulling in close to enjoy more of the world around me. My first time in space I purposely pushed off from the station and floated into the abyss just to see if I could. Eventually I landed on a distant space rock and even that looked amazing up close. The view from the ring looking back at the space station, etc. was breathtaking. Absolutely a 5 star experience.

You may want to get another sensor to play this, otherwise you could find yourself stuck.  Two sensors just don't seem to be good enough.  I got to a point where I was unable to turn around due to lack of tracking capability.  Otherwise, it's pretty cool so far, I feel like I'm in space.. as a robot :)

Best VR title to date! The graphics and narrative are phenomenal. A completely captivating storyline that made for an edge of my seat experience. Not a single complaint on this one. Big congrats to the developers! This game is worth the money and they deserve every penny. Outstanding job!
This is one of the best titles so far, up there with Arizona Sunshine in terms of story/immersion.
Sincerely amazing to playthrough this story mode and then the multi-player game is fun and a workout!
A must buy.

review_title: Every Oculus owner needs to buy it
one_reviews_text:
When I first tried the Echo Arena beta, and exited the game, I immediately hit the pre-order button, because it was the most natural VR experience I ever had. The movement is fantastic, and combined with the fact, that your whole body is visible makes this game the No.1 VR experience.
Now, the preordered game just downloaded, and after 2 hours of gaming I can only encourage everyone to support these developers and buy this game, as this is a must for everyone who is in love with VR games. 5/5!!

Finished this game in one whole weekend, this game isn't short, I went on a playing stree of five hours each day, the game lasted 10 hours for me!

It's absoloutely amazing, it gets you so involved and it actually feels like you're there!

This game the best vr game to date. The locomotion, the story, the interaction and just the setting in space is phenomenal. If you haven't already bought it, i suggest you to do so. Well worth the price.

Played 4.5 hours in my first session with it. The game is mesmerizing. I am very prone to motion sickness and can't believe I was not affected by this game. The developers have done something very clever here to make it comfortable (probably having pitch/yaw default to off helped a ton).

review_title: Truly one of the best games on VR
one_reviews_text: Totally enjoyed playing this story for 11 hours. Incredibly immersive (hey, you are floating in an orbit!) and a flashing story. If you like sci-fi then it is a MUST!

First stop reading this and buy the game.

The night after finishing the game - I had a dream that I was floating through space.  This game is amazing.  They have created one of the best movement systems in a vr game.  The graphics are simply breath taking.  This game is what I wanted Adrift to be.  This is like playing a block buster sci-fy movie and being one of the actors.  

This is the best VR experence I have had so far.  I hope they make a sequal.  There is one bad thing about the game though - The ending is abrupt.  Its not a bad ending but it feels slightly unfinished.   Do your part and but this!  I want to see Lone Echo 2!!!!!!!

great graphics, absolutly amazing movement and controls. everything feels so natural, its almost scary.  you kinda completly forget you are palying a VR game.
story whise you feel instantly connected with liv. if i should name one thing i didnt like, it would be the ending which was rather sudden. i thought my game crashed ;)

The graphics and performance optimizations are impressive, and the dialogue between Liv and Echo-1 almost makes you feel like part of a science fiction novel. The movement system couldn't be more perfect for VR, and during the EVA portions, with Saturn in the backdrop, there were moments I just had to sit back shake my head in awe. Hearing other reviews disparage the ending, I was worried about that before playing the game. But now, as far as I could tell, nothing was lacking. You'd better grab this game.

I mean how bad can it be if it has dinosaur toys on the console named "Alan", "Gina", "Nate"
Enviroment,mechanics,story,pacing and voice acting are superb.

This game engaged me more than any other game VR or not. 
It elicited some instinctual behaviours in me. I didn't even know a game could do that.

VR games are all about escapism and this provides that full on experience.  You will feel like a helper in a space station filled to the brim with a lot of small details and interactive spaces.  Excellent dialog interface too.  Main downside is I have a small space for VR and the use of hands to navigate through the environment does get me turned around a lot.  A third sensor I think is ideal but even if I did have one I do think you could get tangled up with the helmet cord.  Beyond that though this is about as advanced as it gets.  Hope it becomes a series and we see more games like this.
Absolute must buy - fantastic!!
This game demonstrates the full potential of the current VR technology

review_title: The new gold standard in VR
one_reviews_text: RAD/OS has made the first proper AAA game. In my opinion, every other game going forward will be measured by Echo's quality of presentation, locomotion and experience. Hands down the best VR game I have played to date (Both Arena & Lone).
Best story, good movement system, beautiful graphics.

A real landmark game for VR.  From the finely tuned execution of controls, visuals, scale and narrative, one is wrapped up in a game of high drama and intrigue. A certain classic that will be looked back on in years to come as among the first to start the new age of VR gaming.
I've tried alot of the new VR games but this is hands down the best I've played. Great movement system and the game really pulls you in. I can not recomend this game enough to anyone with an oculus
This is the first full fledged game for VR and it is amazing. THAT is why I bought the rift!

review_title: OMG this game is a must!!
one_reviews_text: When the game started I was like okay probably the whole game will be like fixing stuff on the station going around in circles. I was very wrong in fact i was so wrong this game is my second favourite now (first is Solus Project) in this category. Great work worth every cent. The only reason I dont want to go into details becouse I don't want to spoil anything see it yourself :)
No motion sickness and the visuals are stunning; however, this is more of a space/zero-gravity sim than a game. It essentially feels like a blue collar maintenence job--in space
One of the best games I've ever played. This game is short but what you get from it is excelent. The story is very compelling and the mechanics are the best  I have experienced in VR.
This game is so immensive. After playing i kept grabbing on walls trying to walk through my house lol. Best VR experience I have had

review_title: Next step in evolution of VR games
one_reviews_text: The 1st VR game I have no complains about: intuitive controls, amazing visuals, proper story, interesting gameplay mechanichs that would've not worked outside VR. Must have for all Rift owners
Wow, incredible!! Immersive, very immersive, it's just amazing, beautiful graphics, nice voice acting, you really feel it!  WELL DONE!!!!

I will start off with this review by not talking about the game directly, but comparing it to other games. The first thing I can think to say is that the production value of Lone Echo is insane. The only game that came close to it is Robo Recall. The difference between the two is that LE actual has a story which is very enjoyable unlike RR, which is just constant shooting of things. That being said they are both great games. What is fantastic about LE is that it is a full on AAA title. The problem we've had up until this point in the history of VR games is there was nothing that truly felt like a game you can play on a 2D screen. There have been fun games, don't get me wrong, such as Job Simulator but they have all been fairly experimental, for the most part short, experiences. Now, lets get onto specifics. I'm going to start by talking about the most important part, gameplay. This game is filled with content. The story up to the part I have played, is excellent. It  is said to be about 4 hours long, but I'm already about 2 hours in and have barely scratched the surface due to all the things to see and play with, and some difficult puzzles. Some parts of it might be a bit tough to figure out at first and I think because of that it will easily make it last 6+ hours. In regards to the way the story works, its great. You are a robot who is helping out your captain, and the interations between them is perfectly done, It makes you feel like your character and the captain have known each other for years. As I said, some of the tasks are a bit difficult and it might take you some time to complete, but once you have you feel proud of yourself for having done it.
As for the actual gameplay and experience, you will need a beast of a computer. I have it on low settings just to get a playable framerate. I personally have 32 GB of ram which helps, but I'm mainly limited to my graphics card not being that powerful. That being said, even on low settings the game looks great!

The best VR experience so far. Graphics are top notch (i5 4670k, gtx 1070, resolution 1.5 runs smooth), atmosphere is amazing, good story, characters are "alive", controls are soo natural with the touch controllers, zero motion sickness issue (i'am very sensitive), so far no major bugs. I say it is a must for all VR gamer. TY Oculus

Unique gameplay experience, flawlessly excuted with a great story.  Best VR experience I have had so far.  The game machanics could only exist in VR.  I feel like I have stepped into the future and it is a bright one.  Thank you!

review_title: An amazing experience, marred by issues
one_reviews_text:
The game is fantastic. They really nailed the movement issues VR tends to have. Teleporting is a cheap mechanic done in other games that, while it works, does disrupt the flow and just doesn't feel real. What's the point of VR if it doesn't make you forget that you're not a robot floating around in a mining facility around Saturn?

I've enjoyed every bit of what I could play. There's some serious technical glitches that as of this review haven't been resolved. Everything was super smooth up until I had to go outside, and then (like many others are experiencing), there's a significant performance drop.
Developers...if the game you are presently working on doesn't come up to this standard, then I'd scrap whatever you are working on and start again.

If you only have two sensors this game does not work well. You need to face away from the front facing sensors much in the game as this will cause intermittent operation of hand  and all movements. It also crashes to desktop. Using Echo Arena does not crash.
Other than this it's awesome. 3 stars becuase of the issues.  Description should state three sensors needed for movement.
An actual full game in VR

The singleplayer storyline alone was worth it. I just finished it in a dozen or so hours. Just wow, is all I can say. Most immersive VR experience I've had so far. Good storytelling and great environment. I felt actually there, controls became second nature. Almost made me cry and it made me feel protective at times, worried for Liv. And after finishing all that, there's still the Multiplayer to check out. Which I heard is 'where it's at'.

review_title: Could not stand the movement system
one_reviews_text: I know everyone raves about this game, but I just hated the way you move around. It made me feel dizzy, and it was also frustrating. Try out the free Arena first before you buy it.
This is a must buy!
The is by far the best VR game I have ever tried. A total VR experience. Other games could learn from this.
No subtitles.
this is probably the best game that I played in my lifetime. No jokes if you really get into the story it soaks you in and you just cant stop playing.
Best in class experience floating and environment. Gameplay is a little tedious/repetitive/slow and therefore boring at times. Some of the puzzles are not clear. Overall worth buying though.

Update, game still won't launch through Oculus Library, support doesn't have a clue currently how to fix it, but got it to launch through it's own .EXE.  Beutiful game, best graphics since Robo Recall (about time), immersive sci-fi story with a degree of freedom in approaching missions, it's like a mega souped up version of the brilliant (and free) ISS Space Station simulator, intuitive controls, works flawless with Touch, worth while investment, just be wary of launch issues and bugs, which will hopefully get patched out soon.

It's short, but very satisfying. Want to feel what it's like to work on a space station, and fling yourself around the exterior of a space station with a gorgeous view of Saturn? Extra points for an emotionally engaging ending. 100% recommend, if any of the above sounds good to you.
It's really impressive and immersive. We want more games like that.

Not sure what to say that other people havent already said.
This game is THAT good!  the most real and the most captivated ive felt in VR yet.
 buy it!

Finshed the game, definitely going to be playing a second time through just to explore the Lore around it. Honestly the best VR game ive played, no other experience like it, cant fault its mechanics, gameplay and story :)
This has to be one of the best VR games I have ever played.

this was a bit slow at first then it pulled me in. gameplay was great, voices, visuals all amazing! but dam that story was good, at least for me i like spacey stuff. worth the buy for the solo experience alone!

This was a pretty amazing experience, especially if you use a chair and try not touching the floor with your feet.  The sense of weightlessness in space, combined with a solid narrative and incredible graphics provide a level of immersion that is unmatched.  This is a game that truely wouldn't be possible in the same way without VR and hand presence.  The movement system is immediately intuitive, and the inverse kinemetics on display are incredible.  The game clocks in at about 6 hours, and it only follows a single narrative (a good narrative, but with no real branching).  Having said that, I thoroughly enjoyed the game.  If a sequel is made, I'd love to see a branching storyline and more ways to form relationships, and a little more action and variety in terms of organisms that you experience.  Overall, though, this game should not be missed.

It's a part free roam, part narrative driven story in combination with the epic graphics, physics and mechanics make this one of the most thrilling VR games I’ve ever played (and I’ve had VR for about 4 months now). I had a session on the game last night and only because I started to feel tired I come off to find four hours have past....
This game will blow your mind, but if you want a taster then Echo area can give you that, minus the exploration and story. 
Non of the photos, videos or gameplays do it justice, honestly.
I've had ZERO issues with the game as a few others with poor PC config's have reported. 
i7 16gig ram and 1070gtx

review_title: The new bar for VR game
one_reviews_text:
The game is a little short, but it's totally the best experience for VR.
*UPDATE* I think this worth to mention: This game also require a MONSTER PC to run it.
*UPDATE2* *Spoiler(sort of)* Dont bother try 999+ on the swear monkey, it can show four digit. Therefore unless you are targeting 9999 plus. --when you do, please tell me.

I can only review from a single player perspective at this time. This is one of the first VR games I feel was worthy of buying. Excelent graphicly and game play wise. The story drags you in and keeps you wanting to play all the way though.

This is a fantastic looking game with some great controls. However, if you're expecting an action game this isn't one. The story feels a little bit slow and most of the stuff the game has you do isn't all that exciting,  especially in the first half.  I also had one bug that prevented me from progressing but loading an old save fixed it. 

I haven't played the multiplayer since the beta but unless they've made big changes since then it's super fun.

I've got about 2.5 hours in it now, and I'm really impressed.  I'd say best VR game I've played so far. The pace  and intensity picks up as you put more time in.  This game gives us hints of VR's real potential.  But be warned, it plays like a late stage Beta. Lots of little bugs here and there, lots of intersecting geometry which totally takes you out of the realism of the game.  Still, it's totally worth the $$$.  Kind of game you wish you could stay in longer than an hour (my comfort limit with the Rift).
Like being in one of your favorite sci-fi movies. Just amazing.

This game is the best VR experience you can get currently. Amazing Visuals, Controls & Story that brings you into the experience of what it's like to live and work in space. This is a MUST buy for any Oculus Rift User.
A superior piece of art and one of the most exceptional sci fi games of all time.

review_title: Good Game but why only in English?!
one_reviews_text: Lone Echo is a good game but why is it only in English. German or other languages subtitles at least!!!

This game nails what a VR should be. Lone Echo will also be a better game in the future as the technology for the headsets and tracking improve (I kept running into tracking problem with the two sensor setup - which break immerision). The controls are pitch perfect and the performance are top notch. If you have a headset you must play this game.

To those people complaining that there is no subtitles or audio in any other language but English, Learn English and stop whining. It costs lots of money to get translators let alone voice actors in other languages. Stop badmouthing the developer's hard work and praise them for a Stellar Product that gives you a reason to play Oculus

Lone Echo is a game of two halves (Echo Arena aside) . The first half is an outstanding - well written and voiced, and laden with a fantastic amount of detail which instantly sells you on the believability of the game world.

The second half has some good moments, horrifically carved up by the tedious process of getting from one place to the next in an uninteresting and repetitive environment.
