It lacks all the detail found in the first half, seemingly to try and keep you in suspense about the origin of what you've found - which turned out to pretty much be my first guess of what it was, as it's such a hackneyed sci-fi trope.

There are (when I played it and despite one patch) some bothersome technical issues. Obvious slowdowns when transitioning between areas, and the odd framerate issue that just seemed out of place were mildly annoying, though I didn't get entire crashes that some people reported.

Saying all that, the first half of the game is so good, it's worth the money (and there' Echo Area to jump into as well for those that are bothered about multiplayer Frisbee). The lack of pacing and detail in the second half turns what should be an essential masterpiece into "merely" an excellent title. Game of the year? No - but it could have been.
A great game, love the graphics and the detail put into the locations.  It would be nice to have a bit more variety of danger, rather than the same avoidance mechanic over and over.
Must have VR game and the new reference for the Virtual Reality. Outstanding Graphics, Story and movement. Would buy it definitly again.

Nice graphics and story but just to warn people:
1. Nausea.
2. Totally unplayable if you only have 2 sensors.

review_title: Awesome game!!  This is a MUST HAVE!
one_reviews_text:
As with majority of the rest of the reviews, I agree with everything they've said.  I pre-ordered (and patiently waited to receive my confirmation email then downloaded properly with no issue) and I don't regret it.  I rarely pre-order games but this was a must after playing the free weekends of Arena.  I think that strategy paid off, marketing team.  Well done.

My *only* concern was the ending.  No spoilers, but...  While the story was totally engaging throughout, and the voice acting top-notch, I felt the end was abrupt/rushed.  I like how the story itself ended, I just felt it could've extrapolated a few more touching moments and dialogue to tie everything together.  It was almost like - ok, we're here - roll credits.

Other than that - amazing game, BUY IT NOW!

Granted I'm only in the beginning stages of the game, but I can't stop playing!  The movement mechanics are awesome and how every VR game should be.  I noticed a few glitches like your arms being able to move through the floor sometimes, but I guess it can't be perfect.  I would highly recommend this game.

This is the definitive VR experience thus far and it's why we are early adopters. The level of immersion is absolutely mind-blowing. The game runs very well at mid/high settings on my  I7 and overclocked 970GT. The attention to detail is stunning with superior voice acting and graphics. The size and scale of the space station, satelites, and mining facilities is phenominal; you literally feel that you are among the Rings of Saturn with the stunning planet in the background. The length of game is dependent on how you play it; for my purposes, the gameworld and experience is so stunning, I've played 8 hours and barely touched the main missions. I spent an hour or two floating around a satelitte and soon found it was an optional mission to repair it. It is also very rewarding and mellow, just floating around and exploring. Ready at Dawn are to be commended for the quintessential VR immersive experience. There is so much potential in this type of setting and locomotion. I find myself dreaming of a Halo type game where you are master chief in weightless enviroment and can go guns blazing. so too multiplayer shooter. the possibilities of VR are endless, it's clear why Valve and Facebook are all in. Skeptics lack vision. Give them two hours with Lone Echo and they will see!

Easily the best game in my Library out of 20+ games.  Fantastic work on developing Liv.  All of her movements keep you immersed, which is the best of any VR game that I have played.  The ability to interact with another every object in every setting is how VR games should be designed.  If you are on the fence about buying this game, I strongly recommend it!

review_title: My First Steps in the VR Gaming World..
one_reviews_text: This is the first game ive brought for my Oculus Rift and i was blown away by it ..
Great experience, very smooth, great storyline.
are you serious ?

I was blown away by the female NPC's facial animations and interactions. Overall it was a awesome time, the only thing I would wish in a sequel would be some cool enemies to actually shoot, maybe even a few zero gravity "boss" battles, and perhaps even another more realistic NPC or two to run into, less "scavenger hunt" puzzles. Overall 5 stars for me though, very polished and well done!

Lone Echo is the most satisfying VR game I've played to date. From a technical perspective, the graphics, interface, and movement systems are all very well done. However, it is the story that won me over. The plot is engaging, the characters are well-acted and likeable, and the tension builds to a satisfying conclusion. 

Please support the developers by buying this game. You won't regret it, they deserve it, and I want them to make more games like this.
Best VR game so far. Just 4 stars only because some of the puzzles and contraptions aren't as clear as they could be or demand a certain order to be completed.

review_title: You get to be a wobot.
one_reviews_text: Never had a hiccup with the game, story is great, just a touch short feeling, but I seamlessly went from sitting to standing and was able to finish the game in two long sessions without any issues! And you get to be a wobot, so who doesn't want to do that.

well LoneEcho is just amazing - and i rly hope there comes more stuff like this!
negative : it ended - feelsbadman

and it is playable with 2 sensors when u do it right i had no problems with 2 sensors

I'm about an hour into Lone Echo.  This is an incredible experience.  I'm running an i5 4670k with GTX980.  Settings default to medium and it looks stunning.  I can't imagine what taking it up to ultra would bring.  It's smooth and detailed.  The movement is polished and feels natural and right.  The immersion is benchmark for VR.  The integration of menus and gameplay into the hands and environment takes you away and you forget you are in a game.  This is truly an accomplishment.  Fantastic work developer.  40$ well spent.  So far this is probably the greatest VR experience to date.  I'm already sad that it will end.

Just completed Lone Echo and it was a really wonderful experience.  The story, characters and voice acting made it so worthwhile.  Some of the best I've seen.  In VR the animations and interactions were just incredible!  I don't think I've cared for an npc character more than this one.  A few moments in the game I was so sucked in that I got chills when certain events happened.  For those wondering about length I clocked in just under 6 hours and it worth every penny.

review_title: A 5 star game with a few temporary bugs
one_reviews_text:
This is absolutely a 5 star virtual reality game; and precisely what the community & industry needed.

The environments are extremely detailed and offer a lot of freedom, the story and voice acting is top tier and the game-play was challenging enough on my first play-through to keep me engaged and not become bored. It's pretty rare for me to finish a game and pretty rare that I feel this satisfied from a VR title. I will definitely be playing the story through again.
The locomotion system is ingenious and felt natural throughout the entire story. You can sit down and play from your office or the couch, but the game does shine when you have a moderate standing play area with 360 tracking.
Unfortunately for me, I did have quite a few crashes (version 3.89) in airlocks and high action scenes which was extremely jarring and somewhat broke the experience. After speaking with RAD developers on Discord it appears that they are aware and are working the problems. I was able to improve my experience by reducing texture detail to the lowest setting while still leaving everything else on high.
Overall a highly recommended purchase for anyone with a VR headset.

review_title: Live and breathe SciFi like never before
one_reviews_text: After having played in the Echo Arena beta weekends, I knew what to expect from the game in terms of locomotion and overall look and feel: an impressively well polished gameplay system better than anything I had played till then. What I hoped for, however, was a genuine story that finally could show the potential that VR really has in delivering a truly unique experience. To say that it delivered would be an understatement. Well done and thank you.

Yes, the graphics are beautiful, the gameplay is consistantly enjoyable, and the motion is fluid and graceful without causing sickness, but the joy of Lone Echo is the relationship between Capt. Olivia (Liv) and her AI assistant Jack (you). The human connection you form together - YOU form together, not the characters form with each other - is almost unmatched by any other relationship in gaming. This is on level with the Witcher 3 in terms of emotional investment and realistic dialogue. 

Another incredible aspect of Lone Echo is how you can shape Jack through your dialogue choices. Does he remain steadfastly adherent to protocol, save for in the most dire of circumstances, or does Liv's habit of risky improvisation rub off on him? Does he understand humor? Would he adhere to his stated purpose forever, or would he - if the moment was right - define a better one? It's entirely up to you.

Lone Echo is absolutely worth the money.

review_title: Amazing Game, although not for VR Noobs
one_reviews_text: I have to admit this my be my favorite VR game to date, and I have at least 40 of them. The immersion of this world is mind blowing. If I had picked up this game a year ago I wouldn't have been able to play it without getting sick. Nowadays I can play this game, cautiously and be just fine. I am not quite finished with this game, maybe I have played around 3 hours so far and it is a 5 out of 5.

review_title: I hope not a lone Echo!
one_reviews_text: You couldnt make this any better, the storyline is gripping the graphics are top notch with very good immersion! Also just a note that the controls are easy to learn! please continue with the story please... much appreciated! (Recommened must buy VR game)

One of my favourite VR games yet - if you enjoy 'the expanse' or 'battlestar galactica' I'm sure you'll love the plot and gameplay.
Its interesting to compare this to robo recall - its every bit as beautiful, and probably equally fun, only this time you are the robot and you actually care deeply for your human companion. No teleportation in sight, either!

Been looking for an Experience like this for a while now and finally there is a game studio able to deliver a complete, polished game with deep immersion, a good plot, great graphics and a playtime that can be counted as a 'complete game'. Thank you Ready at Dawn and Oculus for this.
Yes, the Game is only english right now without subtiltles and this should be changed to get more people inside this brilliant story. I'm sure devs will deliver fast.
Please give us more of this quality games - oculus do your best to get devs to work. This is the stuff VR is made for.
Would pay again the same amount for a sequel. Would like to see how Liv and Jack are doing in the future's future :)
Great. Thanks.

Interesting story, but kinda simple. Moving in zero gravity works great, I WAS on this space station :) It's a lot of fun. About cons...There could be more variety in gameplay mechanics. Game had some minor bugs (scripts not loading, voice overlaps, physics, few crashes).

I really enjoyed this experience, but I feel that with some minor tweaks to story and gameplay it could be best GAME of the decade.
Currently the best game there is at this moment! You have to try it out to believe it because it's amazing!

Figured motion sickness would get me on this game I do suffer quite a bit from it.Thought I would give myself 10 minutes of play time and jump out to recover.Played 10 minutes of the game then removed my headset to find I had been in the game for almost 2 hours lol.

Only just started this, but I already feel like I have my money's worth.  Decent graphics, good storyline, and awesome movement controls.  I can't wait until next weekend when I'll have a chance to play through the game!

It's great. This is what AAA VR titles should be like. Mechanics aren't insulting or forced. All natural. The zero G movement is smooth and does not cause motion sickness. I'd recommend playing sitting down to help with this. Plays well, very well optimized. Can't wait to get more into it. About 2hrs in so far.

This game is it. If you truly want to be blown away buy it, support these developers. 

In terms of gameplay you'll get around 5-6 hours, depending on your speed. That's not much, true. But the quality is worth every penny. 

Graphics are top notch (my 1080ti is around 100% all the time). Sound is impressive (especially when you leave the station with all the machines and have total serenity in space), models are real life like. Atmosphere is beyond anything I've seen so far.

There are some fetch and repair quests, I like that. It's predictable and you can just relax and take in the atmosphere while doing them. And then you have chaotic situations where you have to act fast.

Could be longer but 5 stars are well deserved here nonetheless. Outstanding.

There is nothing much i can add to what everyone has already written here.
One important note though,If you want more of these amazing experiences please buy the game at full price and support the developer.This game is truly the work of a dedicated passionate team that needs to be compensated for pushing the boundries of whats possible with vr.

[played with room scale setup] The story is simple but the connection between Jack and Olivia carried the whole thing without problems, the game looks and feels great. 
It contains some puzzles but overall they felt to easy to solve, but that may is not the point of the game, the importent thing is the experience - and it was a great one, so -  I recommend the game!

btw. I played with 8GB of RAM and encountered performance problems in large areas (first exit through a air lock for example). I've seen that my RAM was at 7,9GB of 8GB at this time, so I would recommended to play the game with > 8GB to have the best experience (as Oculus stated above)

Had pretty high expectations for this game. About an hour or so in, it's most definitely meeting them. Story is stronger than any game I've played in VR. Graphics are awesome. Locomotion system is the best I've used in VR. Can't wait to finish this off. Must buy.

review_title: I mean, great game when it works
one_reviews_text: HMD freezes, crashes to desktop with Windows saying low on memory, and there is ZERO representation from these devs anywhere. There was a patch yesterday but no change log. Does it fix the crashing? Who knows! This game is pretty much the difinitive VR game atm but some people are having issues, myself being one. I will readdress this review at a later time but as of now I give it 3 stars and that's generous.
One of the best games I have ever played. Very nice story line, touch controls are awesome, interesting task to do. The moment when you first leave the ship and drift into space is incredible!
Arguably the best VR-game on the market. A true system-seller.

Hands down the best VR game out there. The unique locomotion (which is NOT nausea enducing in any capacity for me), dialogue, voice acting and story telling was aboslutely fantastic. The way the game had you interract with the world around you was perfect.
That's what VR is made for: an immersive gameplay experience!

This is the first complete AAA VR game ever! The graphics are stunning, the controls are fantastic, the voice acting is on point, the story is great and the play area is MASSIVE! No loading screens between any of the areas (interiors or exteriors). Just finished it after about 4 hours straight... SEQUEL NOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

review_title: One of the best buys in the Oculus store
one_reviews_text: Show this to show people the potential of VR storytelling. Very polished with high production values, a great story, and great characters. Some minor repetitive tedium later in the game (playing a very similar section, with an identical mechanic, like 4 times in a row) means the gameplay gets in the way of the game, but only a bit. Totally worth it. I hope to see people speed run this game since this is very dextrous and fine in its skillset.

review_title: The most awesome VR AAA game available!
one_reviews_text:
As i did wrote in the title, the sentence is right, i started on HTC Vive a long time a go and played some nice and inmersive games, but yesterday i was able to play Lone Echo with my new oculus device and touch controllers and this game feels perfect, every action is natural, and you move throught the space ship as you should be in 0 gravity. A game you can miss. Overall score 9

that's why i give a 4 of 5 stars.

one_reviews_text: I didn't find myself beihg grabbed by the first five minutes of gameplay. It's hard to do that with a game like this, but the more i've played the more i've enjoyed. Lots of grabby tactile stuff to do, an interesting environment to explore, a cool communication system, and i like the aesthetic.
One of my greatest gaming experiences in the last 27 years and i've played a LOT of greats like Ultima Underworld, Wing Commander or Witcher 3 all at release.
Okay... I would NOT have purchased this if it wasn't for the video made by Reality Check VR channel on YouTube.  Props to him for a great first look at the game.  Great game... Thanks!
Good game to play. Have played for 3+ hours now. Only limited motion sickness. Awsome story.
I'm a little sad that this is the first VR game I have played. I don't know how anyone else can top this...
Defintely one of the best VR games out there. Great visuals, controls, and puzzles. Worth the price!!
Great Game!!!!

Amazing detail, great graphics, perfected controls, interesting world and story. You're doing yourself a disservice by not getting this.

Edit: Added my specs: GTX 1080, i7, 16gb ram, CV1 with touch and *3 sensors* (360 tracking highly recommended)

I'm not normally into exploration games, but the way this game was made just made it so enjoyable. If you are not into that and want fast paced only stay away from this one. Otherwise, it's a must have! I'm playing on Vive (through ReVive) and it plays amazing!
First VR game that knocked me off my feet. Amazing gameplay, amazing graphics, engaging story. I'm not ready to say goodbye, I want a sequel!

Incredible experience.  The zero-gravity controls should immediately become some kind of industry standard.  Thank goodness we also have Echo Arena - learning how to fly through the space is well worth your time.

1 Rift summer special
2 Lone Echo

Great game but seems to be a little buggy still, several times I've gotten stuck where the AI won't open the door to the next area for whatever reason.

THE BEST

Truely one of the most engaging experiences I've ever had in VR so far. On top of that, the story and environments are something so captivating- I haven't quite been this enthralled with something since Super Metroid.
If you like space and immersion. Then you will love it. Finally a game with a story , looks stunning and really shows what VR can do. Cant wait till more games like this come for VR. JUST WOW

the end is little bit weak to me, I was shocked that this is the ending. I thougnt the ending would be more solid and more strong. However, I still like this game!
If the next game would have Chinese, that will be way more better!

review_title: No nausea and brilliant in itself
one_reviews_text: I puke at every occasion in VR, but I can play this game for hours without any complications. ;) I can't play Lucky's Tale for the above reason.  This is not the format to write about it's brilliance. RoadToVR.com has an article about it, if you want to know more.

I cannot compare this to another game on my Oculus/Steam library.  Without a question, this is the next stage of where VR should be going!  Great story line puzzler, that doesn't feel like a puzzler as much as it feels like intuitive exploring.  10/10 recommend

Anyone else get motion sick playing this game. feels so real

The good things are that you can actually see your arms instead of hands only. A really big thing for me, on top of that you get to see your body and legs once in a while which is a great bonus.

(for those whining weakasses:) You won't get sick in here(!) and it has no horror or scary parts. Just enough awe and excitement left though. Making it perfect for the whole family to enjoy this game.

WOW. This game is why I bought a Rift. Really immersive experience, with great voice acting and animation, and lots to do. Controls are very cleverly thought out and work very well. 5 stars !

Just played about an hour and a half and the story is keeping me captivated so far.  The VR is amazing and the graphics are great.  Totally blown away so far!
This game is soo good! If you want to see the future of gaming just get this game.

review_title: Buy it! Play it! Love it!

VR as it meant to be!
Not a single shot was fired and it was a far more intense, fun and compelling experience than most AAAs from the last years!

Best VR game 2017 so far. Buy and play (or better feel) a real sf action adventure with the best movement solution in VR to date.

I enjoyed it. I think it was worth my $39.99. I used a 970 GTX so I did stutter quite a bit on settings low, but it was playable enough since I'm not sensitive to nausea in VR since low frames can cause that.

Anyways, it really reminded me of a Telltale game in the sense that you can say things that change responses, but in the end the story will be the same.

It starts off pretty cool since you're legit on a space station and it feels weird. It then gets kind of boring as you go around the space station doing chores. Afterwards, things get a little more interesting. However, there are not really puzzles. It is mainly pressing buttons or searching around for batteries. This isn't really a bad thing, but it's basically filler. However, in the sense of the narrative it makes sense as you repair or change the way stuff is working.

These more boring bits reminded me a bit of games like Job Simulator, where the tasks aren't that interesting and feel a bit like work. However, I know a lot of people like Job Simulator so it might be up your alley.

The real part of where it shines is the graphics (I assume, since I have a 970 and it's all at low to be playable) as well as the character development is pretty cool. I like the robot you are and I like the other characters and AIs. It really feels like you are in a movie...

I find the simple platformer something that is relevant since in certain segments you have to be quite precise with your boosts and grabs otherwise you have to start over. Those spots I didn't mind since it made me feel pressure to avoid them and more like a real game.

I'm usually not a guy who likes space games, but this really was super immersive. TLDR ----- The game is basically an adventure experience as if you are in a sci-fi movie yourself. It is very immersive, with characters, mo-cap, environments, graphics, but shallow on gameplay elements. However, it is still a great VR experience.
